loans.name: Rofina

texts.en:
Rofina, who is in her late 40s, is married with three kids who are still in school. She has been running a retail shop as well as raising livestock, e.g., poultry, for ten years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rofina’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her retail stock and start the poultry business. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group. Rofina will use the profit to pay for school fees, household expenses and loan repayment, and to buy a plot of land. She will also reinvest in the business. She will use the loan to buy fast-moving items like sugar, beans, peaches, rice, salt, etc., and to buy chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming an international business.

Rofina will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan's scheduled period.

loans.use: to buy fast-moving items like sugar, beans, peaches, rice, salt, etc., and to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi is managing her own beauty parlor. She does manicures/pedicures and different hair treatments. During the first year of business operation, she noticed that her daily earnings were not sufficient enough. However, Heidi was introduced to CCT and became one of the beneficiaries of the microfinancing program. She is also thankful that there are people who are willing to help new entrepreneurs like her.

Her previous loan worth PHP 25,000 was granted and made a vast impact on the business. After receiving the loan, she immediately bought hair treatments and other needed materials for her parlor. Now she is able to earn to approximately PHP 15,000 every month. As time goes by, the demand of the business continues to increase. Heidi needs to buy boxes of hair treatments and other supplies to cater to more customers. This is why she is applying again for a loan, this time amounting to PHP 45,000. Once again, she is hoping that you will consider her story.

Heidi wants to have a bigger parlor someday that offers a variety of hair treatments and various beauty and wellness services. She believes that your help will make her business move forward. If ever granted, she will put some of the money to her savings account so she will have available emergency funds as well.

On a weekly basis, Heidi regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience on the business, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells track suits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances to expand her business. She will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy more stock of track suits. She hopes that in the future she will have increased sales. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy  more stock of track suits

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, one of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) partners, was granted a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 and faithfully used it to improve her variety store. She is grateful, for the loan has helped her a lot to stock needed grocery items for the business.

Anita aims to have a one-stop shop someday that will provide all of the items needed by the consumers. Hence, she is contemplating ways of how to attract buyers. Turning her variety store into a grocery store is one of her goals. Since it is her bread and butter, Anita exerts her effort and hard work for the business. Added capital and revolving funds will help her business to flourish. With this, Anita decided to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy additional products for the variety store such as bottled drinks, grocery items, school supplies and other products.

Anita is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. There she gains spiritual strength for members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Managing a business demands a lot of patient and perseverance. This is Virgincita's point of view as an entrepreneur. She is one of the members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and manages a direct-selling business at present. Buying and selling personal products and merchandise does not need high capital to start. You just need to have passion and dedication to be successful. Virgincita is thankful to God as CCT was able to grant her previous loan amounting to PHP 8,000. She bought items pre-ordered by customers using her revolving capital and the additional financial assistance extended to her.

Virginia is grateful for becoming involved in this kind of venture. This serves as an additional source of income for her family's daily needs and sustenance. She works hard to make the business flourish. This year, Virgincita wants to apply for another loan of PHP 8,000 to have additional products to put on her display cabinet. Availability of the products should be considered in this type of business so that customers will not wait for weeks just to avail them. Virgincita is anticipating that her request will be granted since this will be a big help for the business.

Virgincita has been consistent in attending the CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This has made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: To pay for beauty products and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo es comerciante de frutas y verduras, tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando. 

Ana, desde hace 8 años tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, anteriormente trabajaba en una ferretería y tuvo que dejar de trabajar ahí para estar más pendiente de sus hijos; su esposo  le ayuda a vender cuando termina su jornada de trabajo, el horario de atención en la tienda en todos los días de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, aceites, pastas, jabones, bebidas y golosinas.- Anteriormente, se le otorgó un préstamo para impulsar su negocio para que fuera creciendo y lo cancelo responsablemente. 

Los sueños para su familia es ver crecer a sus hijos y que sigan estudiando hasta que sean profesionales y que su negocio sea más grande.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old and studied up to high school. She is married and her husband sells fruits and vegetables. They have four children who are in school.

For the past eight years, Ana has run a small store out of her house. Before that she worked at a hardware store but she had to stop to take care of her children. Her husband helps her sell when he gets off work. The store is open every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

Ana needs the loan so that she can buy staple goods such as basic grains, oils, pasta, soap, drinks and snacks. Previously, she got a loan to help her business grow and she paid it off responsibly.

Her dreams for her family are to see her children grow and for them to continue with their studies until they become professionals. She also wants to see her business expand.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as basic grains, oils, pasta, soap, drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Portant la corde du bœuf en main sur la photo , Salia est âgé de 41 (quarante un) ans. Il vit avec sa femme ménagère et ses enfants  au village, l’âge de ses enfants  est compris entre 4 à 19 ans. Salia est l’emboucher de bœufs qui réside au Mali, il pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années. Salia s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Il s’endette auprès du RMCR pour acheter de bœufs pour son embouche. Après quelques mois d’entretien en nourriture et traitement, il revend ses bœufs dans les mêmes marchés locaux. Salia désire construire une belle maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Salia is the one holding the bull's cord in the photo.  He is 41 years old and lives with his wife, a homemaker, and his children in the village. His children range from 4o to 19 years of age. Salia is a cattle farmer from Mali. He has been in this business for some years. He stocks up at the nearby markets. 

Salia is taking out a loan from RMCR to buy cattle for fattening and resale. After taking care of cattle for several months, he resells them at the same local market. Salia's wish is to be able to build a nice house for his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло бизнес-леди. Она из района Рудаки. Шахло родилась и выросла в районе Рудаки. Ей 31 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Детишкам 15, 12 и 9 лет. Они живут вместе. Дети учатся в школе. Муж предоставляет услуги такси. У Шахло есть свой не большой бизнес. Она продает полотенца и одеяло. Шахло ходит по домам и по улицам, чтобы продавать товар. Она хочет перевозить женскую и мужскую осеннюю одежду на продажу. У нее мечта расширить деятельность, к сожалению, для перевоза одежды у нее нет денежных средств. И по этой причине Шахло обратилась за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать ее финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en: Shahlo is a business women. She was born and raised in the Rudaki region where she still resides. She is 31 years old, married, with three kids. Hew kids are 15,12, and 9 years old. They all live together, the children go to school. Shahlo's husband is a taxi driver. She herself had a small business selling towels and blankets. Shahlo sells her products door-to-door and on the streets. She also wants to start selling men's and women's autumn clothing. She is dreaming of expanding her business, but unfortunately she doesn't have enough money to transport the clothes, which is why she requested a loan. You can help Shahlo resolve her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to expand her business and transport clothes.

loans.name: Musenya

texts.en:
Musenya is 64 years old. She is married and has six children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is Musenya's fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of flour, sugar, rice, salt, detergents, bread, milk, etc. She will use the profits from her expanded business to open a green grocery stall. Her hope and dream is to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, sugar, rice, salt, detergents, bread, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a butchery, where she sells meat and also grilled beef. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances to expand the business.

Rukia will use this 38,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more goat meat. Her business goal is to be supplying meat to other butcheries within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business and educate her children.

This is Rukia's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a hotel [restaurant].

loans.use: to buy more goat meat.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking oil. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances to expand her business.

Everlyne will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking oil. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 48 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school.

Melisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melisa has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Melisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Carolina

texts.es:
Vilma, vive en casa propia la cual comparte con su esposo y una hija de un año de edad, ella le colabora a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, trabaja dando el servicio de cosmetóloga, también comercializa, calzado, bolsos y otros accesorios, desarrolla está actividad desde hace tres años, ofrece sus servicios a domicilio, el oficio lo aprendió gracias a su familia y su ventaja es que tiene una clientela que prefiere sus productos.
Con el financiamiento Vilma comprara calzado, prendas de vestir, una secadora y una plancha para el cabello, mejorara el equipo de trabajo y ofrecerá nueva mercadería a sus clientes, espera tener un negocio más competitivo para incrementar sus ventas e ingresos, su riesgo es que está expuesta de alguna manera a ser víctima de un asalto.
Sus sueños son tener una boutique y estudiar una carrera en la universidad para tener un mejor futuro junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in her own home that she shares with her husband and 1-year-old daughter.  She helps her husband out with the household expenses.  She makes a living offering cosmetology services as well as selling footwear, bags, and other accessories.  She has been developing her business for 3 years and she offers her services at home.  She learned this business from her family and her advantage is that she has built a clientele who prefers her products.  

Vilma will use the loan to buy footwear, clothing, a dryer, and a straightening iron for hair, as well as improve her work equipment and offer new merchandise to her customers.  She hopes that her business will be more competitive so that she can increase her sales and profits.  One risk that she has is that she is vulnerable to become a victim of assault.  

 Her dreams are to have a boutique and to get a university degree so that she can build a better future with her family.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothing, a dryer, and a straightening iron for hair, as well as improve her work equipment and offer new merchandise to her customers.

loans.name: Srey Group

texts.en:
Srey is a 44-year-old married rice farmer with two children, and she resides in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Two of her children work as factory workers. Srey is pictured first from the right and has cultivated rice since 1991. Her husband is a 51-year-old rice farmer as well. Together, they can earn approximately USD 9 per day.

Srey, a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of six members, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season. This loan will help her be able to increase her income as well as her family's standard of living.

In the future, Srey is going to save money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season.

loans.name: Cirela

texts.en:
Cirela is a hardworking mother and a loving wife. She and her husband are in farming activities for a longer period of time. She's making good harvest so that she is able to raise pigs for fattening.

She very recently asked PMPC for this amount to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins. She hopes that this new business venture of hers will prosper.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Solidarity - N06Tsơn2Psơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung is 38 years old, and she is married. She has had a service business of tailoring clothes for more than 10 years.

Dung lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines and material for making more clothes to sell.

In 2012, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Since then, she invested the capital she got from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to purchase machines and necessary inputs to expand her business. Dung has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of "Solidarity - N06TSơn2PSơn," which consists of three members.

Along with her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase machines and material for making more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 40 years old. He is married and has six children.

His business is making woodcarvings. He has been in this business for 23 years.

He earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenya shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy wood for making carvings.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to improve the family’s standard of living and also pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a stable family.

loans.use: to buy wood for making carvings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a Kiva borrower. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells vegetables. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to have a bigger store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de gobierno, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con ellos.

Ana, durante 20 años vendió verduras y frutas en el mercado de la ciudad, pero ahora ha decidido colocar una tienda de productos lácteos y granos básicos, porque consideró que le quedaban muchas más ganancias.

El préstamo solicitado será para ampliar la tienda y comprar más productos como crema, quesos, quesillo, requesón, etc. todo para obtener mejores ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Ella sueña con tener un mejor negocio y con sus ganancias darles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old and has studied through fourth grade. She is married, and her husband works as an employee in a government company. She has 6 children, of whom only two live with her.

Ana spent 20 years selling vegetables and fruit in the market in the city. Now, she has decided to start a dairy product and basic grains store, because she believe that this will give her much more income.

The loan requested will be used to grow the store and to buy more products, such as cream, cheese, tortillas with cream cheese filling, cottage cheese, etc. This will help her earn a better income and cover the household expenses.

She dreams of having a better business and, with her earnings, of giving her children university educations.

loans.use: to grow her store and buy more products, such as cream, cheese, tortillas with cream cheese filling, cottage cheese, etc.

loans.name: Fredy Arnulfo

texts.es: Fredy de 26 años de edad habita en vivienda familiar con su compañera de vida. Él se dedica a trabajar como albañil independiente en los alrededores de su localidad y de esa manera se gana la vida para llevar el sustento a su hogar, gracias a su experiencia, de 6 años cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos . Fredy desea construir un cerco alrededor de su vivienda para darle mayor protección es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir: en tela metálica, lámina, hierro y alambre para poder hacer la mejora a su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
Fredy is 26 years old and lives in his family's home with his wife. He is dedication to working as an independent construction worker in the outskirts of his area. In this way, he makes a living to bring sustenance to his home. Thanks to his 6 years of experience, he has many clients that request his work.

Fredy wants to build a fence around his home for more security. For this reason, he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, iron, and wire to make improvements to his house. In this way, he will improve his wife's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, iron, and wire to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has a business selling clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now. Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional clothes to sell.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la administración de un auto-lote, tienen tres hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Cecilia, se dedica a vender en un cafetín que tiene en el centro escolar de su comunidad, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 m.d.

El préstamo será utilizado para mejorar las instalaciones del cafetín y para comprar más productos para la venta. 

Ella desea seguir trabajando para obtener mejorar sus ingresos y poder ayudarle a sus hijos para que tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 33 years old and has earned a degree in school. She is married, and her husband manages a car lot. They have 3 children, who attend school.

Cecilia sells goods in her cafe, which is in the school area of her community. She works from Monday to Friday from 7:00am until noon.

The loan will be used to improve the facilities of the cafe and to buy more products to sell.

She wants to continue working to earn a better income and to be able to help her children have a good education.

loans.use: to improve the facilities in her cafe and to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.ru:
Равшаной 48 лет, она замужем и у нее имеется один ребенок. У нее среднее общее образование. У ее родителей  не было возможности оплатить обучение в университете. Денег,которые зарабатывает ее муж не хватает на обеспечении семьи. Она  помогает своему мужу, занимаясь продажей одежды на базаре. На данный момент они с мужем собирают деньги на образование своего ребенка. Хотят чтобы их ребенок получил высшее образование и не имел таких трудностей по жизни, которые было у них.  
Равшаной планирует получить кредит на установление пластиковых окон. Так как прошлая зима была очень холодной, они всей семьей очень часто болели и не имели возможность выходить на работу. Это очень повлияло на их финансовое состояние. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Равшаной надеется,что МДО Арванд выделит ей нужную сумму.Благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Ravshanoy is 48 years old, she is married, with a child. She has completed high school. Her parents didn't have the money to pay university tuition fees. Her husband's earnings are not enough to sustain their family. Ravshanoy tries to help her husband selling clothes at the local market. She and her husband want their son to get higher education to spare him such difficulties as they experienced. 

Ravshanoy requested a loan to install new windows. Last winter was so cold that all the family got ill very often and couldn't work. It affected their financial state. That's why Ravshanoy turned to MDO Avand for financial support. She is hoping that MDO Arvand will provide her with sufficient funds. She is grateful for your support and trust.

loans.use: to install new windows

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: 53 летный бизнесмен Муртазо. Он из района Зафарабад. Муртазо отец троих детей. Жена и дочери занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке. У него дружная и трудолюбивая семья. Муртазо тоже занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке. У нее имеется точка продаже. Муртазо продает ткани около 20 лет.  Он честный и ответственный человек. Муртазо обращается вежливо людьми. У него много клиентов и  бизнесом все идет хорошо. Но у него есть одна проблема, которая его каждый день мучает. Муртазо болеет, он страдает от болезни. Ему надо сделать операцию, чтобы лечить боль и сохранить жизнь. Муртазо по этой причине обратился к Вам за кредитом. У него жизнь впереди. Вы можете помочь Муртазо.
texts.en: 53-year-old Murtazo is a businessman from the district of Zafarobod. He is a father of three children. His wife and children are selling products in the local market. Murtazo too is involved in the local market trade. He has his own stall. He has been selling fabric for about 20 years. He is an honest and responsibile man. But he has one problem that keeps him worried every day, he is suffering from an illness. He needs a surgery to relieve pain and save his life. This is the reason Murtazo requested a loan. He has his life still in front of him. You can help Murtazo!

loans.use: to pay for the surgery and purchase prescription drugs.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials to build a better business premises. Her business goal is that she will have a big hotel within five years.

She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a better business premises.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma engages in farming. She grows and sells seaweed. She is married to a fisherman. They were blessed with three children. Her eldest child is 25 while the youngest is 11.

She is the one who sells her husband's catch like fish, crabs, and seashells. She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like straw, nylon and fishing net. These could improve the yield of her farm. With these, she could generate higher earnings and be able to do the necessary expansion. Slowly, she can roll-out her capital and start to save.

Wilma dreams of putting up a sari-sari (variety) store to have a sustainable source of income in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy materials like straw, nylon and fishing net.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is married and she is a businesswoman. She has a very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities a few years ago with her own working capital, and she makes her best of it. She is earning good money and she is taking this loan because she wants to open a big store. So she is requesting a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store including hand lotion, sardines, milk, cooking oils, biscuits, noodles, candles, salts, sugar, detergents, soft drinks and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy hand lotion, sardines, milk, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles, candles, salts, sugar, detergents, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is a 47-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte. She has two children ages 18 and 16 years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Meriam is engaged in a tailoring business. She has been doing this for 11 years to earn a living. In the future, she wishes to be  successful in her business and to have a stable livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy materials like cloth.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 42-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, buying and selling maize, groundnuts and coffee as his main source of income but does not have any extra income. He has been doing this business for the last 14 years to get an income, sustain his family and educate his children. He has a vision of buying a tipper lorry for collecting maize and produce in general from the farmers deep in the villages but his major challenge is the high transport costs that reduce his profits leading to less money for reinvestment.

He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 49-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with three adult children. Her husband works hard as a farmer and a coconut wine gatherer, while Julita earns a living by doing a hog-raising business. She has been doing this for almost seven years.

Aside from raising pigs, Julita and her husband are engaged in vegetable farming.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to renovate her piggery and to buy fertilizer for their vegetable farm. In the future, she wishes to improve their piggery and to increase the number of their piglets.

loans.use: to renovate her piggery and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en: Melitona is a businesswoman from Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old, married and has an expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Melitona is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Melitona continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old. She is married to Philip who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children between 12 and 6 years old, respectively.

She has had a dairy business for seven years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has borrowed KES 15,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan.

Agnes has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase animal feed and farm inputs. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, pay for medical care, expand her livestock and crop farming as her secondary business and repay her loan, too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established dairy business and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and farm inputs.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio is a married man. He has three children. He operates a farm where he grows cabbages and other vegetables. He has been involved in this business for four years.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs.

His business goal is to have more land for farming within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Athuman

texts.en:
Athuman is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of milk. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Kahunda

texts.en: Kahunda is a married woman. She has seven children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Benkedi Ii Group

texts.fr: Mamine Abou  est celle qui a Porté  la main sur le mouton, c’est  une femme âgée de 56 ans ; elle réside au mali.  elle est veuve et vit avec  ses 5 enfants, âgés de 16 à 30 ans tous cultivateurs de profession. Dans l’avenir elle veut acheter des bœufs de labour pour ses enfants afin qu’ils puissent augmenter leur capacité de production. Elle fait recourt à l’IMF pour financer ses petits activités qu’elle pra tique depuis une quinze ans Elle utilise le prêt pour acheter les animaux affaiblis (moutons et chèvres) pour les entretenir et les revendre . Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et vend ses produits dans les mêmes marchés  Elle est satisfaite de fait qu’elle arrive à aider ses enfants dans la prise en charge des dépenses de  famille
texts.en:
Abou, the woman with her hand on the sheep, is 56 years old; she lives in Mali. She is a widow and lives with her five children, aged between 16 and 30 - all of them are farmers.
In the future she wants to buy working oxen for her children so that they can increase their production capacity.
She has sought help from the MFI to finance her small business, which she has been doing for about fifteen years. She uses loans to buy weakened animals (sheep and goats) in order to nurse them stronger and resell them. She buys them in the local markets and resells in those same markets.
She is happy that she is able to help her children with their living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase animals for resale.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, Carmelita availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pig for commercial sale.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Boulgissa

texts.fr:
Mme BOULGISSA est célibataire sans enfant. Elle n'a personne en charge.
Elle est étudiante depuis 02ans. Elle s'approvisionne en recharge de gaz dans son quartier.
Elle veut s'équiper en bouteille de gaz (01 bouteille). 
Avec cette bouteille de gaz, elle compte participer à la réduction de la coupe abusive du bois.Elle ambitionne aider sa famille à améliorer un temps soit peu leur santé en utilisant le gaz et non le bois de chauffe ou le charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Boulgissa is single and has no children. She is not responsible for anyone other than herself and has been a student for two years.

Boulgissa believes that overuse of firewood is destroying trees and the environment and she would like to buy a refil for her gas bottle. This will enable her family to use this form of fuel instead of firewood or charcoal, both of which are also detrimental to their health.

loans.use: to buy one bottle of gas.

loans.name: Sherije

texts.en:
Sherije comes from a city that is more economically developed than other cities and is known for its handicrafts and trading. For the last 10 years, Sherije has been making handicraft items and running a tailoring business to earn her living. She operates her business from home and sells locally to customers in the area.

Sherije is a mother of two adult children and her husband is employed as a guard in a public organization with a low salary. Sherije’s business is going very well due to the committed effort that she puts into her work. She is very happy and loves what she does.

She has requested this loan in order to buy materials to continue making her items. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions. She is very thankful to the lenders for the help. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to continue making her items.

loans.name: Andre

texts.fr:
Mr ANDRE est marié et père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 42 ans et le moins âgé a 22 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et il a 08 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage de porcs depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne chez  les éleveurs grossistes.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 03 porcs  et 05 sacs d’aliments pour porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Andre is married and the father of six children. The eldest is 42 and the youngest is 22 years old. One of them attends school and in total he is financially responsible for eight people. He has reared pigs for fifteen years.
He buys them from wholesale rearers. With the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy three pigs and five sacks of pig food. He wants to use the profits generated to grow his business.
His goal is to take care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and five sacks of pig feed.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is an active member of Paglaum MPC. She has availed various loan products that supported her bakery business. She is 63 years old, married and lives in Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Belen successfully paid her previous loan without records of default. She is in need of additional capital for her business and asks for a loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, lard, butter, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast and other items.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, lard, butter, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast and other items.

loans.name: Julio

texts.fr: Julio, 24 ans, est célibataire et sans enfant à charge. Il est éleveur et vendeur de chèvres.  Il souhaite avoir un microcrédit pour augmenter son cheptel.
texts.en: Julio, 24, is single and has no children. He rears and sells goats. He is seeking a micro-loan in order to increase his herd size.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.fr: Anastasie est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mère de deux enfants, Anastasie s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des articles de mercerie et des tissus. Pour s’approvisionner, Anastasie se rend une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des rouleaux de popelines, Anastasie nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Anastasie va pouvoir aider son mari à bien s’occupé de leurs enfants et  agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Anastasie is thirty-nine years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Adidogomé and earns her living by selling fabric and sewing accessories. Once a month she buys new supplies from the market.

Anastasie has requested this loan to buy rolls of poplin fabric. She will use her improved earnings to expand her business and help her husband to provide for their children.

loans.use: to buy 14 rolls of poplin fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair gel.

loans.name: Dieu Est La Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALBERTINE BENEWENDE est responsable du groupe DIEU EST LA. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 16 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charges.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 01 an. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de Ouagadougou.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle  compte acheter 10 pièces de pagnes et des hauts pour les filles.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante et voyager à l’extérieur pour acheter des pagnes et revendre.
texts.en:
Albertine Benewende is the group leader of the Dieu Est La group. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 24 and the youngest 16 years old. All three children attend school and she has five people dependent on her in total.
She has been selling pagne cloths for one year, and buys her stock in the markets of Ouagadougou. With this loan, she plans to buy ten pagne cloths, and some tops for girls. She wants to use the profits from this loan to strengthen her business.
Her goal is to become a significant trader and to travel abroad to buy her fabrics for resale.

loans.use: to buy ten traditional 'pagne' fabrics and some girl's tops.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr: Patrick a 40 ans. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Pour trouver de quoi nourrir sa famille, il revend des produits alimentaires à domicile. Son rêve est de devenir autonome financièrement et de pouvoir offrir un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Patrick is forty years old, married and father to three children. In order to earn a living and feed his family, he sells food products from his home.

Patrick's dream is to become financially independent and offer his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy cans of ketchup and butter.

loans.name: Maman

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Maman est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Maman est une marchande de bouillie  préparée à base du mil à domicile. Maman revend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile. Maman s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa préparation et désire ce prêt pour réaliser ses achats des sacs de mil et des bols de sucre afin de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez importante pour inscrire ses enfants dans des écoles de haut niveau.
texts.en:
Maman is forty-one years old, married and mother to four children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells millet porridge from her home. Three times a month she buys new supplies from the market.

Maman has requested this loan to buy sacks of millet and bowls of sugar. Her improved profit will be used to register her children in good quality schools.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of millet and 5 bowls of sugar.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Victoire est une femme mariée  âgée de 29 ans habitant à Tokoin. Victoire prépare et vend de la pâte bandée fermentée « Egblin » à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Victoire s’approvisionne de son nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché. Victoire désire accroitre son commerce et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs afin de réaliser un bon revenu pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Victoire is twenty-nine years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells 'Egblin' (fermented, maize paste) from the front of her home and in the surrounding neighbourhoods. She buys the neccessary supplies twice a month from the market.

Victoire has requested this loan to buy bowls of maize and expand her business further. Her increased income will help provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 43 bowls of maize.

loans.name: Yolaine

texts.fr: Yolaine est âgée de 42 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a six enfants. Elle revend des ustensiles ménagers tels que des rideaux, des nappes et des draps etc.  C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle arrive à générer des revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Yolaine is forty-two years old, lives with a man and has six children. She sells kitchen items such as curtains, tablecloths and sheets.

Yolaine has requested this loan to increase her stock levels and improve her earnings. This will allow her to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cans of conserves.

loans.name: Rusenyi Obumu Group

texts.en:
George William is a member of the Rusenyi Obumu group where members guarantee each other when one is to get a loan and make payments. It is located in Fort Portal, Uganda.

George William is a teacher by profession and also makes bricks for a living. He has been in business for ten years now. He is very happy with what he is doing and in the future, he dreams of having a big project of brick making in his village to serve the increasing demand for bricks as most people in his community are constructing permanent houses.

George William is faced with the challenge of heavy rains that destroy his bricks, making it very expensive to successively operate. He has asked for a loan to pay for the laborers who make his bricks.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers who make his bricks.

loans.name: Akossiwa  Djigbodi

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge habitant à Adidogomé. Agée de 36 ans, Akossiwa est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Akossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des balles de friperies  afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is thirty-six years old, married and responsible for two children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells second-hand clothing. Three times a month she buys new supplies from the market and sells them from in front of her house and in the surrounding areas.

Akossiwa has requested this loan to increase her stock levels and improve her profits. She will buy bundles of second-hand clothing to meet the needs of her customers. Her earnings will help her husband provide for the expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 2 bundles of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is 46 years old and a widower from Polao, Tangub City. He runs and operates a motorcycle transportation business that provides transportation to the locality. He's doing well with his business and most especially in providing for the needs of his family. Just recently he needed an amount to pay for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle unit for his transportation business so he asked for a loan from PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance of a motorcycle unit for his transportation business.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en: Mylyn is a sari-sari store owner from Baybay, Leyte. She is a married woman and has two daughters ages eight and six years old. Mylyn has been doing the sari-sari store business for two years to earn a living, while her husband works hard as a farmer. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as bread, chips, candies, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice. In the future, Mylyn wishes to improve her sari-sari store business. She also wants to be sustainable.

loans.use: to buy bread, chips, candies, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice.

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en: Julieto is a motorcycle driver who provides transportation to localities in Tangub City. He works hard for the needs of his family. He wants to fully own the motorcycle unit that he operates so he asked for a loan to fully pay for the motorcycle unit for his transportation business.

loans.use: to fully pay for a motorcycle unit for transportation.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest and polite. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a fleet of motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a prominent and hardworking man dealing in a produce business selling beans, maize, peas, groundnuts and cassava flour in a busy area found in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the previous loan, he managed to buy groundnuts to sell. He faces the challenge of price fluctuation, which hinders his business growth. In spite of this, he hopes to buy a new car that will ease transport from his suppliers to his shop. Clovice needs a loan to buy more groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda is a businesswoman from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She runs and operates a convenience store that primarily sells consumable goods that are basic to a household. She is 39 years old and married with three school-age children. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, which provides her with needed capital for her business ventures. Now that she needs to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, condiments and confections, she is asking for a loan from the co-op. She hopes that she can maintain her good membership so that she can continuously turn to it whenever she needs additional capital.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, condiments and confections.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед молодой житель города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он в городе живет вместе матерью, женой и троими детьми. Его жена домохозяйка и сидя дома зарабатывает на жизнь. Она предоставляет услуги шитье. Дети Хуршеда маленькие ими ухаживает его жена. Хуршед активный, умный и заботливый человек. Он хочет начать свою деятельность, чтобы зарабатывать обеспечить семью. Хуршед решил купить автомашину и заниматься таксистом. Он выбрал эту деятельность, потому что Хурдеш любит водить автомашину. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Хуршед обратился за кредитом. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Khurshed, age 33, is a young resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He lives with his mother, his wife and his three children.  His wife is a homemaker and she also earns some money working as a seamstress from home.  His children are still young and in the care of their mother. Khurshed is a dynamic, intelligent and caring man.  He wants to start his own business, so that he can make some money and support his family.  He has decided to buy a car and to start working as a taxi driver.  He has chosen this activity because he enjoys driving.  He is taking a loan for lack of financial resources.  He relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Farangiz

texts.ru: Ее зовут Фарангиз. Она живет в районе Зафарабод и ей 32 лет. Фарангиз ответственная, гостеприимная и приятная в общение женщина. Она проживает вместе с мужем и дочерьми. Фарангиз занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она продвигает эту деятельностью более 5 лет. Фарангиз обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет закончить ремонт. Она не смогла отремонтировать все комнату.  Фарангиз хочется получить кредит и за счет кредита отремонтировать остальную комнату. На счет заемных средств Фарангиз намерена приобрести стройматериалы. Она по этой причине просит кредит. Фарангиз заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Farangiz, 32, lives in the Zafarobod district of Tajikistan.  She is a responsible, friendly and pleasant woman.  She lives with her husband and daughters.  She has been working as an independent seamstress for more than five years.  She is taking a loan in order to finish renovating her house.  She was not able to finish renovating her entire house, so she's hoping to receive a loan in order to renovate one last room.  She will use her loan to buy construction supplies.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies in order to finish renovating her house.

loans.name: Kholida

texts.ru: Холиде 20 лет. Молодая не замужняя девушка. Родилась в районе Пяндж. У нее среднее образование. Она швея. Холида занимается этим 2 года. Ей очень нравится ее работа. Она шьет с удовольствием. Холида милая, приветливая и люди к ней тянутся. У нее много клиентов. Для дальнейшей работы ей нужна современная машина для шитья. Благодаря машине работа пойдет в гору, потому что новая технология работает намного лучше. Поэтому она просит Вас дать ей кредит значительную сумму для покупки швейной машины. Холида заранее благодарит Вам за помощь.
texts.en:
Kholida, age 20, is a young and single woman who was born in the Pyandj district of Tajikistan.  She has a secondary education and works as a seamstress.  She has been involved in this activity for the past two years.  She really enjoys her work and sews with great pleasure.

Kholida is nice, friendly, and people enjoy her company.  She has many customers.  In order to continue working, she needs to acquire a modern sewing machine.  A new machine will give a real boost to her work, because the new technology makes things so much easier.  For this reason, she is turning to you for a loan so that she can receive enough money to buy a sewing machine.  She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt: A Sra. Laura é casada, vive com o marido, três filhos, três sobrinhos e os sogros na casa dos sogros. É comerciante, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar materiais  de construção tais como chapas de zinco, cimento e janelas. Tem sonho de terminar a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal, e tem como desafio trabalhar cada vez mais para poder merecer mais financiamentos.
texts.en: Laura is married.  She lives with her husband, their three children, three nephews, and her in-laws in her in-laws' house.  She is a merchant, and with the current loan she plans to purchase construction materials like zinc panels, cement, and windows.  Her dream is to complete construction on her house and to purchase a vehicle for personal use. Her challenge is to always work harder in order to deserve more loans.

loans.use: purchase zinc panels, cement, and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase zinc panels, cement, and doors.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
A sra Amelia tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de duas filhas gemeas. Vive em casa própria e suas filhas frequentam a  8a classe. Para além das suas filhas, cuida de uma sobrinha, filha do seu irmão. Tem uma mercearia no quintal da sua casa e com o empréstimo pretende comprar produtos da primeira necessidade tais como: arroz, farinha de trigo, farinha de milho, amendoim, coco, tapioca, açúcar e outros produtos para revender.
Ela  sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e  ter uma viatura para facilitar nas deslocações. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido
texts.en:
Amelia is 35 years old. She is single and mother of twin girls. She owns the home where she lives and her children attend 8th grade. In addition to her children, she cares for a niece, Her brother's daughter.

She has a small shop on the land where her house is and with this loan she plans to purchase staple items such as: rice, wheat flour, cornmeal, peanuts, coconut, tapioca, sugar, and other products for resale.

Her dream is to expand her business and to have a car to facilitate movements. Her challenge is to repay the loan within the established period.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, cornmeal, peanuts, coconut, tapioca, sugar, and other products to resell.

loans.name: Amé

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Amé est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Amé est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché des mèches et tissages et les revendent dans son salon de coiffure. Amé nécessite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de mèches et tissages en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Amé, who has two children, is a 31-year old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She is a hairdresser who gets her supplies of hair extensions and hair weaves once a month at the market and then resells them in her salon. Amé needs this loan to order dozens of hair extensions and hair weaves so she can make more profit and help her husband to take care of their children and provide for the family's food and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy 15 dozen hair extensions and 10 dozen hair weaves.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
A sra Elisa tem 49 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 04 filhos dos quais 03 estão na sua responsabilidade e frequentam o ensino escolar e 01 é maior de idade e trabalha. Tem mercearia numa das ruas movimentadas da cidade, com o empréstimo pretende comprar, refrescos, sumos, lâmpadas, arroz, pão, amendoim, farinha de trigo e de milho, peixe, frangos pra revender para revender.
Ela sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e  construir a sua casa. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido
texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years old. She is a widowed mother of 4 children, 3 of whom still live with her and attend school, and one who is an adult who works. She has a small shop on one of the busy streets of the city. With this loan she plans to buy soft drinks, juices, light bulbs, rice, bread, peanuts, wheat flour, cornmeal, fish and chickens for resale.

Her dream is to expand her business and build a house. Her challenge is to pay back the loan within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juice, light bulbs, rice, bread, peanuts, wheat flour, cornmeal, fish, and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Estrela

texts.pt:
A sra Estrela tem 33 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 03 filhos dos quais 02 frequentam o ensino escolar e 01 não tem idade escolar. Trabalha no Ministerio de educação e cuida dos seus seus filhos. Com o empréstimo, vai comprar cimento, varões, blocos para melhorar as condições da sua casa de banho.
Ela sonha em dar continuidade com os estudos e melhorar as condições habitacionais. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido pese embora o salário não chega para todas as despesas.
texts.en:
Estrela is 33 years old. She is widowed and mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school and one who is not yet school-aged. She works for the Ministry of Education and takes care of her children. With this loan she will purchase cement, metal bars, and cement blocks to improve the conditions of her bathroom.

Her dream is to continue her education and improve her living conditions. Her challenge is to repay the loan within the established period despite the fact that her salary does not cover all of her expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cement, metalbars, and cement block to improve the conditions of her bathroom.

loans.name: Phala Group

texts.en:
In the picture, Phala took this photo with his group member. Phala is a 39 years old, He is a married rice farmer and fattening up animals, and he has three children in his care. Two of his children work as factory workers and one child attends school.

Phala is pictured 1st from the right, and he has been a farmer since 1996. His wife is 36 years old, a rice farmer as well. All of them lives in the rural village in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $9 per day. Phala is a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members, and he will use his portion to buy piglets to fatten and earn additional income to improve his living standards. With this loan, he will be able to have enough money to buy piglets to fatten. In the future, he wants to buy more cows, renovate his house and support his children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten

loans.name: Afi Justine

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mère de cinq enfants, Afi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre son but. Pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois, Afi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de faire face aux différents problèmes qu’elle éprouve quotidiennement et de bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a 44-year old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She is mother to five children and sells charcoal which she buys twice a month from the market and resells in front of her home in order to achieve her goal. Afi needs this money to fund the order of sacks of charcoal and make a good profit margin, so that she can deal with the various problems that she encounters on a daily basis and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 23 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years old. She is married to James  who is a farmer and they are blessed with three children,She has had a farming business for nine years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She has borrowed KES. 10,000 from Visionfund Kenya as her first loan. 

And she will be using the loan to purchase animal feeds and farm inputs. She also hopes that the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children for medical care expand livestock and crop farming as her secondary business and repay her loan too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established farming business enjoy a better live with her family."

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi est un homme marié âgée de 38 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Kossi  est sans enfant et est un revendeur des photos posters vitrées qu’il s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route et  à domicile. Kossi désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de vitres en vue de bien vendre et de gagner des bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 38-year old married man who lives in Adidogomé. He does not have any children and sells photographic posters in glass frames. He gets his supplies twice a month from the market and resells them on the roadside and from home. Kossi would like this loan so he can order glass frames with a view to getting good sales of his products and making more money, so he can provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy 158 glass frames.

loans.name: Yangoiningthou Group

texts.en:
Ibethoi, Ningol, Angoubi, Indubala and Naobi are the members of Yangoiningthou Group hailing from Bishenpur District, Manipur, India. Ibethoi and Ningol are involved in a vegetable selling business; Indubala is involved in fish selling business, while Angoubi and Naobi weave women's wraparounds. It is their belief that with additional funds, they can increase their earning level with more profit.

Ibethoi is 54 years old and also the group leader. She wants to utilise the loan for selling vegetables that she will buy from whole sale vegetable market and sell in her neighbourhood. Currently her monthly household income is Rs 6500 which does not suffice for a family of 7 people. At this age she has to step out and run this vegetable business, for meeting her family needs. With your loan, Ibethoi will be able to sell potatoes, garlic, tomatoes, green chillies, brinjals, etc. With the extra income, they can increase their standard of living and also ensure that their children get proper education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for expanding her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old. She is married and has 3 children. 

Her business is cereals and vegetables. She has been in the business for 15 years. 

She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy stock rice, cow peas and vegetables as well as gas cylinders for sale. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to increase business stock. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be a wholesale supplier of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy stock rice, cow peas and vegetables as well as gas cylinders for sale

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en: Jenipher is a  Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a food stall where she sells fish and chicken. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and chicken. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and chicken.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet a 37 year old married lady living in Fort Portal Uganda. She used the previous loan to construct her house which is not yet completed. Still in her business of growing a type of banana commonly known as Kisubi a raw material for distilling waragi a local drink, Annet is thankful to Kiva that has supported her reach this far in her business and is looking forward to completing her house construction and educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Annet has asked for a loan to buy doors and windows for her house.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her house.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. With the previous loan, he managed to buy tomatoes to sell. He is still selling fresh foods like fruits and vegetables and at the same time operates a tea plantation that adds him more income. Richard is facing challenges of his stock becoming perishable and price fluctuation. However, Richard has a vision of buying land where to construct a good house for his family. Richard needs a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy is 49-year-old and a grocery seller for 10 years. Beside this, she grows all kinds of vegetables to get extra income. Originally from Battambang province, she is a married mother of five children and one of whom is still in school. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for her to support her business.

Now, she is seeking for a loan with VisionFund, and she is a group leader consisting of five members. This is the third loan for Savy and those previous loans helped her family’s living has improved gradually. As the group leader of this new loan, she will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items to attract more customers and she will use a part of loan to buy fertilizer to increase more yields. She hopes that she can save more money for future need and upgrade her family living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to attract more customers as well as increasing sales revenue so that she can save more money for future need.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Enyonam est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé. Agée de 38 ans, Enyonam est une revendeuse des épices qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des bols de poivres et de  l’ail, Enyonam nécessite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement en vue d’en tirer profit et venir en aide à ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Enyonam, who is 38 years old, married and mother to two children, lives in Adidogomé. She sells spices which she gets twice a month from the market and resells in the surrounding districts. Enyonam needs this loan to fund her supplies so she make make a profit and help to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy eight bowls of garlic and five bowls of pepper.

loans.name: Marie Michel

texts.fr: Marie Michel, 27 ans, est mariée. Elle a deux enfants. Pour générer un peu de revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle a mis sur pied une petite activité de revente de produits alimentaires. Sur son étale installé à l’entrée de son domicile, elle vend du lait, spaghettis, riz, maïs, etc.  Elle cherche un microcrédit pour se procurer plus de stock.
texts.en: Marie Michel is 27 years old, married and has two children. In order to generate a small income to take care of her family, she has set up a small activity retailing food products. She has a stall at the entrance to her home where she sells milk, spaghetti, rice, corn, etc. She is seeking a microloan to get more stock.

loans.use: to buy crates of spaghetti.

loans.name: Shahbaz

texts.en:
Shahbaz is 31 years old man, residing in Sialkot, Pakistan. He is a father of two daughters and one son. He has been running a manufacturing business of surgical instruments for many years. This business is only the financially supporting source to the entire family. He learns these arts of manufacture since his childhood and now he adopts it as his own business. He owns a different variety of machines to work on making surgical instruments that use for medical operations. After manufacturing these items, he provides supply to firms and medical stores and earns lump sum income to meet his household expenses.

He deals his regular customers with polite and honesty. That is the reason his current business is running well and increasing day by day. Therefore Shahbaz is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan because he wants to increase his current business. Shahbaz will purchase more raw material for manufacturing surgical instruments.
He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more raw material for manufacturing surgical instruments

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Claudia Ines

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 4 meses, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy solidaria. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chasquipampa’ área residencial ubicado al sur de la ciudad.
Claudia es morena de cabello negro largo y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes, actividad que realiza desde niña cuando le ayudaba a su madre, “trabajé con mi madre hasta que cumplí mayoría de edad luego me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede disponer de su tiempo independientemente, la desventaja son muy pocas. Su sueño es construir su casa, ella desea realizar la compra de juguetes por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes por mayor para renovar su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young 26-year old woman. She is married and has a 3-year old son and a 4-month old daughter. Her business is selling toys. She is a good mother, independent and very supportive. Her business is located in the "Chasquipampa" area, which is a residential area south of the city.

Claudia is dark-skinned, with long black hair and a thin physique. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works in transport and with her children who are not yet school age. They live in a rented house, built of brick and cement and which has all of the basic services.

Her business is selling toys, a job that she has done since she was a little girl and used to help her mother. "I worked with my mother until I was an adult and then I became independent..." she says. The advantage of her business is that time is at her disposal. There are few disadvantages.

Her dream is to build her house. She wants to buy toys at wholesale prices. This is the 1st loan with the institution in the 3 years that she has been doing this job. For those reasons, Claudia is asking for a loan to buy toys at wholesale prices to renovate her business.

loans.use: to buy toys at wholesale prices to renovate her business.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer de 59 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es emprendedora, paciente y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ donde se realiza la feria 2 días por semana. 
Paula es morena de cabello trenzado y vestir tradicional. Su lengua materna es el Aymara y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, su trabajo comienza con la selección de prendas para asearlas y embolsarlas para darle una mejor presentación y venderlas, “inicie mi negocio vendiendo de forma ambulante, ahorré y pude comprar un puesto de venta en la feria…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende a precios económicos, la desventaja es la falta de transporte propio para transportar las bolsas de ropa. Su sueño es vender por mayor, ella desea comprar ropa por mayor para incrementar la oferta de mercadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paula solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para incrementar la oferta de temporada.
texts.en:
Paula is a 59-year old woman. She is married and has no children. She works selling second-hand clothing. She is entrepreneurial, patient and very friendly. Her business is located in the "16 de julio" area, where the market is held 2 days a week.

Paula is dark-skinned with braided hair and traditional clothing. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who does the same type of work. They live in a house built of adobe and it has all of the basic services.

Her business is selling second-hand clothing. Her job begins with a selection of clothing to clean and collect in sacks to give them a better presentation and sell them. "I began my business selling on the street. I saved up and was able to buy a stall in the market..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that she sells at cheap prices. The disadvantage is the lack of personal transport to transport the bags of clothing. Her dream is to sell wholesale. She wants to buy clothing at wholesale prices to increase the merchandise supply. This is the 1st loan with the institution in the 10 years that she has been doing this work. For those reasons, Paula is asking for a loan to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale prices to increase this season's supply.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing at wholesales prices to increase this season's supply.

loans.name: Elis Antonio

texts.es: Con 30 años de edad Elis muestra que es un hombre trabajador brindando sus servicios de mantenimiento, en un rancho de playa para lo cual se despierta desde muy temprano. Él habita junto a su compañera de vida, con la cual busca la manera de mejorar siempre de la vivienda en que viven. Elis desea mejorar su casa de habitación, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera protegerse de las inclemencias del clima.
texts.en: At 30 years old, Elis shows that he is a hard-working man working in maintenance on a ranch for which he wakes up very early in the morning. He lives with his life partner, with whom he always seeks a way to improve the house where they live. Elis wants to improve his house, so he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to replace the roof on his house and, in this way, protect himself from the inclement weather.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III.
El socio Justino alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de sauna, el socio  lleva buen tiempo en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
El socio  solicita el crédito para la compra de duchas.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Comuzone III loan group.

Justino alternates his daily jobs, dedicating himself to his sauna business. He has been doing the job for a while and it is going well for him thanks to the commitment that he puts into his business every day. He is a responsible and persevering person.
