He wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy showers. He is thankful for the given loan and promises to comply with his dues.

loans.use: to buy showers.

loans.name: Cesar Mateo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III.
El socio sigue dedicándose  al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, el socio continua haciendo crecer y engordar a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Comuzone III" loan group. He continues to work in his business raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens. He continues to grow and fatten his animals to later sell them to the customers that come to him. He has been doing this job for a while and it is going well for him thanks to the commitment that he puts into his business every day. This is the way that he supports his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy chickens and others. He feels thankful for the given loan and promises to comply with his dues.

loans.use: to buy chickens and others.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia  Elena continua  dedicándose a  su negocio de venta de llantas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
texts.en: Elena continues working in her business selling tires. She has been doing this job for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the commitment that she puts into her business every day. This is how she supports her family. She is a responsible and persevering person. She feels thankful for the given loan and promises to comply with her dues. She is asking for a loan to buy tires.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Alta Gracia

texts.es:
Altagracia, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela, uno trabaja en la agricultura y una de sus hijas ya formó su propio hogar. 

Altagracia, se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina desde hace 10 años, además hace tamales para salir a vender por las tardes en su comunidad, en el negocio también se involucran sus hijos. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar más prendas de vestir para ofrecer variedad de opciones a sus clientes y así poder obtener mejores ingresos. 

Altagracia, desea mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio de ropa y en un futuro poner una tienda de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Altagracia, 40 years old, went to school up to the second grade. She is a single mother and has 4 children of whom two go to school, one works in agriculture, and one of her daughters already has her own household.

Altagracia has worked selling women's clothing for 10 years. In addition, she makes tamales to go out and sell in the afternoons in her community. Her children are also involved in the business.

The loan will be used to purchase more clothing to offer a variety of options to her customers and, so, to be able to get better income.

Altagracia wants to improve her house and expand her clothing business and, in the future, open a store with basic products.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to offer a variety of options to her customers.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora es una mujer de 44 años de edad, trabajadora, por tal motivo decidió poner su negocio desde hace dos años de venta de tortillas en su vivienda para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar en el cual vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 15 y 11 años de edad además de su papá. Dora desea mejorar el área de la cocina de su hogar es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, grava, hierro, arena y lámina para mejorar su cocina y de esta manera tener un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Dora is a 44-year old hard-working woman. For that reason, she decided to start her own business 2 years ago selling tortillas in her home to be able to provide food for the home where she lives with her partner and her two daughters, ages 15 and 11, as well as her father.

Dora wants to improve the kitchen area of her home, so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, gravel, iron, sand and metal sheets to improve her kitchen and this way she can have a decent place to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, iron, sand and metal sheets to improve her kitchen and this way she can have a decent place to prepare her food.

loans.name: Yaneth Maricela

texts.es: Yaneth de 27 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida, y a sus 3 hijos, 2 niños de 12 y  7 años y una niña de un año de edad. Yaneth posee una pequeña tienda junto con una venta de tortillas, con lo cual saca adelante a su familia. Es por ello que busca la manera de mejorar su negocio y para lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz por mayoreo, y granos básicos, detergente, especias, bebidas, entre muchas cosas más que necesita para su tienda. Para poder obtener más ganancias y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yaneth, 27 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their three children, 2 boys ages 12 and 7 and a girl who is one year old. Yaneth has a small store along with tortilla sales, with which she gets her family ahead. For this, she seeks a way to improve her business and for that she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in corn in bulk, and basic grains, detergents, spices, drinks, and many more things she needs for her store, to be able to get more earnings and, so, to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in corn in bulk, and basic grains, detergent, spices, drinks and many more things that she needs for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and other furniture to increase sales and improve earnings, in order to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María busca ayuda con un nuevo financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mozos para sembrar la milpa, de esta manera tendrá un mejor desarrollo y dará una cosecha más abundante, otra parte le será de ayuda para invertirlo en concentrado para alimentar los cerdos y el ganado, su negocio se mantendrá funcionando.
El utilizar el crédito anterior ha podido mejorar sus ganancias, puesto que los cerdos se pusieron más robustos y los vendió a buenos precios, por lo que agradece mucho el apoyo que recibe.
texts.en:
María seeks help with another loan to purchase agricultural supplies and pay workers to plant the cornfield, In this way, it will have better development and will give a more abundant harvest. Another part of the loan will be invested in concentrated feed for the pigs and livestock. Her business will continue running.

The use of the previous loan has allowed her to improve her earnings, since the pigs were more robust and she sold them at good prices, so she is very grateful for the support she gets.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay workers to plant the cornfield, in this way it will have better development and will give a more abundant harvest.

loans.name: Maria Elizabet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III.
La socia Maria Elizabet alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de carne, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vede su mercadería a sus cliente que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carne entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Comuzone III communal bank.

The borrower, Maria Elizabet, alternates her daily tasks with working selling meat. The borrower has had her business for a good while, which is going well to her thanks to the determination which she puts into her business each day. The borrower sells her merchandise to her customers who ask for it. The borrower is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The borrower wants to be able to continue working so to, in this way, continue supporting her family.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase meat and more.

loans.use: to purchase meat and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wood, varnish, nails, screws, paint and tools necessary to continue with his work as carpenter.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman. She has six children.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as patient.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with demand for the products and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as low prices.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Rami is 30 years old, single with no children, and he lives in Hebron city.

Rami has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Rami needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and sell them and make some profits.

The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Rami hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of livestock.

Rami thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Angelina es una señora de 62 años de edad, cuya ocupación es la venta de boquitas típicas como los son: dulces, platanitos, yuquitas, semillas, chicharras, entre otras. Ella tiene 25 años de residir en su vivienda con su acompañante quien es de avanzada edad. Angelina en busca de satisfacer sus necesidades básicas, día con día sale a promocionar sus productos que con mucho esfuerzo prepara. Es por ello que en busca de ayuda solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: plátanos, dulces, semillas, yuca, entre otros productos, y también necesita la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que no posee este servicio.
texts.en:
Angelina is a 62-year old woman, whose occupation is selling traditional snacks such as: candy, plantain chips, yucca chips, seeds, cicadas, and others. She has been living in her home for 25 years with her partner who is elderly. In search of satisfying her basic needs, Angelina goes out day-after-day to promote her products that she prepares with a lot of effort.

For that reason, she is looking for help and asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy bananas, candy, seeds, yucca and other products. She also needs to install electricity in her home because she does not have this service.

loans.use: to buy bananas, candy, seeds, yucca and other products. She also needs to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Penh Group

texts.en:
Penh, 47, lives with her family members in a rural village in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. She is a rice farmer with two children in her care. One of her children works as a factory worker and one attends school. Her husband, 49, is a rice farmer as well.

Penh is pictured first from the right and has cultivated rice since 1988. Together, she and her husband can make approximately USD 6 per day.

As the leader of a group of five, Penh would like to request a loan. She will use her share to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, she will be able to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances.

In the future, she is going to save money to buy more farmland to cultivate rice, renovate her house and support her youngest child to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is grateful that she has received a number of loans and promptly repaid all of those loans. The loans helped fund the maintenance of her jeepney, ensuring safe and efficient service and thus continuous income to meet her family's needs.

She trusts that she can again avail a 19,000 PHP loan to pay for the annual registration, new tires and maintenance of her jeepney. A proper and regular maintenance of her unit is necessary to ensure safe and continuous service, thus providing steady income to meet their daily needs and fund her children's education.

She is thanking God and you for your continuous support of her livelihood.

Eufemia aims to maintain her transportation business to enable her to send all of her four children to school. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the religion she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, tires, annual registration and maintenance for her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son runs a general store to sell rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store.

Due to his good behavior; he has built up very good relations among his customers and his sales have increased. He does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Anwar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and flour. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, sugar, and flour for her son's general store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-year-old married woman blessed with three children. She has had a farming business for 24 years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She has borrowed 10,000 KES from Visionfund Kenya as her first loan.

And she will use the loan to purchase farm inputs. She hopes that the anticipated profit will help her, to buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, afford medical care, expand the current business, and repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase  farm inputs

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as honest and has operated a retail business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use 70,000 KES to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Asesewa 1Group

texts.en:
The group Asesewa 1 is in its eighth loan cycle which has given them a lot of experience. They live in the city of Accra, Teshie, part of the nation's capital but it is considered to be an urban poor area. They are persistent and sacrificing women. They trade cooking oil, jewelry, electrical items, sewing accessories, and diapers.

Salomey is one of the members and earns a living in selling electrical items, sewing accessories, and diapers. She makes a living in a dignified and honest way. She is helping people and those who struggle.

She is requesting this loan to buy electrical items, sewing accessories, and diapers which she will sell to customers. In this way she is able to continue with her efforts. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to be someone and improve her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy diapers, electrical, and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old single man who lives in the city of Hebron. Mohammad has a small stockade in front of his house and he trades goats, sheep, and ewes.

Mohammad needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise and sell to make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Mohammad hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of livestock.

Mohammad thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, cereals and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet used the previous loan to rent a banana plantation to make Waragi, a local brew, the business she has been running since 2007. She started this business with a hope of earning income to meet the daily demands at home like medical care, school fees and loan payment.

She faces challenges of competition and less capital that hinders expansion of her business. Juliet has a vision of becoming a financially independent person in her village. Juliet has asked for another loan to rent a banana plantation to distill Waragi, a local brew, to sell.

loans.use: to rent a banana plantation to distill Waragi, a local brew, to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads.

Samson will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a Matatu within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will own a transport company. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old. She is married and has five children. For the past 10 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables. Elizabeth earns 15,000 KES each month. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a stock of cabbage, kale, tomatoes, and onions. She will also use a part of her loan to buy doors and windows for her house. This will be her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. Elizabeth’s hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale business and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, kale, tomatoes, and onions and buy doors and windows for her house

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en: Kibibi is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal stock.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal stock

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 39 years old, married, and a mother of four children. Her husband, who appears in this photo, has been a tailor for many years. He is known in his town for stitching fine gentlemen’s clothing. Nusrat’s husband earns a good amount of income to meet the expenses of their household and help provide for the educational needs of their children. 

Nusrat is requesting a 60,000 PKR loan to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, and lace for her husband’s business. Her loan will help improve his business and enable him to meet orders on time. Nusrat is positive about her husband's future earnings and she dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, and lace

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a Kiva borrower. She has one child.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to have a big boutique within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a married man with one child. He operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. Jonathan describes himself as honest. His greatest business challenge is low stock.

Jonathan is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This will be his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Jonathan successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be responsible.

Christina operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with a high demand for her products and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

Her business goal is to have a big cereals store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be joyful.

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital.

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

Her business goal is to have a big grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have well educated children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be visionary.

She operates a retail business where she makes makuti (thatched roofs) using palm leaves. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy coconut palm leaves.

She hopes that in the future she will create employment. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy  palm tree leaves

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman. She has three children.

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children.

She owns a retail shop selling items like cassava, sim sim, soap and soft drinks alongside growing food crops like bananas, poultry farming and goat rearing which enables her to generate additional income for her family. Oliver is facing challenges of weather changes that affect her crops and hence low yields and low profits. However, in the future, Oliver has a vision of educating all her children to higher levels of learning and expanding her business to new areas.

Oliver is thankful to Kiva and Kiva lenders that supported her to boost her businesses and educate her children as she seeks for another loan to pay school fees for her dependents.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her dependants.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is 46 years old. She is a responsible mother who is living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Gulshan’s husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and other items. He has been trading scrap goods with the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, Gulshan’s husband does not have money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell.

Gulshan is requesting a loan to help her husband buy scrap goods, establish his business, and provide some savings for sudden needs or incidents. She is very impressed with this honorable support. Gulshan shares her wish to take more loans after repaying this one. She thanks Kiva lenders and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Mrevat

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Mervat is a 30-year-old woman who is married with four kids. She lives in Tubas, near Nablus city. Mervat has a small stockade in front of her house which she uses to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, and other animals. Her two main business challenges are the lack of liquidity, which limits her ability to expand her business, and the seasonality of the livestock trade.

Mervat is requesting a loan to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell to make a profit. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase the number of livestock. Mervat thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cement, bricks, pipework,labour costs and the fee for a water connection.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 34 year old lady, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Shagufta wants to make some savings so she can provide better for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income. For many years, her husband has been driving a van with some irregularity because most of the time his van remains out of order. He has to maintain the van but his earnings and savings do not allow him to do this.

Shagufta requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to repair the van and can drive it regularly. She hopes her husband will be able to generate income and that she will be able to make enough savings.

Shagufta gives thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the van for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is a twenty nine year old single lady with one child living in Fort Portal Uganda. She has a business running a beauty salon. At the same time she started farming on a small scale seven years ago with the hope of earning a living for her family. She is facing hardships of seasonality and competition that hinder her growth since customers have become few. However, she is aiming at constructing a residential home for family.

Tausi is grateful to Kiva and Kiva lenders who have given her the support that has enabled her to successfully develop her business to the level that it has reached. She has asked for another loan to buy weaves, oils and other accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy weaves, oils and other accessories to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una joven de 38 años de edad es madre soltera y trabaja como asistente administrativo. Desde los 13 años utiliza anteojos por la miopía que padece.
Cada seis meses ella tiene que cambiar de anteojos por indicaciones del oftalmólogo. Ella esta cansada de depender de sus anteojos, cada mañana lo primero que hace es ponerse sus lentes para ver. La aspiración de ella es poder ser operada y que se corrija su error de refracción.
texts.en:
She is a 38 year old single mother. She works as an administrative assistant. She has used glasses for 13 years for myopia. Every six months she has to change the glasses as directed by her ophthalmologist.

She is tired of depending upon her glasses. The first thing she does in the morning is to put on her glasses in order to see. She hopes to be able to have surgery to correct her vision problem.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and paint in order to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Suaad

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Suaad is 51 years old. She is a married woman with four kids, and lives in Tubas near Nablus city.

Suaad has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc.

Suaad needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits.

The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Suaad hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock.

Suaad thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them, sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Alfredo De Jesus

texts.es: Alfredo de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 23 años de edad y su pequeño nieto de 6 años. Él es un hombre admirable sencillo y trabajador que a pesar de las dificultades no ha dejado de luchar por ayudar a su hija para que se supere y su nieto. Actualmente se dedica a cuidar un rancho que los dueños le dejan a su cargo es así como el mantiene la economía de su casa, con el crédito anterior el reparo una parte del techo de su casa ahora está solicitando otro crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en madera, lámina galvanizada, clavos etc., para cambiar el techo y ver su vivienda mucho más bonita y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo, age 45, lives in his own house with his 23 year old daughter and his little six year old grandson. He is an admirable, unassuming, and hard-working man. In spite of difficulties, he has not stopped struggling to help his daughter and his grandson to succeed.

He currently cares for a ranch that the owners have left under his care. This is how he supports his household.

With the previous loan he repaired part of the roof of his house. He is now requesting another loan from FUSAI in order to buy wood, galvanized metal sheeting, and nails, etc. in order to change the roof. He will do this in order for his house to be more attractive and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, galvanized metal sheeting, and nails, etc. in order to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, beans, and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice, and cereals. Her business goal is to have a big shop within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice, and cereals.

loans.name: Khair Nishan

texts.en:
Khair Nishan is 52 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is married with three children, and two of them are attending School. She is at present working as a fish seller in the market in Bundibugyo, Uganda, where she stays with her family.

She has been a hardworking lady on her stall for five years now, but faces a challenge of few funds to enable her to expand her business. She hopes to build rentals for supplementary income.

She has requested a loan to add capital in her fish business by buying more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fredy Adilio

texts.es: Fredy de 23 años de edad vive con su esposa su vivienda es propia, ellos aún no tiene hijos pero su visión es algún día tenerla pero para eso él trabaja muy duro para tener y darle lo mejor a sus futuros hijos. Él es empleado de una empresa a las afueras de su comunidad donde presta sus servicios de seguridad es de esta manera como es se gana la vida y lleva el alimento diario a su hogar. El está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en duralita, polines y tornillos para reparar el techo   del corredor de su casa ellos están preparando una vivienda digna para el futuro de su familia es por eso que esperan una respuesta favorable a su crédito.
texts.en:
Fredy, age 23, lives with his wife in his own house. They do not yet have children, but he envisions having them one day. That is why he works very hard in order to have and to give the best to his future children. He is an employee of a company in an area surrounding his community where he provides security services. This is how he earns a living and brings daily food to his household.

He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, beams, and screws in order to repair the roof of the veranda of his house. They are preparing a decent house for the future of his family. That is why they hope for a favorable response to this loan.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, beams, and screws to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a productive area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. Her business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 59-year-old widow. She is blessed with three children aged between 26 and 24 years old.

She has had a farming business for 30 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. She has borrowed KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan. She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs.

She hopes that the anticipated profit from the expanded business will help her to buy food for the family, cater for medical care, expand the current business and repay her loan, too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is 46 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching.

Rasheeda’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Rasheeda has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demand of her customers consistently.

She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demand of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil casado. Hace tres meses le encontraron un pequeño tumor en el ojo izquierdo el cual le esta obstruyendo la visión,teme que esto empeore y afecte en su trabajo y puedan llegar a despedirlo. Actualmente  su esposa esta embarazada, por lo que en este momento su trabajo es muy importante para él. El necesita urgentemente una operación.
texts.en:
He is 26 years old and married. Three months ago they found a small tumor in his left eye. It is obstructing his vision. He is afraid that it will get worse, affect his work, and they may fire him.

His wife is currently pregnant. Therefore, his work is now very important to him. He urgently needs an operation.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es: José cuenta con 48 años de edad, y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a sus 6 hijos tres niñas de 22, 16 y 13 años y tres varones de 24, 19 y 7 años de edad. José se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa de su localidad, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con este ingreso económico. La vivienda en la que habita José tiene una pared que está hecha de lámina deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo para construir la pared de su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera brindar protección a su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 48, lives in his own house with his six children. He has three daughters; ages 22, 16, and 13. He has three sons; ages 24, 19, and 7. José provides his services to a company in his area. He is very happy to have this income.

The house in which José lives has a wall made of metal sheeting that is damaged. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and brick in order to build the wall of his house as soon as possible. This way he will provide his family with protection.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and brick in order to build the wall of his house.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is indeed grateful for Kiva's and CCT's (Center for Community Transformation) continued moral and financial support. They have greatly helped her to persevere in life. The proceeds of her loans have really sustained her fruits/vegetables business.

Once again she needs funds in the amount of PHP 50,000 to pay for a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell on a retail basis. Although there are days that her sales are slow, she maintains her cheerful and positive outlook that as sure as the sun rises every morning, her sales will also pick up in time.

Yolanda hopes to have her own fruit/vegetable stall at their town market someday. She trusts that with her hard work she will harvest the fruits of her labor and have an abundant life. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  mangoes, oranges, lanzones, grapes, cabbage, sweet potatoes, carrots, etc., to sell at her fruit/vegetable stand.

loans.name: Rasool

texts.en:
Rasool is a 59-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area.

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has three children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income, so she can fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income, so she can fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her family members.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is married with children. He operates a butcher shop, and also does farming. By doing these businesses, Wilson is able to meet his family's needs.

He is an honest and hardworking man but is limited by capital. If he is given a chance to get a loan, he can do great in his business and pay it back very well because of the fact that he is strategically located, with less competitors and more customers.

He requests money to buy cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Flor Esmeralda

texts.es: Flor es una mujer trabajadora de 33 años de edad que habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus 3 hijos dos niñas de 15 y 4 años de edad y un varón de 6 años de edad. Flor se dedica a la venta de artesanías para el hogar y de uso personal, en una playa de mucha afluencia de turistas, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Flor desea construir el corredor de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, cemento y arena para construir el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Flor, 33, is a hardworking woman who lives in her own home along with her three children, two daughters ages four and fifteen and one son who is 6 years old. Flor sells crafts for the home and for personal use, on a beach that is popular with tourists. This allows her to support the household financially.

Flor wishes to build a corridor from her home which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, cement and sand to build a corridor from her home.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is 30 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children, who attend school. She is very hard working and honest, and she has to do a lot of hard work to pay her household expenses. It is a challenge to afford the school tuition fee. She owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband works at a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. Saima wants to buy more cosmetic products for her beauty salon, so she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to enhance her business. Saima is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk-selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 36 years old and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demand of her customers efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demand of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Akuavi

texts.fr: Mariée, Akuavi est une femme sans enfant. Akuavi est une femme âgée de 35 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Akuavi est une couturière qui achète des popelines et des vaselines  qu’elle expose dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner des rouleaux de popelines et de vaselines, Akuavi se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akuavi va pouvoir aider son mari à prendre en charge aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Akuavi is married with no children. She is a 35-year old woman living in Adidogomé. Akuavi is a seamstress who buys poplin and interlining that she displays in her sewing workshop at her home.

In order to purchase rolls of poplin and interlining, Akuavi goes to the market wice a month. With the resulting profit margin, Akuavi will be able to help her husband take care of the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy four rolls of poplin and three rolls of interlining.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia, 30, is married and a vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality fibers for her carpet business.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Sarun, village chief of Stok Kabbas Village, Cambodia, lives with his wife and four daughters. Besides working as village chief, he and his wife (both in the picture standing in-front of their house) do farming on their four hectares of land. He devotes himself to his farming business in order to help his daughters pursue higher education. Currently he has achieved some of his goal. One of his daughters is a teacher, and another one is still pursuing a bachelor's degree. Sarun decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar power system for his home. He believes with a solar home system, his children will be able to study at night better than before. His whole family also can live in a safer environment.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Stok Kabbas Village, Banteay Preal Commune, Rolea

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: Mariée, Mana est une femme avec quatre enfants à charge. Mana est âgée de 35 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelée « Akpan ». Mana  achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Mana demande ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs afin de gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mana is a married woman taking care of four children. She is 35 years old and lives in Tokoin where she prepares and sells "pâte bandée" mash made of corn, called "Akpan". Mana buys the necessary ingredients for its preparation twice a month at the market and sells her merchandise in front of her house and in surrounding neighbourhoods.

Mana is requesting this loan to order bowls of corn so as to earn more profits, with the goal of providing for her needs and to improve her children's daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 65 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.ru: Eduard молодой парень в возрасте 32 года, женат и работает в области сельского хозяйства, он выращивает смородину. В настоящее время Eduard выращивает смородину на 10 соток, но этой осенью посадит ещё 50 соток смородины. Все земляные работы он делает с помощи мотоблока. Eduard хочет расширить свой бизнес и для развития бизнеса он хочет купить рефрижератор (6 тонн, 17М3). В рефрижератор будет хранить собственную продукцию и собирать в деревне от небольших производителей: смородину, малину, ежевику и крыжовника. В настоящее время Eduard продаёт продукцию на предприятия, специализирующееся в экспорте в страны СНГ. После покупки рефрижератор продукция будет храниться дольше и сохранит качество, которое позволит экспортировать ягоды в Европе.
texts.en: Eduard is a young man 32 years of age. He is married and works in the agricultural field, growing currants. At the present time Eduard is growing currants on 10 ares [0.1 hectares], but this autumn he will plant another 50 ares [0.5 hectares] of currants. He carries out all of his work on the land with the help of a rototiller. Eduard wants to expand his business, and for the development of the business he wants to buy a refrigerator (6 tonnes, 17 cubic meters). He will store his own produce in the refrigerator and gather from other small producers in his village: currants, raspberries, blackberries and gooseberries. At the present time Eduard sells his produce to companies specializing in export to CIS countries. After buying the refrigerator his produce will last longer and will preserve its quality, which will allow exporting berries to Europe.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Nojoud

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine!

Nojoud is a 36-year-old married woman with four kids, and she lives in Tubas near Nablus city. She has a small yard in front of her house, and her main business is trading in livestock such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc.

Nojoud needs this loan to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell to make a profit.

Her business faces two main challenges. The first one is a lack of liquidity which limits her ability to develop her project, and the second is seasonality in livestock trading.

In the future, Nojoud hopes to expand her business by increasing her number of livestock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell to make a profit.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old and married with 4 children. He has had a butcher's business for 10 years.

He will be using the loan to buy cattle for slaughter, and he hopes this will enable him to have more stock of meat to sell in order to make more income, which will help him to complete construction of his rental houses.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a bigger piece of land and build some real estate.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughter, and he hopes this will enable him to have more stock of meat to sell in order to make more income, which will help him to complete construction of his rental houses.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 39-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of the city as well.

Her husband has gotten a new contract for whitewashing and oil painting of newly constructed houses, but he does not have paint brushes or rollers for providing these services. Nasreen requested a loan so that her husband can buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. Her husband’s savings are very poor, and this is why he is unable to buy new tools.

She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tools, such as paint brushes, rollers, and kerosene oil, for her husband's whitewashing and oil painting services.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 55-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. She has had a business purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She works very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat’s husband owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, headlights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford the household expenses.

Her husband is the only person supporting his family and also his old parents. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with the future expenses. Therefore, Riffat has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband.

Riffat is the mother of five children; some of them are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her children. She hopes that her husband will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Riffat thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts for her husband's spare parts store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old and married to Joseph, and they are blessed with four children aged between 18 and 8 years old. She is a tea farmer, which earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Jane has applied for her second loan of KES 20,000 from VFK Kapsabet branch, with which she plans to pay school fees for her son. Her future dream is to see her children excel in their education.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Alime

texts.en:
Alime is married and a mother of two. She makes jewellery boxes, meerschaum jewels at home and makes a contribution to the family budget. She sells them by retail or wholesale. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of velvet fabric for her boxes and materials for her jewelleries. She wants to produce more and gain more and improve her business.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Alime hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Evde takı kutusu, lületaşı takılar yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Yaptığı ürünleri toptan ve perakende olarak satıyor. Kullandığı mikro kredi ile kutu yapımında kullanmak için kadife kumaş ve takı malzemesini toptan alarak üreterek satmak istiyor ve para kazanarak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy velvet fabric boxes and materials

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 51-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single earning person. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw which is their single source of income.

She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total.

Therefore, Safia wants to receive a loan for her son so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her son, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family.

She hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María tiene 30 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos un varón de 11 años y dos niñas de 6 y 2 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con este negocio. María desea construir una pared en su vivienda, que le permita brindar mayor protección a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pared de su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 30 years old. She lives in a house that she owns, together with her life partner and her three children: a boy of 11 and girls who are 6 and 2. María works selling beauty products by catalog. This work allows her to support her household economically, and thus she feels very happy to have this business. María wants to build a wall for her house, which will provide her family with better protection. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron bars to build the wall for her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron bars to build a wall for her home.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widow with 1 child and she operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes and inadequate funds.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is thanking Kiva and CCT from the bottom of her heart for their untiring support of her livelihood. She has received loans numerous times, which she has fully paid, and has funded the needs and maintenance of her jeepney, thus ensuring a steady income to feed her family.

She trusts that she can again request a 50,000 PHP loan to pay for the annual registration, reupholstery, fuel, and tune up of her jeepney. Regular and proper maintenance of her jeepney is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. Her transport business means a lot to her as it is her main source of income to send her children to school.

Rosana plans to acquire another jeepney. She aims to have a better quality of life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the reupholstery, new tires, fuel, and tune up of her jeepney.

loans.name: Kalisya

texts.en:
Kalisya used the previous loan to buy cassava flour to sell. He owns a milling machine as his main business alongside selling cassava flour, coffee seeds, bananas and growing potatoes. He normally sells to traders from the city and with the profits earned he has been able to provide basic needs to his family like school fees, medical care and food.

He is faced with challenges of less capital to buy enough stock which hinders expansion of his business. He has future prospects of buying more milling machines that he can use to increase production. He has asked for a loan to stock coffee seeds for selling.

loans.use: to stock coffee seeds for selling.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 45 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses, she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely increase her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 47-year-old married woman.

Some years ago, she started her business selling animals in her community. She purchases small baby goats and, after raising them for a year or so, she sells them in her community in order to earn money. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats to resell in the market in order to earn a profit.

She aspires to save money to provide a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to raise and resell in the market in order to earn a profit.

loans.name: Firdos

texts.en:
Firdos is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children.

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years and she knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc. in order to be able to sew more dresses on time.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc. in order to be able to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 22 years old single lady. She is running a business of milk selling, so she has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Naseem's job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. She earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenditures.

Now she needs to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Naseem has requested for 40000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 53 years old, married woman, with 4 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Nasira expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Neveen

texts.en:
Neveen is an amazing mother who lives in Bethlehem City. She has three children and she is working hard to ensure a good life for them and ensure that they do not need anything.
Neveen husband works as employee, but he cannot cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Neveen started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income.
She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in vitamins for the brain and for the appetite, fever and cough medicines, skin creams, etc.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marcosa is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Marcosa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marcosa requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Marcosa has been in this business for 8 years. Marcosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Amtool's Group

texts.en:
Amtool is 50 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this her husband, Amtool has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and wants to pay labor cost for it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Amtool thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel of rickshaw for her husband's transportation servics.

loans.name: Harriet,

texts.en: Harriet, is thirty five years, married and lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda with her four children. She trades in cosmetics and ladies hair weaves as a beautician and earns additional income from cocoa gardens. She started the business eight years ago and she is proud of the progress although challenged by increasing transport costs and limited capital. She hopes to expand business in future and make enough money to educate her children plus the two dependents under her care. Harriet has requested for a loan to buy cosmetics and weaves for selling.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair weaves for resale.

loans.name: Bazirio

texts.en:
Bazirio is a hardworking married man with 7 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening, but also does coffee and banana growing to supplement his earnings. He has been doing this work of crop farming and cattle fattening for more than 25 years with the intention of increasing on his income and paying school fees for his children.

He hopes to expand and modernize his farm and being a good father, he is dedicated to his mission of educating all his children up to university level.
With all the ambitions he has, his capital is not enough so he is seeking a loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man with 1 child. He operates a butchery where he sells meat and has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to own a cafe within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have educated children. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser is 59 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling fancy cloths. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Kouser is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list.

Currently she needs a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase good-quality fancy cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality fancy cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Sanjeeda

texts.en:
Sanjeeda is a 45 years old, married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of sewing. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities.

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing  more dresses on time to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Nadeen

texts.en:
Nadeen is an amazing mother of two children and lives in a small village near Hebron City. She is working hard to ensure a good life for her family.

Nadeen's husband works but does not earn enough to cover all his family's needs. She wants to help him any way she can. Because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business five years ago.

She sews clothes to sell. After she gained good experience in this business, she decided to expand it. Nadeen applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine, yarn and fabric to increase her income.

Nadeen needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, yarn and fabric to increase her income.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Silvia tiene 33 años de edad es madre soltera habita en casa propia junto a sus dos pequeñas hijas de 10 años,  7 años de edad y su abuelo de 87 años el tío de 45 años y su prima de 38 años gracias a su gran esfuerzo está sacando adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios al igual su tío y su prima le ayudan para los gastos del hogar. Ella desde hace 13 años se dedica a la venta de ropa interior la sale a vender todos los días de la semana y buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos quiere vender blusas y faldas pantalones, trajes para niños y niñas para obtener mejores ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, brassier, fustanes, licras pantaletas, fajas etc. Para darle a su familia otra mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia is 33-years old and a single mother, living in her own house with her two young daughters who are ten and seven years old,  her grandfather, who is 87 years old, her 45-year old uncle, and her 38 year-old cousin. Through her efforts she is moving her children forward in their studies while her uncle and cousin help in the household expenses. 

For the last 13 years she has worked in the sale of underclothes which she sells every day. She is seeking a way to increase her earnings and wants to sell blouses, skirts, pants, children's outfits to have higher earnings. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, bras, petticoats, lycra panties, girdles, etc. to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in: blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, bras, petticoats, lycra panties, girdles, etc. to give her family better living conditions.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married father of two children. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia is 59 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anatolia has a general store business in the Philippines. Anatolia requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, biscuits, beers, etc. to sell.

Anatolia has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Anatolia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, biscuits, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 39 years old. She lives in the small village of Chkhoria with her husband, 2 children and pensioner parents-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows, 2 pigs and a plot of land, where nut trees are grown. They produce cheese to sell locally at a good price.

Marina is hardworking woman and does her best to insure a good harvest. The harvested nuts are also sold locally. Marina wants to start trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 4000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of nuts to resell at higher price. Marina will be able to generate more income and improve the living conditions for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in potatoes, yucca, plantains, corn, margarine, bags, cabbage, tomatoes, consommé, limes, etc. and she also wants to buy a cart for potatoes.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is a 51-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte. Her husband works hard as a construction worker while Narcisa is engaged in raising pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Kumushai

texts.ru: Кумушай, 20 лет, замужем, есть дочь. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Кумушай, на 2,0 ГА собственного земельного надела, она в основном выращивает картофель , лук, кукурузу, помидоры для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,900 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кумушай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистых овощей. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение бизнеса и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en:
Kumushai is 20 and married with one daughter. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as a source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she has 2 hectares of her own land where she grows mainly potatoes, onions, corn and tomatoes for sale. Her monthly income is 7,900 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Kumushai has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer to amend the soil and grow organic vegetables. She wants to put profits from the loan into further building up her business and plans to save toward buying a family car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 29-year-old married mother of four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She makes and sells soap in the markets and gets additional income from buying and selling fish. She is very hard working and creative in business but is challenged by inadequate capital. She hopes to educate her children up to the university level. She operates on a busy street in town and her sells mainly to locals who are good and supportive which encourages her to work extra hours.
