She has requested a loan to buy chemicals and materials to make soap.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and materials to make soap.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a married mother of two children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, milk, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a large shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live well. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, flour, milk and other items.

loans.name: Aley Joud Group

texts.en:
Huda is the featured borrower for Aley Joud Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Huda is a 54-year-old married mother of four children. For ten years ago, she started making crafts to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a very creative woman who makes unique crafts for different occasions, such as chocolate designs and souvenirs. She has a good reputation among her region, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open her own crafts shop. Huda is the lady standing in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Nada is the lady on the left, and Sawsan is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to open her own crafts shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: 100 lb. bags of corn, metal sheets, nails, and wood so that she can meet the demand from her customers.

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa tiene 37 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres queridos   hijos de 19 años, 11 años y 8 años de edad a los cuales les está dando estudios por lo que quiere verlos triunfar en la vida, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que siempre ha sacado adelante a su familia y gracias a la ayuda que le brinda su compañero de vida. Luisa desde 14 años se ha dedicado a vender productos de belleza por catalogo ya que de eso obtiene sus ingresos económicos. Luisa ha observado que cada día son más las personas que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas para el cuerpo, cremas para el cabello, fragancias para damas y caballeros, champú, jabones, lápiz labial, lápiz para ojos, para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luisa is 37-years old. She lives in her own house with her life partner and her three beloved children who are 19, 11 and eight years old. She is providing for their studies so that they can succeed in life. She is a very hard-working woman who is a fighter. She always moves her family forward thanks to the help of her partner. 

Since she was 14 years old, Luisa has worked selling beauty products from a catalogue to earn a living. Luisa has observed that every day there are more people requesting her products. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: lotions for the body and hair, fragrances for women and men, shampoo, soaps, lipstick and eyeliner to meet the demand for products from her customers and to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To invest in: lotions for the body and hair, fragrances for women and men, shampoo, soaps, lipstick, and eyeliner.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: This loan of $1,000 will allow Jose to send his son to University. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, school supplies, and school registration. Jose loves his son very much and hopes that furthering his education will help him have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy tuition, textbooks, school supplies, and school registration.

loans.name: Elisena

texts.fr: Elisena est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant qui est régulièrement scolarisés. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques. Cette activité lui donne de quoi nourrir sa famille et faire un peu d’épargne pour les cas imprévus.
texts.en: Elisena is 39 years old. She is a married mother to one child who regularly attends school. She earns a living through selling cosmetic products. This activity brings in enough income to feed her family and accumulate some savings on the side in case of unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase packs of beauty lotion.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares lives in Irbid. He is a 22-year-old single guy. He is a bachelor student majoring in tourism management. Fares chose this major because it is easier to find jobs in this field.

He has been facing some financial problems that prevent him from paying his university fees and completing his studies. He has applied for an education loan to help him pay for his university fees and complete his education. His next step is to complete advanced studies after he gets the bachelor degree and achieve his dream to become a university teacher in the tourism management in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.en: Nurzhamal is a 19-year-old freshman at American University in Central Asia, located in Bishkek. She considers education as the key for making dreams come true. Because of that, she came from a rural area of Kyrgyzstan to the capital to get a higher education. Having passed AUCA entrance exams successfully, now she is asking for a Kiva loan to cover part of her tuition fee. Nurzhamal is a dignified candidate for a Kiva loan because she has a big family of five members: her parents, herself and two younger siblings. Her father is a farmer; he works in the field and grows fruits and vegetables to sell to earn money. Her mother is a biology teacher; unfortunately, there is just one school in her village and there is no available work place for her mom after she returned from maternity leave. Nurzhamal’s father couldn’t get a higher education due to his family’s financial difficulties when he was younger, so now his main dream is to give a good education to his children as they could have a better life in the future then he has now.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at AUCA

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en:
Saiid is a 24-year-old married Palestinian refugee, a father of one child, who is working with cattle for eight years. He is a hard working man who puts so much effort to develop his business in order to improve his family's living.
Just like most Palestinian Refugees living in Lebanon, he has certain limitations where he finds himself doing things unintentionally just because he can't do something else.

To improve his living, Saiid is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy big quantities of fodder with special encouragement to store it for the coming autumn and winter seasons.
He will also use part of the loan to make necessary maintenance to his house to keep it a healthy living place before the coming autumn and winter seasons.
He hopes to stay capable of developing and improving his farm to increase his income and improve his family's social and financial living.

loans.use: to buy big quantities of fodder with special encouragment to store for the coming autumn and winter seasons.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 36-year-old married mother of three children. She works hard as a tutor from her house providing educational services to nearby neighbors, so that from the acquired income she can provide her children with the best education and support her husband in covering their living needs.
Roula is a responsible person, who is taking a big responsibility of taking care of her children alone, since her husband traveled abroad seeking a better income opportunity.
Roula's income is limited, she manages it properly. But sometimes, she can't cover sudden requests quickly or freely. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children school tuition fees.
She hopes to stay capable of providing her children with necessary education for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her children school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: Delphine, 45 ans, divorcée. Elle vit avec ses deux enfants dans la ville de Petit-Goâve. Pour trouver de quoi subvenir aux besoin de tous les jours, elle vend des articles divers. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour s’acheter des sacs de sucreries à revendre aux écoliers du quartier.
texts.en: Delphine is a 45-year-old divorcee. She lives with her two children in the town of Petit-Goâve. In order to meet their daily needs, she sells various items for a living. She needs this loan to purchase bags of candy which she will resell to schoolchildren in her local area.

loans.use: to purchase bags of candy.

loans.name: Gislaine

texts.fr: Gislaine est commerçante. Elle revend des produits alimentaires.  Agée de 29 ans, mariée, elle vit à Petit-Goâve avec son fils et son mari.  Avec la revente des produits alimentaires, Gislaine arrive à prendre soin de sa famille et payer l’écolage de son enfant. Elle cherche un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Gislaine is a shopkeeper. She sells food products. She is a 29-year-old married mother to one child who lives in Petit-Goâve with her family. Through selling these foodstuffs, Gislaine is able to take care of her family and pay for her child to attend school. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase macaroni and bags of rice.

loans.name: Clara Elizabeth

texts.es: Clara de 34 años vive felizmente con su compañero de vida y junto a una hija de 9 años y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella tiene 15 años de residir en vivienda propia, en la cual atiende a diario sus labores del hogar, mientras que su esposo sale a diario a laborar para llevar el sustento diario para su familia. Pero en vista de la necesidad y de las condiciones de su hogar, Clara hace la petición de un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: la compra de lámina, polines, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.  Ya que su hogar es de lámina y por el pasar del tiempo se ha deteriorado y es por lo que necesita la reparación, todo esto a fin de poder tener un lugar mejor para vivir ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Clara is 34 years old. She lives happily with her life companion, together with her 9 year old daughter and her 2 year old son. She has lived in her own home for 15 years where she takes care of the household tasks daily, while her husband goes out each day to work to provide the daily sustenance for her family.

Seeing the need and the condition of her house Clara is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of laminated sheeting, beams, nails and wire to replace the roof of her house. As her house is made from laminated sheeting it has deteriorated with the passing of time and so it needs repairs. All this is in order to have a better place for her and her family to live.

loans.use: to invest in laminated sheeting, beams, nails and wire to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 33-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Samir also has electronic maintenance workshop. Samir took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new tools for his workshop. With this loan, Samir can improve his service Samir also increase his customers. Samir dreams to become stable situation in Gaza to develop his work and lives with his family in peace.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his electronics workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for sugar, wheat flour, rice flour, cooking oil, margarine, eggs, etc,

loans.name: Lorena Beatriz

texts.es: Lorena es una mujer de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos a los que apoyan para que estudien y ellos puedan optar a una mejor calidad de vida. Lorena se dedica a prestar sus servicios en un negocio local con lo que logra obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para sostener a su familia, además su compañero de vida le apoya con lo que logran brindar lo mejor a su familia. Lorena desea instalar techo a su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado y en época de invierno ingresa el agua a su vivienda deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para reparar el techo de su vivienda, anteriormente Lorena solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en el piso de su vivienda, por lo que se siente agradecida y espera seguir contando con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Lorena is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her partner and four children, whom she supports so they can attend school and choose a better quality of life. Lorena makes a living offering her services in a local business and with her earnings she manages to make the necessary income to support her family. In addition, her partner supports her and with their combined income they provide their family with the best they can.

Lorena wants to install a roof on her house since the current one is deteriorating and during the winter the water comes in, destroying their few belongings. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to repair the roof on her home.

Lorena previously requested a loan, which she used for flooring in her home. She is very grateful and she hopes to continue receiving this support.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her business.

Beatriz has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Naciye

texts.en:
Naciye's husband is deceased. All four of her children are married and she lives alone.

Naciye knits baby socks and shoes. She makes jewelry from meerschaum and makes contributions to the family budget.

With the help of the loan, Naciye is planning to buy bulk purchases of thread and meerschaum stones to make more products, sell them, and make more money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Naciye hanımın eşi vefat etmiş. Dört çocuğunu evlendirmiş yalnız yaşıyor. Naciye hanım örgüden bebe patikleri yapıyor, Lüle taşından da takılar yapıyor ve aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Kullandığı mikro kredi ile örgü ipi ve lületaşını ham olarak alarak üreterek satış yapmayı ve para kazanmayı planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy knitting yarn and meerschaum  products

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35 year old married woman. She has been making embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family.

To cherish her children and to meet household expenses she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all the raw materials for embroidery. She completes her embroidery tasks over a wooden frame alongside her daughters. She wants to sells her embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become an expert in her art and wants to buy raw materials of her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Shazia has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell and could generate maximum income.

She is a mother of seven children and she hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and wooden frames for her embroidery business so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell directly in the market.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: A  $1000 loan is offered to Albina to improve her business.She is married and she has four children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, biscuits, body lotion, coffee, sugar and eggs.She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.Running a business has made Albina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, biscuits, body lotion, coffee, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en: Chanry is a 25-year-old farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two small children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young to attend school. For six years she has grown cassava and rice to earn income to support her family. She also sell grocery items in order to earn additional income as well. Recently, the price of cassava has decreased, which makes it really hard for her to generate income to feed her two children and keep supporting their study as before. Now she is applying for this first Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yield and take the remaining money to spend on labor fees. She hopes her crop will grow healthily so that she can sell it at a higher price and renovate her old house to put her family in a safe house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yield, enabling her to earn more income to renovate her old house and keep her children safe.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 40-year-old married mother of three children, who runs her own pastry business from her house, to support her husband, who is traveling abroad seeking a better income business in covering their family's living needs.
Nisrine is well known in her region, she enjoys her business and she believes that she has special talents in developing it. Nisrine works hard to improve her family's living, especially through providing them with a healthy living place, since she had leakage issues from last winter.

For this reason and to take the necessary precautions before the coming autumn and winter season, Nisrine is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to do the necessary maintenance on her house before the coming winter season to keep it a healthy living place.
She hopes that in the future she can open her separate bakery and increase her production.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance for her house before the coming winter season to keep it a healthy living place

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 40-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has five children. Four of these are still school aged children ages 21, 19, 17 and 14 years old. Marites and her husband both sell ice to the community usually to the fishermen. They have been doing these for 20 years to earn a living. Aside from these, they are also owned a small eatery that give them extra income.

Marites is asking a loan for additional capital to their ice selling business such as labor, transportation and electricity. Marites wishes to send all her children to school to get a college degree. Thus, they will have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: for additional capital to their ice selling business such as labor, transportation and electricity

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a single man. He describes himself to be social. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. His primary customers are ladies. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more dresses. His business goal is to have a modern boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more dresses

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shanaz is a 38-year-old lady, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband works in abroad, so nowadays she is living with her sibling. She wants to provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible, in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her brother has been driving a motorized rickshaw for several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient capital to fix the problem. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her brother to buy a body for the motorized rickshaw.
She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a motorized rickshaw's body for her brother's transportation services.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira , is 47 years old, married woman, running a small business selling garments to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Tahira  has requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia  is a widow; some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home to meet their day-to-day expenses. Safia is popularly known in her area for her skill in sewing. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 30000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.  She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child. She earns a living by raising chicken in the Philippines and supplements this income with earnings from food vending. She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more chicks, feed, and vitamins . Marlyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Catalina works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Catalina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable vending business.

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.  Charito is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is married and he has four children. He works as a teacher, and he works very hard for his children and all members of his family. Vicente took this loan of $600 to buy stone, cement, sand, wood and other items necessary to repair his house. He is happy with this loan because TRM offered the loan to him.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, sand, wood and other items to repair his house.

loans.name: Amnah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Amnah, who is a 48-year-old widow with one son and one daughter. Amnah is a merchant and has been selling traditional snack food for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.  Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Amnah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food, such as meat, spices, and vegetables.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is an amazing lady who lives in a small village near Hebron City. She is working hard to ensure a good life for her family and ensure that they do not need anything.

Hala's father works as employee, but he would not cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Hala started her business three years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had some good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarn and fabric to increase her income.

She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and yarn and fabric to increase her income.

loans.name: Elena Maribel

texts.es: Elena es una mujer de 38 años de edad que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de empleada doméstica, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia. Elena habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo de 6 años de edad, que es su mayor alegría. Elena desea terminar de construir el cuarto, ya que con el crédito anterior coloco techo, puertas y ventanas, pero aún le falta una pared que es de lámina por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo para terminar de construir la pared que falta para terminar su cuarto.
texts.en:
Elena is a 38-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She has been doing this work for many years and she has a lot of experience. Elena lives in her own home with her six-year-old son, who is her greatest joy.

Elena wants to finish building the room, since she used the previous loan to install a roof, doors and windows. She is still missing a wall made of laminate, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick to finish building the missing wall to finish her room.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick to finish building the missing wall.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Los Angeles  está en su 3er. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, están luchando y esforzándose para poder ayudar a sus familias a través del trabajo unido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Victoriana, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema, luchando y esforzándose por poder crecer y salir adelante. Victoriana se dedica al humilde trabajo de la venta de gallinas, y por medio de esto tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de gallinas y balanceados, para poder seguir con su humilde trabajo para poder continuar ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group, called “Los Angeles” [The Angels], is in its third cycle of the Women Committee Program. They are all part of the poverty elimination program. They are all fighting and working hard to help their families by working together.

One of the members is Victoriana, who demonstrated a poverty level one, which means that she lives in extreme poverty. She fights and works hard to get ahead. Victoriana is dedicated to the humble activity of selling hens. This is how she finds the means to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy hens and concentrated feed, in order to continue with her humble work and be able to help her beloved ones.

loans.use: to buy hens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor costs to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 48-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and her son is engaged in a scrap material recycling business.

Shamshad's son needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, her son is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, Shamshad has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable Shamshad's son to purchase the scrap material in bulk, so that he can earn a good profit from his business.

Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy scrap material in bulk for her son's recycling business.

loans.name: Antoun

texts.en:
Antoun is an entrepreneur who lives in Bethlehem City. He is working hard to ensure a good life for his family so that they do not need anything.
Antoun's father works but does not earn enough to cover all his family's needs. Antoun wanted to help his father so he decided to open his own business.
Antoun started his business three years ago sewing clothes to sell. After gaining good experience in this business, he decided to expand. He applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine, yarn and fabric to increase his income.
Antourn needs your support to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, yarn and fabric to increase his income.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soda, sweets, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, sweets, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soap, sweets, flour and other items

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 50 years old. She is married with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emerita has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more inventory of dry goods to sell such as blankets, towels, blouses, etc.

Emerita has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emerita has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of dry goods to sell such as blankets, towels, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo crédito para desarrollar sus actividades agrícolas de esta temporada, comprara abono, herbicidas e insecticidas para tener preparado el terreno y eliminar la maleza para sembrar granos básicos, espera que en esta oportunidad las cosechas sean mucho más abundantes.
Con la facilidad que le da los créditos se mantiene trabajando en el campo, es algo que disfruta mucho hacer, vive en las mismas circunstancias familiares y en su situación económica ha tenido una mejoría.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan to expand his farming business for the season. He will buy manure, herbicides and insecticides to prepare the land and eliminate the weeds to plant basic grains. He hopes that this time the crops are much more abundant.

Even though he easily receives loans, he continues working in the field, as it is something he really enjoys doing.

The circumstances within his family remain the same, and his financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and insecticides to prepare the land and to eliminate the weeds to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 33-year-old lady. She is married and passing her life with her daughter and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband because her husband owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover is very high.

Due to the high cost he is facing a shortage of material and is unable to purchase expensive raw material to sell. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can remove the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount her husband will buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, precious stones and sequins to use for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Gulzara

texts.ru: Гулзара, 28 лет, вдова, 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, с 2007 года в качестве дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. Она жизнерадостный и ответственный человек. У Гулзары в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 3 лошади. На сегодняшний день деятельность Гулзары приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 21,500 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание и воспитание детей Гулзары. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и увеличения доходов, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку коров и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена заготовить ячмень, в качестве корма для скота на зиму.
texts.en: Gulzara is 28 years old, a widow, and has two children. She has a higher education. She has been farming since 2007 to get income. She is a cheerful and responsible person. Gulzara has four cows and three horses. Today Gulzara's business brings her a monthly profit of 21,500 som (KGS), but these funds are insufficient for a decent life and to raise Gulzara's children. For the further development of her business and to increase her income she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) which she will direct towards the purchase of some cows and sheep to increase the size of her herd. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan to develop her business, and she intends to prepare barley to use as feed for the livestock during winter.

loans.use: to buy some cows and sheep in order to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Virtuosas está en su 1 º ciclo, es un grupo nuevo el cual está trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas quieren poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pamela es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy buena, que ayuda a su grupo y siempre trata de poder orientarlas y ser el ejemplo. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos variados, tiene todo tipo y con ello se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Virtuosas” [Virtuous Women], and is in its first cycle. It is a new group, part of the poverty elimination program. All the members want to receive training and improve their living conditions and those of their beloved ones.

Pamela is the group’s president. She is a good woman, and helps her group by trying to be a role model and a leader for the members. She sells assorted cosmetics. She sells all types of products, and this is how she makes a living in a dignified and honest way. She is a hardworking and persistent woman, who wants to improve her living conditions.

She is requesting this loan to buy assorted cosmetics to sell. In this way, she will be able to continue selling her products as she has been doing so far, and help her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a 42-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and a mother of a 14-year-old child. To help her husband financially, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been doing this for almost four years.

Perlita wishes to uplift her business and become sustainable in the future. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as powdered chocolate drink, coffee, sugar, biscuits, canned goods, spices, cooking oil, chips, candies, bread, noodles, and toiletries.

loans.use: to buy powdered chocolate drink, coffee, sugar, biscuits, canned goods, spices, cooking oil, chips, candies, bread, noodles, and toiletries.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a variety of goods, like bread, candies, biscuits, condiments, assorted canned goods, beverages and toiletries.

She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol, and has one grown child. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for a long period of time.

Bernardina is asking for a loan to buy stock like soft drinks and other groceries. With the increased stock, she would be able to expand her business and slowly handle her finances. She would also be able to save for the future.

She is hoping that her main source of livelihood will be successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy stock like soft drinks and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 42 years old. He is not married and has no children. He has had a business making and selling bricks for five years.

Benard will be using the loan to purchase tools and hopes this will help him expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to open other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase tools to help him expand the business.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is a married mother of three children. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, maize, beans, flour, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more flour, rice, bread and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more flour, rice, bread and other items.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de sus ventas ambulantes, viene ganándose la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Sandra por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, y cubre los gastos que día a día necesita cubrir. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se unió al grupo para poder mejorar y crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas ambulantes, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Cayetano group is in the poverty elimination program, and one of the members is Sandra. Due to her constant efforts and work, and through her door-to-door sales, she is making an honest living.

Through her work, Sandra helps her family and covers day-to-day expenses. She is a hardworking and persistent woman, who joined the group to be able to grow and improve herself.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in purchasing footwear, clothing, accessories, and other items, to be able to continue with her door-to-door sales. This will allow her to continue growing and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothing, accessories, and other things.

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en: Nerisa is engaged in raising pigs to earn a living while her husband works hard as a farmer. They work together to provide for the needs of the family. Nerisa has been doing this hog raising business for 10 years and she dreams of having a sustainable life in the future for her family. She is a 29-year-old woman and has two children ages three and six months old. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy piglet to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglet.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru is a married mother of three children. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more fish. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosa has been in this business for 31 years. Rosa earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
Ulfat is 22 years old, married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is taking out a loan for her husband, who owns an embroidery materials shop. He has been selling embroidery materials for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover is very high.

Due to high costs, he is unable to purchase expensive materials to sell. Therefore, Ulfat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy embroidery materials. Her husband will buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Ulfat is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy thread, fancy cloth, precious stones, and sequins for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 6 de Enero está en su Primer ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres, donde todas trabajan para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las integrantes se encuentran mejorando su calidad de vida saliendo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes que forma parte de este grupo es la Sra. Lucila, quien vende comidas rápidas que ella misma hace, es muy buena en las comidas que hace, es por eso que le va muy bien y ya tiene muchos clientes. Ella comenta que con su humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir con la venta de sus comidas, como ser: verduras, carne, condimentos, pollos y otros, de manera a poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The group called 6 de Enero (6th January) is in its first loan cycle of the Women's Committee programme, which is where all the women work to be successful. They are taking part in the scheme to eliminate poverty, where the members are improving their quality of life to get above the poverty line.

One of the members of this group is Lucila, who sells fast foods that she makes herself. The food she makes is very good and this is why she is doing so well and has a lot of clients. She says that with her humble job she has the means to be able to give her family a dignified life.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients to be able to continue selling her food, such as: vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken and other goods. Through this she will be able to keep delighting her customers with the delicacies that she makes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken and other products.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soda, sweets, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, sweets, flour and other items. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soap, sweets, flour and other items.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La Señora Edelmira tiene 68 años, está casada, y tiene un hijo ya mayor, que con la ayuda de su esposo ha podido sacar adelante y criarlo.
La Sra. Edelmira se dedica a la Fabricación y venta de carbón hace más de 20 años, por medio de este trabajo es conocida en la zona y está creciendo ampliamente. Es mu luchadora y sacrificada que quiere seguir trabajando y creciendo.
 Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para fabricación de carbón, y de esa forma poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Edelmira is 68 years old. She is married and has an adult son. With the help of her husband, she was able to raise her son and help him to get ahead. 

Edelmira has been making and selling charcoal for more than twenty years. She is well-known locally thanks to this activity, and her business is growing a lot. She is a hardworking and devoted woman, and wants to continue working and growing.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make charcoal, in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make charcoal.

loans.name: Leocardia

texts.en: Leocardia is a married mother of three children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour ,soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more sugar, flour, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Marie Violette

texts.fr: Violette, 39 ans, est veuve. Elle a trois enfants dont elle assure seule la charge. Pour trouver de quoi répondre aux besoins, elle vend des vêtements usagés. Souhaitant améliorer l’activité, elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Violette, 39, is a widow. She has three children of whom she is the sole caretaker. In order to take care of their needs, she sells used clothing. Wishing to improve her business, she is seeking a microloan to augment her stock.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.fr: Ludith, 21 ans, est célibataire. Elle n’a pas d’enfants à charge. Son activité est une petite boutique de produits cosmétiques.  Elle y vend des dentifrices, des savons de toilettes, des déodorants, des parfums, des lotions de beauté, etc. Cela fait déjà un an qu’elle mène cette activité. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock de savons de toilette et de déodorants.
texts.en: Ludith, 21, is single. She does not have any children. Her business consists of a small cosmetics shop. She sells toothpaste, soaps, deodorant, perfumes, beauty lotions, etc. She has been doing this for a year. She needs a loan to augment her stock of soaps and deodorant.

loans.use: to buy soaps and deodorant.

loans.name: Josephine Asiedua

texts.en:
Josephine is a first-year student at the Pantang Nursing and Midwifery Training School, pursuing a diploma in nursing. She needs the loan to help pay her tuition fee.

As a child she always helped people around her whenever she felt they were in need. That has fueled her dream to becoming a professional nurse. Josephine's profession interests her because she will have the requisite skills to really take care of the sick and the needy. She also will be able to financially support her family and other people in the community.

In the near future, she will be a professional nurse. However, without education she cannot realize her dreams and acquire the needed skills to help the sick.

Without this assistance from Kingsbridge, Josephine's only other option would have been to ask family and friends for support, a choice not so reliable.

Josephine said, “Teenage pregnancy is predominant in my community so I think investors should invest more in education to help send more girls to school”.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Elnora is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Elnora has been raising chickens for 10 years and earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Jovenes Artesanos Group

texts.es:
El Comité esta conformado en total por 7 jovenes con aspiraciones, sueños y propósitos por lo cual se están dedicando para poder salir adelante. Es un grupo de jóvenes luchadores que quieren poder crecer para poder ayudar a su familia.
Uno de ellos es Juan, quien estudia y trabaja desde temprana edad se siente inculcado con ejemplos para salir adelante con la ayuda constante de sus padres, proviene de una familia muy humilde.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la venta de productos para la venta, como ser calzados, frazadas, sabanas y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of 7 youth with aspirations, dreams, and purpose, which they are working towards in order to get ahead. This is a group of persistent young men who want to be able to grow in order to be able to help their families.

One of them is Juan, who has been going to school and working from a young age. He feels that the constant help from his parents has given him good examples for getting ahead. He comes from a family of modest means.

He is requesting this loan to invest it in purchasing products that he will then sell, such as footwear, blankets, sheets, and other things. This will allow him to continue working as he has been.

loans.use: to buy footwear, blankets, sheets, and other items.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, tiene un Copetín – Almacén, en frente de su propia casa, prepara comida para los empleados de una recicladora, que se encuentra cerca de su local, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, y es por eso que le va muy bien y ya es muy conocido en la zona.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa como ser: verduras, frutas, lácteos, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the town of Villa Elisa. He has a fast food counter and grocery store in front of his own home. He makes food for the employees of a recycling plant that is very close to his house.

He has earned a living through this work for several years and this is why he is doing well and is very well-known in the area.

He is asking for this loan so that he can invest in ingredients to stock his pantry, such as: vegetables, fruit, dairy products and other items. This means he will be able to continue selling as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to stock his pantry such as: vegetables, fruit, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora Graciela tiene 52 años, está casada, y tiene hijos ya mayores, que ambos con muchos sacrificios pudieron criar y sacar adelante.
 La Sra. Graciela se dedica a la venta y cría de cerdo hace más de 8 años, es conocida en el barrio por su arduo trabajo y su lucha por poder salir adelante.
 Pide este préstamo para la compra de animales para su posterior cría y venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Graciela is 52 years old. She is married and has grown-up children. She and her husband raised them with a lot of sacrifice.

Graciela has been working raising and selling pigs for more than eight years. She is well-known locally, thanks to her hard work and her persistence to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy animals to raise and sell. This will help her to continue with her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 32-year-old, married man from Rafah, Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Omar has a greenhouse in the city for the cultivation of fruits and vegetables. It is a good business and provides him a good income. But the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Omar could not save any funds from last season. He has taken a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouse for this season.

Omar hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouse this season.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
To earn his living, a 53-year-old man from Baybay, Leyte is engaged in a buying and selling business. He is Ronaldo. He has been buying and selling coconut wine and charcoal for almost 15 years to provide for his family's needs.

Ronaldo works hard each day to sustain his family. His wife stays at home and takes good care of their household chores. They raised their 5 adult children through his business of buying and selling.

Ronaldo is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy coconut wine to sell. In the future, he dreams of an upturn in their family's livelihood. He also dreams of succeeding in this business.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
Para la mayoría de los habitantes de una comunidad oaxaqueña, vivir en el campo es trabajar para el campo ya que es una  zona puesto totalmente productora de caña de azúcar. Las grandes estructuras donde se extrae el azúcar son llamados “Ingenios” y la temporada en donde se cosecha la caña es conocida como “zafra”. 
   En dicha comunidad se integró un grupo llamado Alfa y Omega cuyo nombre hace referencia al principio y al final de cualquier cosa, es decir, a la totalidad. Las integrantes del grupo son: Julia y Verónica quienes venden bisutería; Irma, tacos y volovanes; Rosalba, ropa; Minerva, tamales; Guadalupe, calzado; Blanca, comida típica; Lorena, refacciones para motocicleta; Juana, abarrotes y Virginia quien atiende una carnicería.
   Es admirable la unión y fortaleza que mostraron Doña Irma y su esposo Miguel quienes hicieron lo posible para que su hijo tuviera un tratamiento necesario para su salud. Después de aprender la receta para preparar volovanes, se dedicaron a su venta de manera ambulante y tal ha sido su éxito que pudieron abrir una taquería. Los volovanes son elaborados sobre una gran mesa donde Don Miguel convierte la harina en masa y posteriormente moldea para darle su tradicional forma circular. Hoy en día cuentan con varios clientes que acuden hasta su domicilio para degustar de este delicioso producto recién salido del horno; otros esperan en sus casas hasta que pase la camioneta cargada.
   Por otro lado tienen un especial agradecimiento con VF México por los préstamos otorgados ya que han enriquecido su actividad. En esta ocasión les será de utilidad pues lo invertirán en la compra de harina, queso, jamón, mantequilla, chile, bolsas, refrescos, jugos, carne y gas.
   Las ganancias obtenidas fueron invertidas en el tratamiento de su hijo y en comprar un horno, un cajón para tacos, mesas, sillas y, además, desde hace 4 meses inauguraron una refaccionaria. El sueño que tienen en mente es remodelar su casa, comprar una batidora y construir dos locales para sus negocios formando así un patrimonio para sus nietos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Irma quien viste blusa negra con lunares en color gris y falda de mezclilla azul.
texts.en:
For the majority of residents of a Oaxacan community, living in the country means working in the country, since it is an area devoted completely to sugarcane production. The large organizations where they extract the sugar are called sugar factories, and the season in which sugarcane is harvested is known as "zafra".

In the aforementioned community, a group was formed called Alfa y Omega [Alfa and Omega], whose name implies the beginning and end of anything, that is, the totality. The members of the group are: Julia and Verónica, who sell costume jewelry; Irma, who sells vol-au-vents [baked pastry shells filled with meat and sauce]; Rosalba, who sells clothes; Minerva, who sells tamale; Guadalupe, who sells footwear; Blanca, who sells traditional food; Lorena, who sells motorcycle parts; Juana, who sells groceries; and Virginia, who works in a butcher's shop.

The unity and strength shown by Irma and her husband Miguel is admirable, as they did everything possible so that their son could have the treatment he needed for his health. After learning the recipe to make vol-au-vents, they began selling them door-to-door. They had so much success, that they were able to open a food stall. The vol-au-vents are made on a big table where Miguel makes dough out of the flour, and then shapes it to give it its traditional circular shape. Now, they have several customers who come all the way to their house to taste this delicious dish, fresh out of the oven. Others wait at home for the loaded truck to come by.

Irma and Miguel are especially grateful to VF México for the loans, as they have enriched their business. This time the loan will be useful because they will invest it in purchasing flour, cheese, ham, butter, chilies, bags, soft drinks, juices, meat, and gas.

The money they have earned has been invested in their son's treatment, and in buying an oven, a crate for tacos, tables, chairs, and, 4 months ago, they opened a repair shop. Their dream is to remodel their house, to buy a blender, and to build two shops for their businesses, thus creating a legacy for their grandchildren.

* The photograph was taken at Irma's house. She is wearing a black blouse with gray polka dots and a blue denim skirt.

loans.use: to buy:  flour, cheese, ham, butter, chilies, bags, soft drinks, juices, meat, and gas.

loans.name: Los Maseteros Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense muy pintoresca se conservan los cerros repletos de árboles que desde lejos asemejan una espesa selva en medio del mapa.  Gran parte de su población se dedica a la compra y reventa de desperdicio industrial mientras otras elaboran macetas y ollas de manera artesanal.
   Don Miguel es una persona trabajadora, alegre y muy responsable, toda su vida ha dedicado a la alfarería e inició eta actividad elaborando las ollas que se ocupan en las piñatas. Sin embargo, para obtener mejores ingresos decidió implementar la creación de macetas con lo que, desde hace treinta y dos años, se ha convertido en un gran artesano. “Es un negocio muy bueno afortunadamente me va bien, pero un préstamo me ayudaría para comprar pintura para decorar las ollas” comentó. 
   Actualmente tiene siete empleados y su deseo es  producir mucho más mercancía para que sus ganancias aumenten. El negocio se ha visto enriquecido, tanto que ahora exporta sus mercancías a otros  Estados de la República. La única motivación siempre ha sido su familia integrada por ocho hijos de los cuales aún dos dependen de él.
   Las metas que alberga Miguel son poder incrementar su producción para incrementar el número de personas a las que puede ayudar por medio del trabajo. No obstante su sueño principal es que su hija pueda terminar una carrera profesional con la que mejore su calidad de vida.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Adela, Ariel y Alejandra quienes también se dedican a la elaboración de macetas, de ahí proviene el nombre que eligieron: Los Maceteros.
*La fotografía fue tomada debajo del quiosco municipal, Don Miguel es quien viste una chamarra color café.
texts.en:
In a very picturesque Mexican community, the hills are covered with trees that, from afar, appear to be a thick jungle right in the middle of the horizon. A large part of the population here makes a living buying and selling industrial waste, while others produce plant pots and other pots by hand.

Miguel is hard-working, happy, and very responsible. All his life he has worked in pottery having started by making ceramic pots for making piñatas. However, in order to earn a higher income, Miguel also decided to open a plant pot business and so, for 32 years, he has been producing goods by hand.

He says, "Fortunately it's a very good business that is going well for me but a loan would help me to buy paint to decorate the pots."

Miguel currently has seven employees. He wants to produce much more merchandise so that his profits increase. Miguel's business has become richer, so much so that he now exports to other states within Mexico. Miguel's only motivation has always been his family: he has eight children, two of whom still depend on him.

Miguel's goals are to increase production in order to increase the number of people to whom he can offer work. Nonetheless, Miguel's biggest dream is for his daughter to finish a university degree in order to improve her quality of life.

The other members of the loan group are Adela, Ariel and Alejandra, who all have businesses making plant pots. It is from this trade that the group's name was born: "Los Maceteros", or the "Pot Makers":

*The photo was taken by the town bandstand. Miguel is wearing a brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 40 years old. She is a single mother blessed with two children. She has had a farming business for 15 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has borrowed KES 15,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan.

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs and animal feed. She hopes that the anticipated profit will help her to buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, cater for their medical care, expand the current business and repay her loan too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established dairy farming business as her other source of income and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 50 years old, married to Kiprono, and blessed with two children, who are eight years and four years old respectively.

She is a shopkeeper and sells rice, sugar, flour and other shop items. She has been in this business for over nine years now, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000.

This being her eighth loan, she plans to buy goods in bulk and expand her shop. Her dreams are to engage in large scale tea farming to sustain herself financially.

loans.use: to buy goods in bulk and expand her shop

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a Kiva borrower. She has five children.

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital.

Tabitha will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of potatoes.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with three children. She operates a sewing business where she makes tablecloths / table linens. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is the high cost of materials. Her business goal is to have increased profits within five years.

This is Teresia's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials

loans.name: Gargenia

texts.en: Gargenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. Gargenia also earns more income from raising pigs and nipa-roof making.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Gargenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Remideus

texts.en:
Remideus is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Remideus earns more income from goat fattening. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dubal Vladimir

texts.es:
Duval tiene 33 años de edad vive en la comunidad Chazojuan tiene dos hijos, pertenece a la Ventanilla Nuevo amanecer se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de platano, guineo y yuca en unos terrenos de la costa ademas cria pollo y cerdos el dinero lo solicita para la compra de chanchos y balanceados para darles de comer.

las compras las realiza en Echeandia, vende al cerdos a un buen precio, cada seis meses, en los tiempos libres le gusta jugar con los niños y disfrutar mucho con la familia.
texts.en:
Duval is 33 years old and lives in the Chazojuan community. He has two children. Duval is a member of the "Nuevo amanecer" communal bank. He works in farming, growing plantains, yucca and bananas on land by the coast. Additionally he raises pigs and chickens. He is applying for this loan in order to buy pigs and feed for the animals.

Duval will the pigs and feed in Echeandía. He sells the pigs on at a good price every six months.

In his spare time, Duval likes to play with his children and really enjoy his time with his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Daryl

texts.en:
Daryl is 39 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Daryl has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Daryl has been running the general store for one year. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
José, se dedica a vender calzado como sandalias, chancletas y zapatos, sale a vender sus productos en su ciudad y se también se traslada a otras en busca de los tan anhelados ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos, el producto lo compra al mayoreo en los mismos lugares, en la actualidad es soltero y tiene bajo su responsabilidad dos hijos que dependen de él.
Para que su negocio continúe en el mercado solicita un crédito con el que comprara zapatillas, sandalias, chancletas, etc., podrá mejorar el inventario para que su negocio sea más rentable y pueda recuperar la inversión con más ganancias.
Sus proyectos son mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
José works selling footwear, such as sandals, flip-flops, and shoes. He travels around the city where he lives to sell his products, but he also visits other cities looking for the income he needs to fulfill his commitments. He always buys his products to the same wholesale dealers. He is currently single, but has two children who are under his care and depend on him.

He needs a loan to keep his business running. He will use it to buy sport shoes, sandals, flip-flops, etc. He will improve his inventory, which will result in a more profitable business. He will be able to get his investment back and make more profits.

He plans to improve his family’s living conditions and build a house.

loans.use: to buy sport shoes, sandals, flip-flops, etc.

loans.name: Jasmina Mercedes

texts.es:
Jasmina es una mujer de cincuenta y un años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos, los cuales ha logrado sacar adelante gracias a su arduo trabajo, ella se considera una mujer emprendedora, luchadora que no le tiene miedo al trabajo y le apasiona el comercio, posee una tienda en la cual oferta ropa y accesorios para mujeres. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva, su negocio logro crecer notablemente, está profundamente agradecida y creer fielmente en Kiva junto a MiCrédito. 
Fue tan buena la experiencia que tuvo Jasmina con el financiamiento, que ha vuelto a solicitar se le otorgue uno nuevo préstamo para comprar calzado, carteras y maquillajes que vayan acorde a la temporada del año, dado que sus clientes siempre solicitan productos que estén a la moda. En un futuro además de seguir trabajando con préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, se con una tienda mucho más grande e incursionando en otros negocios.
texts.en:
Jasmina is 51 years old. She is a single mother to two children, whom she has helped to move forward through hard work.

Jasmina is enterprising and plucky; she is not afraid of hard work and is passionate about business. She has a shop where she sells women's clothing and accessories. Thanks to her first loan from Kiva, Jasmina's business grew noticeably. Jasmina is very grateful for the loan, and believes in Kiva and MiCrédito.

Jasmina's loan experience was so good that she has come back to applying for another loan. She will use the loan to buy seasonal footwear, purses and make-up as her customers are always looking for fashionable products.

In the future Jasmina would like to continue working with loans and Kiva and MiCrédito, and to do that work with a much larger shop and managing other businesses.

loans.use: to buy footwear, purses and make-up.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
Desde que ves a Roger, podes notar que es un joven muy aplicado y apasionado por lo que hace. Actualmente cursa su último año en la carrera de Contaduría Pública, estudia por las mañanas ya que por la tarde trabaja medio tiempo en una empresa privada, en el área de asesoría contable. Sus padres son su principal apoyo, él pone todo su esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia y retribuirles todo los sacrificios que han hecho por él. 
En estos momentos ha descubierto en Kiva y MiCrédito, una oportunidad a través de un financiamiento, que va a marcar una diferencia en su carrera como profesional, dado que le planea usar este préstamo para comprar una computadora más actual que le permita usar los programas avanzados de contabilidad. En un futuro desea montar su propia empresa de asesoría contable.
texts.en:
As soon as you meet Roger, you can see that he is very dedicated to and passionate about his work. He is currently studying his final year for a degree in public accounting. He studies in the mornings as in the afternoons he works part time as an accounting assistant at a business in the private sector. Roger's parents are his biggest support. Roger puts in all his effort to move forward with his family, and to repay all of the sacrifices that they have made for him.

Roger recently discovered in MiCrédito and Kiva an opportunity for a loan. This will make a big difference in his degree as he will use the loan to buy a more modern computer that will allow him to use more advanced accounting software. In the future Roger would like to start his own business offering accounting services.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 41-years old married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a chicken shop where his daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell it from his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which reduced his purchasing power for new inventory.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy broilers for producing chicken and reselling from his shop. She dreams to provide all the facilities of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy broilers for her husband's chicken selling shop.

loans.name: Laxminarayan Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Ambika, 27, is a humble lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She lives with her husband and infant in a village of Odisha, India. She is a vegetable vendor who manages the household expenses with her household monthly income of INR 5,000. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity.

Joining hands with two others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Ambika has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunities offered, the group now seeks a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these three hardworking, rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Gloria Esinam

texts.en:
“I am Gloria, a student worker at the Pentecost University College, studying Information Technology. The loan is to help pay for my tuition fees.

Having the interest of the nation at heart has been my number one reason for choosing my career path. The completion of my studies would see me up the ranks in the Forces so as to affect certain decisions very well, and to also be at a position where I can support my community financially.

My uncle is my greatest source of inspiration because of his dedicated spirit to the Armed Forces.

I wish to have been rated high in the Armed Forces in the next five to ten years, which also will mean an increase in my salary.”

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Laxminarayan Shg-B Group

texts.en:
The lady standing in the middle in the photograph is Chinmayee. She is 37 years old and from a village of Salepur, Odisha, India. She is a blessed mother of a 5-year-old daughter. She is the victim of rural India's sanitation crisis.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that she does not have access to a latrine and has to compromise her privacy, as she has to depend upon the open field to relieve herself. This makes her more vulnerable to crimes and animal bites.

Therefore, Chinmayee, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a latrine in her house. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick, and it will also result in higher standards of hygiene and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to build a latrine in her house.

loans.name: Meprisane

texts.fr: Meprisane a 42 ans. Elle est veuve et elle a deux enfants. Dans sa petite boutique, elle vend des produits alimentaires et quelques produits cosmétiques. Elle demande un microcrédit pour éviter les ruptures de stock. À l’avenir, elle espère épargner davantage pour l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Meprisane is 42. She is a widow and has two children. In her small shop, she sells food and some cosmetic products. She is asking for a microloan to avoid running out of stock. In the future, she hopes to save more for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Yvelt
