texts.fr: Yvelt a 35 ans. Cela fait déjà 7 ans qu’il a mis sur pied une boutique de revente de boissons. Il y vend des boissons gazeuses et énergisantes.  Père d’un enfant et séparé d’avec sa femme, il travaille sans relâche pour préparer l’avenir de son enfant.  Son rêve est de devenir autonome financièrement.
texts.en: Yvelt is 35. It’s been 7 years since he opened up his beverage shop. He sells carbonated and energy drinks. A father of one and separated from his wife, he works tirelessly to prepare for the future of his child. His dream is to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy non-alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Célimène

texts.fr: Célimène, 23 ans, est célibataire. Elle n’a pas d’enfants. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Cela lui permet de gagner de l’argent pour subvenir à ses besoins et faire un peu d’économie pour l’avenir. Mais elle souhaite que l’activité progresse davantage. Elle demande donc un prêt pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Célimène, 23, is single. She does not have any children. She sells food items. This allows her to earn money to meet her needs and to save a little for the future. She would like her business to grow. She is thus asking for a loan to augment her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy grains and spaghetti.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette a 57 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 3 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Cela fait plus de 15 ans, qu’elle a ouvert une boutique de produits alimentaires dans sa zone. A cause de son ancienneté, elle est très fréquentée dans sa boutique tous les jours. Une activité qui la permet d’élever seule ses enfants en l’absence de son mari décédé. Bernadette désire augmenter son revenu et mieux répondre aux besoins de ses enfants. Voulant exploiter les opportunités qu’elle a dans son commerce, elle a demandé un microcrédit en vue d’augmenter ses marchandises.
texts.en: Bernadette is 57. She is a widowed mother of three, all of whom attend school. More than 15 years ago, she opened a food item shop in her area. Because of her years of experience, her shop is busy every day. This is a business which allows her to raise her children alone in the absence of her dead husband. Bernadette wants to increase her revenue and better meet the needs of her children. Wanting to take advantage of the opportunities she has in her business, she asked for a microloan in order to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cases of soap, deodorant, and beauty lotion.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man with two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

Alex has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is weather changes.

This is Alex's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 110,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en: Petronilla is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another sewing machine. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Nuriwulan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of Ruma's agents, Nuriwulan. She lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband.

Nuriwulan owns and manages a stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. Her husband works as an employee for a private company. She wanted to join Ruma because, as a woman, she wants to both help her husband improve their life and learn about how to manage another business opportunity. She also wants to contribute to her community.

As her business grows, Nuriwulan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, especially on weekends.

Having known about its importance, your loan will be very useful to help Nuriwulan improve her business and, accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Nuriwulan is sitting in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Ginette

texts.fr: Ginette, 36 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a deux enfants qui sont tous régulièrement scolarisés.  Pour prendre soin de sa famille, Ginette vend des produits alimentaires.  Elle a aménagé un espace à son domicile pour loger sa petite boutique pour arranger ses marchandises. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour acheter un stock vin.
texts.en: Ginette is 36 years old and lives in a common law union. She has two children who are both regularly in school. In order to take care of her family, Ginette sells groceries. She converted a space in her home to accommodate a small shop to display her merchandise. She needs a loan to purchase a supply of wine.

loans.use: to purchase wine.

loans.name: Laxminarayan Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Shradhanjali, the lady standing on the right, is a 32-year-old woman living with her husband, father-in-law, and two children in a small village of Odisha, India. She is engaged in a food stall where she sells breakfast and snacks and earns 3,000 INR per month.

She wants to expand her business so that she can make more money and can get her children admitted in a school. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She shares a part of the responsibility for all the family’s expenses.

She, along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR. Shradhanjali will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a refrigerator so that she can store cold drinks and milk-made foods, as they are in more demand among her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator so that she can store cold drinks and milk-made foods.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she cooks bread and cakes to sell. 

She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital.

Nancy will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for making cakes.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Laxminarayan Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Amita is a 34-year-old divorced lady from a village of Salepur, Odisha, India. She is currently living with her son, aged 2 years, and her old parents. She owns and manages a tailoring shop where she stitches clothes for her customers when they place orders for stitching. She stitches salwars, blouses, and suits, all of which are Indian traditional dress clothing, for her customers. She has one sewing machine in her shop.

She has a very good relationship with her customers, but she is not able to take orders in large amounts, as she has only one sewing machine. She has a plan to purchase one more sewing machine for her shop and appoint another person as her helper so that she can take orders in bulk and satisfy her customers.

Amita and her group partner have applied for a loan amount of 30,000 India Rupees (INR). Amita will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a sewing machine and fabric, and for appointing a person as her helper in her shop. She has a dream to have her son study in a good school and to save some money for his higher studies.

In the picture, the lady standing on the right is Amita.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Marie Yolaine

texts.fr: Marie Yolaine a 58 ans. Elle est divorcée et n’as pas d’enfants. Comme activité génératrice de revenus, elle vend des produits alimentaires chez elle. Elle est à la recherche d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock de bonbons et de lait.
texts.en: Marie Yolaine is 58 years old. She is divorced and has no children. As a money-earning activity, she sells groceries in her house. She is seeking a loan to grow her stock of candy and milk.

loans.use: to buy candy and milk.

loans.name: Rosemène

texts.fr: Rosemène est âgée de 47 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a trois enfants à sa charge. Pour trouver de quoi subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des produits alimentaires et des épices à domicile. Elle ambitionne de devenir une grande commerçante dans sa zone. Elle ne rate aucune occasion d’ajouter quelque chose dans son stock pour faire progresser son activité. Elle demande un prêt qu’elle compte utiliser dans l’achat de vivres alimentaires et de haricots.
texts.en: Rosemène is 47. She is in a civil union and has three children to take care of. In order to meet the needs of her family, she sells food products and spices from home. She has the ambition to become a big businesswoman in her area. She never misses the opportunity to add something to her stock in order to grow her business. She is asking for a loan which she plans to use in buying food and beans.

loans.use: to buy food and beans.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.fr: Alicia, 30 ans, vit en union libre et est mère de deux enfants. Elle revend des produits divers (lessives, sucreries, spaghettis et autres produits alimentaires). Elle veut développer son commerce progressivement. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Alicia, 30, is in a civil union and is a mother of two. She sells diverse items (laundry products, sweets, spaghetti, and other food items). She wants to gradually grow her business. She needs a loan to augment her stock.

loans.use: to buy laundry products.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, soap, sweets, bread and other items.

Beatrice has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inflation.

This is Beatrice's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy more flour, soap, sweets, bread and other items for her store inventory.

Her business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more flour, soap, sweets, bread and other items for her store inventory.

loans.name: Achyar

texts.en:
Achyar lives with his wife in North Bogor, located about an hour and thirty minutes’ drive from Jakarta, Indonesia’s capitol. Achyar is an agent for Kiva's field partner Ruma, a business that sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He is satisfied with his job because Ruma supports him by giving him suggestions as to how to improve his business. By being an agent he is also helping his community members who need more access to such services, especially on weekends.

Achyar has applied for a 12,000,000 IDR loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Omm Namaha Sivay Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Lovarani, 33, is an industrious and enterprising lady from an interior village of Salepur, Odisha, India. She is the one standing on the extreme right in the photograph.

Lovarani and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private.

She understands the importance of having a toilet at home and therefore is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR along with her group members. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet. It will be a big step towards a better standard of living for her.

Lovarani is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Omm Namaha Sivay Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Champa is a 48-year-old lady standing in the centre in the photo. She hails from a small village of Salepur, Odisha, India.

Unfortunately, she has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity, because of which she has to face a lot of problems, as she has to travel a long distance to attend nature's call. She has also once suffered from snake bite while she was relieving herself in an open field. But, she could not afford to build a hygienic toilet due to a lack of financial resources.

Champa, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a new, hygienic toilet and reduce the risk of vulnerability and crime. Access to a toilet will also help her to improve her and her family's health.

Champa is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to build a new, hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Diocena

texts.en:
Diocena has been raising hogs for almost six years now. This is her main source of income.

She is married with two children, ages 17 and 20 years old, respectively. She is 49 years of age. Aside from raising hogs, she also grows and sells rice.

Diocena is in need of capital to support her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and additional pigs. With these, she could maximize the resources available and improve both sources of income.

Diocena dreams of handling both sources of income successfully, to continue to support the education of her children, so they have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional pigs.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with two children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a barber shop and has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

This is Jackson's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment

loans.name: Alce Evita

texts.fr: Alce, 52ans, vit avec son mari  et ses enfants à Delmas. Elle a mis sur pied, depuis tantôt 6 ans, une petite librairie. Elle vend des livres scolaires pour enfants de moins de 12 ans. L’activité se révèle très rentable, mais elle n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour l’exploiter au maximum. Elle cherche donc un prêt pour augmenter son stock à l’occasion de la réouverture des classes.
texts.en: Alce, 52 years of age, lives with her husband and her children in Delmas. About six years ago, she managed to start up a little bookstore. She sells school books for children under 12. This activity has proved quite profitable, but she does not have the necessary means to get the most out of it. She is therefore seeking a loan to grow her stock in time for the back-to-school period.

loans.use: to buy school books for children.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is a 35-year-old man who lives in Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has two children, ages 11 and nine years old.

To earn a living, he runs a “karyada business” (a hauling business using an animal such as a horse or a water buffalo to carry the load instead of a truck or jeep). He works hard through this business for almost 10 years. Aside from this, he also runs a hog raising business.

Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy medicines and food for his horse, and he also wants to purchase piglets and feed. In the future, Ronnie wants to have a stable business to give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and food for his horse and to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu has three children. When asked how she would describe herself, she said, “Reliable.”

For the past four years Sikukuu has operated a small shop where she sells bread, flour, sugar, soap and other household items. Her business is located in a residential area, and her main customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital.

Sikukuu has taken out and successfully repaid three prior loans through Kiva's field partner SMEP. She has applied for a 50,000 KES loan to buy more bread, flour, soap and other items to stock her shop.

Sikukuu’s goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes she will live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more bread, flour, soap and other items to stock her shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a Kiva borrower. She has two children.

Janet describes herself as dependable. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, soda, flour, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

Janet will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, soda and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, soda and other items

loans.name: Femmes Actuelles Group

texts.fr:
Korotimi, est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. 

Elle exerce son activité de vente de pagnes (wax, et de bazins) depuis 15 ans. C

Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son accueil des clients, elle vend des articles de bonne qualités avec des prix défiants la concurrence. 

Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 250 000 f cfa de pagne (wax, bazins etc...) et le reste des 250 000 pour le fonds de roulement. L'utilité du prêt c'est d'approvisionner sa boutique afin de renforcer son activité.

Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévue à ACFIME
texts.en:
Korotimi is a married, 43-year-old mother of 3 children who are all in school.

She has been selling pagne cloth (wax and damasks) for the past 15 years.

Her welcoming attitude towards her customers, nice quality pieces, and competitive prices make her business successful.

She is asking for a loan to purchase 250,000 francs of pagne fabric (wax, damasks, etc.) and the rest of the 250,000 francs for working capital. This loan will be used to stock her shop in order to strengthen her business.

She has already received two loans and has reimbursed ACFIME on time.

loans.use: to buy 250,000 francs in 'pagne' cloth (wax, damasks) and the rest of the 250,000 francs for working capital.

loans.name: Naear

texts.en:
Naear is 35 years old. She is a young and energetic woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a garment shop in the nearby market for many years. His shop is situated under the garment market and there are a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers of a profitable price. This competition can become the cause of low sales and more work as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delighting colors of garments in the shop so he can maintain his rate of sales.Therefore, Naear has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a fresh stock of delightful color garments.

Naear hopes that her husband will purchase garments according to his desire at the right time so that he can cope with the market competition and can increase his income as well.

Naear thanks to Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy fresh stocks of delightful color garments for her husband's garment store.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is an amazing mother who lives in Tubas village near Nablus. She has two children and she works hard to ensure a good life for them and to ensure that they do not need for anything. Sana's husband works as an employee, but he cannot cover all the needs of his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can and, because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Sana started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine, yarns and fabrics to increase her income.

She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, yarns and fabrics to increase her income.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 36 years old. He lives in Gurjaani district with his family. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and peach trees. Zurab produces wine to sell seasonally.

Zurab wants to open a bakery and has requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. With the loan Zurab will open a bakery and will bake Georgian bread. This will give him a chance to generate a stable income and improve the living conditions of his family. Zurab awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined.

Juliana operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor business premises.

Juliana will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business to a five-star hotel. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a businessman who describes himself as determined. For the past six years he has sold milk in Mombasa, Kenya. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest challenge to be the high cost of keeping his milk cold.

Said has taken out and successfully repaid two previous loans through Kiva's field partner SMEP. He has now applied for a 60,000 KES loan to buy more milk to sell. He is working to build up his business.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Omm Namaha Sivay Shg-C Group

texts.en: Sanjukta, the lady standing second from left in the first row is a 45-year-old lady who lost her husband three years back. Since then, she has taken on all the burdens of her family. She lives with her daughter, age 22, and her son, age 20. After her husband passed away, she became involved in an agriculture activity. This is not sufficient to manage her family, so she purchased a cow. Now she is taking care of her cow and selling milk in the local market. From this business, she earns 2,000 to 2,500 INR per month. She wants to purchase one more cow and continue her milk business. She has one year of experience in this field and she has time to take care of the cow. Sanjukta, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows. She says that this business can strengthen her economic condition and she can pay her children's tuition. She has a dream of educating her children so they can earn for themselves in the future. She does not want her children to face the same kinds of problems in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows

loans.name: Mogbe

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Mogbe est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin. Avec deux enfants à charge, Mogbe est une femme dynamique qui lutte pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants en préparant de la bouillie faites à base du maïs. Mogbe sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Mogbe répondra favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir ainsi une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Mogbe is a 27-year old married woman  living in Tokoin. She is an energetic person  who works very hard to  ensure the well-being of her two dependent children. 

Mogbe cooks corn porridge for sale. She is seeking this loan to buy bowls of corn. Thanks to her profit margin, Mogbe will be able to meet customer demand and achieve financial autonomy allowing her to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 43 bowls [of corn].

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 26 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He owns a bakery which has been located in his place of residence for 26 years. He has a lot of customers because of the quality of his bread.

He uses the profits that he makes to get ahead on his household expenses. Carlos is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, flavoured jellies, loaf tins and other items, so that he can continue working and have a greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavoured jellies, loaf tins and other items.

loans.name: Angel Octavio

texts.es:
Angel tiene 54 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de platano y guineo ademas se dedica a la criansa de chanchos y ganado el dinero solicita para la comprar de cerdos y alimento como balanceado de engorde y crianza.

las compras las realiza en Echeandia por alli son mas baratos y los vende en la feria de animales en guaranda los domingos a el gusta mucho criar a los animalitos y dice que son parte de la familia, el sueño de Angel tner mayores ingresos para incremetar el negocio, enfrenta desafios como la situacion de las carretaras en donde viven ya que no son asfaltadas y es muy complicado entrar en carro.
texts.en:
Angel is 54 years old and is married with two children. He is a banana farmer who also breeds pigs and cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy pigs and balanced feed for growth and breeding.

These purchases will be made in Echeandia as they are cheaper there and he will sell them at the animal fair in Guaranda on Sundays. He really loves to raise the animals and says they are part of the family. Angel's dream is to have a higher revenue to increase the business. He faces challenges such as the state of the roads where they live because they are not paved and it is very difficult to enter by car.

loans.use: to buy pigs and balanced feed for growth and breeding.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz de 59 años es una microempresaria que emprendió la iniciativa de tener su propio negocio a raíz de sus problemas económicos y para ayudar a su familia; inició como ayudante en unas confecciones, donde le dieron la oportunidad de aprender este arte, de este modo se hizo toda una experta en la elaboración de prendas de vestir para toda ocasión.  Tiempo después y gracias a la experiencia adquirida en su anterior empleo, tomó capacitaciones formales en las que aprendió técnicas más avanzadas de costuras e inició su taller de confección.  Beatriz cuenta con tres años de funcionamiento en su taller y alterno a su actividad principal, alquila lavadoras a sus vecinos y residentes en el sector; ella tomo sus ahorros y compró seis lavadoras, con ayuda de su hijo realiza el reparto de las mismas para los servicios que se le generan diariamente. Sin lugar a la duda Beatriz con ayuda de su familia y su esfuerzo, ha generado bienestar gracias a sus negocios y desea continuar apostándole al éxito, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en tres lavadoras y telas entre otros insumos para la confección.  Esta inversión es muy importante para el progreso de su negocio, porque con ella podrá cubrir la demanda insatisfecha.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar su nivel de ventas y las condiciones de habitabilidad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Beatriz, age 59, is a microentrepreneur who took the initiative to start her own business, because of her economic problems and in order to help her family. She started as an assistant to some tailors, where she received the opportunity to learn this art. In this way, she became an expert in making clothing for all occasions.

A while later, building on the experience acquired in her previous job, she took formal training in which she learned more advanced dressmaking techniques, and she started her own tailoring workshop. Beatriz has been operating her workshop for three years, and in addition to her main activity, she rents washing machines to her neighbors and residents in the area.

She took her savings and bought six washing machines. With help from her son, she distributes them for the services generated each day. Without a doubt, with the help of her family and through her own efforts, Beatriz has generated well-being thanks to her businesses and her desire to continue pursuing success. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in three washing machines as well as fabric and other supplies to make clothing. This investment is very important for the progress of her business, because it will allow her to cover the customer demand that is currently not satisfied. Her goals for the future are to increase her sales and improve the living conditions in her home.

loans.use: invest in three washing machines as well as fabric and other supplies to make clothing.

loans.name: Hugo Ernesto

texts.es:
Hugo, sigue haciendo el negocio de venta de productos para limpieza, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar detergentes para pisos, ropa, vehículos y baños, considera que tendrá mercadería suficiente para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes.
Anteriormente ha utilizados los créditos para mantener su fuente de ingresos, ya que de esta manera le permite mejorar un poco económicamente para pagar sus deudas y dar a su núcleo familiar lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Hugo sells cleaning products and is requesting a new loan to buy enough detergent for floors, clothing, vehicles and bathrooms to meet the needs of his customers.

He has used previous loans to maintain his source of income, as this gives him a little boost to pay his debts and give his family what they need to have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy sufficient detergent for floors, clothing, vehicles and bathrooms to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Ghelha Dei Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 42-year-old rural woman who resides in a village in Odisha, India with her family. She has a family comprised of her husband and two sons. She is the one standing in the middle of the photograph. Saraswati and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. Saraswati understands the importance of having a toilet at home.

She leads a group of two industrious women who have come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them.

loans.use: to build a toilet for increased convinience

loans.name: Philippine

texts.fr: Philippine est une femme célibataire âgée de 40 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Philippine est une marchande de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Philippine demande ce prêt pour commander des unités de jupes et collants afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Philippine, age 40, is a single mother of two who lives in Tokoin. She is a reseller of second-hand clothing that she buys once a month at the market and sells in front of her house.

Philippine is seeking this loan to order skirts and tights. She wants to meet customer demand and earn substantial profits, which will help her to support her children's academic education.

loans.use: to buy 45 skirts and 45 pairs of tights.

loans.name: Ghelha Dei Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Minati, from Salepur, in rural Odisha, has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Minati, her husband and her two children are among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with two others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Minati has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With a toilet in their homes, they will be able to lead a healthier life and save the time they spend on walking long distances to relieve themselves. They seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety. Minati is standing in the middle in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a toilet for increased safety and privacy

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Mère de six enfants, Ayélé est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Ayélé est une revendeuse de sacs et divers qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Ayélé  sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des douzaines de sacs. Ayélé désire avec le bénéfice, rehausser son niveau de commerce et permettre un bon épanouissement et  niveau scolaire à ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a 37-year old married woman with six children who lives in Tokoin She sells bags and miscellaneous items, stocking up at the market three times per year and reselling in nearby neighborhoods as an itinerant vendor. 

Ayélé is seeking this loan to buy dozens of bags. Thanks to her revenue, she would like to expand her business and provide for her children well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy two dozens of bags.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Doña Cruz de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha podidonsalir adelente con su hogar, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que le ha ido muy bien con las ventas y ha tenido buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Cruz is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She owns a small shop which has been located in her place of residence for the last 3 years. She sells a variety of products, such as sweets, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jelly, sugar etc. With her profits she has been able to get ahead with her home.

Cruz is asking again for a loan so that she can buy more merchandise wholesale since she has had very good sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jelly, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Bahrinsa

texts.ru: Бахринса, 49 лет, замужем, есть дети и внуки. В 2005 году она начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. У Бахринсы в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы. Также на участке мерою 2,70 Га земли она выращивает рис для реализации. Супруг предоставляет услуги трактора местному населению. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет примерно 32,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Бахринса обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и сбор урожая экологически-чистого риса. Доходы от кредита Бахринса планирует направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bahrinsa is 49 years old, married, and has children and grandchildren. She started doing agricultural work in 2005. She  owns four cows. On her land plot of 2.7 ha [6.7], she has been growing rice for sale. Her husband provides services as a tractor operator locally. Bahrinsa’s monthly revenue is approximately 32,000 soms (KGS).

In order to develop her business further, Bahrinsa has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy fertilizers and harvest environmentally clean rice. Bahrinsa plans to use the revenues from her loan for further business growth.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for harvesting of eco-friendly rice.

loans.name: Alexi Jeovanny

texts.es:
Alexi, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, debido a que sus padres no contaban con suficientes recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañado, su pareja trabaja en una cooperativa, es padre de tres hijos de 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, solo los primeros 2 estudian y en su casa también vive su madre y dos sobrinas.

Alexi, tiene 15 años de trabajar como jornalero, desde niño su padre le enseño este trabajo y como no tenia otra actividad productiva que le generara ingresos, se dedico a este oficio. El lugar donde trabaja está a 20 minutos de su hogar y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 de la mañana a 1:00 p.m.

Alexi, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas entre estos están: 2 quintales de fertilizantes, una bolsa de semilla de maíz y pagar mano de obra para limpiar el terreno donde cultiva.- Con el crédito podrá comprar los insumos de una vez y mejorar sus cosechas con el fin de obtener más ingresos para los gastos familiares.

Los sueños y aspiraciones de Alexi, es tener una mejor calidad de vida, buena salud, mejor alimentación, mejor vestuario y también ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Alexi, 31 years old, studied until third grade because his parents did not have enough financial resources for him to continue studying. He is married and his partner works in a cooperative. He is also a father of three children aged 10, 8 and 6; only the first 2 study. His mother and two nieces also live with them.

Alexi, has worked as a laborer for 15 years. As a child, his father taught him this job and as he has had no other productive activities that generate income, he has continued with this job. His place of work is 20 minutes from his home and his work schedule is from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm.

Alexi, needs this loan to buy agricultural products such as: 2 pounds of fertilizer, a bag of maize seed and to pay for labor to clear the land where he farms. With it, he can purchase items straight away and improve crops in order to earn more income for the family expenses.

He dreams of having a better quality of life, good health, better food, better clothes and also to help his children to study and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products such as: 2 pounds of fertilizer, a bag of maize seed and to pay for the labor to clear the land where he farms.

loans.name: Yipene Group

texts.fr:
Sidonie, est une femme âgée de 45 ans, mariée mère de 1 enfant scolarisé. 

Elle exerce son activité depuis 15 ans. 

Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son expérience dans la vente des pagnes, son amour du commerce, son dynamisme et son accueille, elle sélection ses clients pour mieux se comprendre.

Elle veut le prêt de 300 000 pour acheter des pagnes tissés afin de ventre.

L'utilité du prêt c'est d'approvisionner sa boutique afin de renforcer son activité.

Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 1 fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Sidonie is a woman of 45, married and the mother of one child who is or has been in school. She has had her business for 15 years. The thing that makes her business do well is her experience in selling pagnes (colorful African print cloth), her love of buying and selling, her dynamism, and her welcome. She selects her clients so as to understand better and be understood.

Sidonie wants her share of the loan, amounting to 300,000 francs, to buy woven pagnes for resale. The usefulness of the loan is to stock her little store so as to boost her business. She has already received a loan one time and reimbursed it on the due date to ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy woven African fabric (pagnes) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cardboard, paper, aluminum and other items to sell.

loans.name: Josefina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Josefina de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene  muchos clientes por los buenos precios, gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor ya que le genera buenos ingresos eonomicos.
texts.en:
Josefina is 40 years of age and lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling clothes for 6 years as a street vendor in different colonies and she has many customers thanks to her good prices. Because of this work, she can manage the household expenses.
She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale clothing to generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Washington Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto es un hombre muy responsable tiene 26 años es soltero tiene un hijo pequeño que no vive con el se dedica a venta de animales como ganado vacuno, cerdos y pollos, el dinero necesita para comprar cerdos, pòllos y alimentos para estoy animales, ademas cultiva pasto para ahorrar alimento para el ganado.

Venda leche a los vecinos de la comunidad, el sueño de Augusto es tener estabilidad economica y asi va hacer muy feliz, en los momentos libres le gusta hacer deporte como el futbool con los amihos de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Augusto, 26, is a very responsible man. He is single and has a young child who does not live with him. He sells animals such as cattle, pigs and chickens. He needs this money to buy pigs, chickens and feed for the animals. He will also cultivate the land for the livestock feed.

Selling milk to the residents of the community, Augusto's dream is to have economic stability and this will make him very happy. In his free time, he likes to play football with friends.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food, beverages, snacks, and other items to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to open a bigger shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en:
The Otinkorang Group is made up of four members. They are from Accra, Teshie, which is part of the capital city of the country. They are characterized as hardworking and responsible with the desire to improve themselves.

Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources to grow their businesses, they currently struggle to get their children ahead and offer them the opportunities that they didn't have. They are into the sale of secondhand clothing, bags, slippers, perfume, earrings, necklaces, roll-on, banku (cooked corn and cassava paste), and fruits.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the representative is Richlove, and she works selling secondhand clothing, bags, and slippers. She works some twelve hours each day selling her products. The business is located on pavement at her residence. She has regular and occasional customers.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing more secondhand clothing, bags, and slippers so that in the not-so-distant future she can get more income. This is her second loan from Kiva. She is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer them to have dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothing, bags, and slippers so that in the not-so-distant future she can get more income.

loans.name: Ghelha Dei Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Kabita, 42, is the lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She is a blessed mother of a teenaged child and wife of a farmer. Her family does not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. Due to a lack of financial resources, she was never able to build a toilet for her home and get access to basic sanitation facilities.

Therefore, Kabita along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR to build hygienic toilets in their respective homes, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: Mariée, Salamatou  est une femme âgée de 52 ans et sans enfant résidant à Tokoin. Salamatou est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises huit fois par mois au marché et le revend  à son domicile. Salamatou demande ce prêt pour commander des cartons de macaronis, le bidon d’huile et le sac de riz en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Salamatou is a married woman aged 52 and childless, living in Tokoin. She sells groceries and restocks her inventory eight times a month at the market, reselling the goods at her home.

Salamatou is asking for this loan so she can order cartons of macaroni, one jerrycan of oil, and a sack of rice so as to have more goods in her inventory and maximize her profit. She wants to help her husband to cover the daily expenditures of the family.

loans.use: to buy one jerrycan of oil, one sack of rice, and two cartons of macaroni.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres sacrificadas que quieren ser alguien en la vida, y se esfuerzan para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo unido y a través de las capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Gabriela, quien vende remedios naturales, tiene todo tipo de remedios naturales que vende de manera ambulante, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, quien comenta que empieza a trabajar todos los días desde muy temprano, donde sale a buscar sus remedios que después vende.
Gabriela pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para poder vender, y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, para poder continuar ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The "Maria Auxiliadora" communal bank is in its sixth season of the women's committee program. They are selfless women who want to be someone in life and they make an effort to help their families by working together and through their training.

One of the members of this group is Gabriela who sells natural remedies. She has all kinds of natural remedies which she sells on the street. She is a selfless woman who starts work very early each day, where she goes out to find remedies to later sell.

Gabriela is requesting this loan so she can buy natural remedies to sell. She hopes to continue with her sales as she has been doing in order to keep helping her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Yola ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas,la socia es una persona trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. 


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the "BUENA VISTA" community bank; this bank is located in the district of Huayopata, belonging to the province of La Convencion and department of Cusco.

The partner is Yola. She is 40 years old, single and has two sons. The partner cultivates fruit and has land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines and oranges. The partner is a hardworking person and a fighter as this has allowed her to bring up her children. She works from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm and already has several years in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her cropland. The partner is asking you for credit to buy seed and fertilizer.

The other partners sell animals, are in the agriculture business, have a grocery store and sell food.

The partner is grateful to those who are part of this dream in this way and agrees to comply with the payment by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 25 years old, married to Bildad, and they have two children aged seven and five years old. She has been in the milk and green tea business for three years now and has been earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. She is a first-time borrower and has requested KES 20,000 to help her increase her stock of milk.

The anticipated profits will be used in paying back the loan and buying food. Anna dreams of having a zero-grazing unit so she can become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married mother of 5 children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothing.

Diana has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of materials for tailoring.

Diana hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Cesar Ernesto

texts.es:
Cesar, es casado no tiene hijos, y no recibe ayuda económica del exterior, su actividad comercial es administrar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, tiene un horario de trabajo de ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, no presenta dificultades por el momento.
En busca de herramientas para presentar un mejor inventario a sus clientes, hace la solicitud de un crédito para comprar boquitas, sodas, pan, dulces, etc., podrá incluir nuevos productos y lograr tener más clientes satisfechos e incrementar sus ganancias.
Los objetivos de Cesar son ampliar su negocio y adquirir un vehículo para desarrollar sus actividades con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Cesar is married with no children, and he doesn't get any external financial help. His job is managing a convenience store. His hours of work are from eight in the morning to four in the afternoon and he has no difficulties at the moment.

In search of tools to present a better inventory to his customers, he is requesting a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, sweets etc. so that he can include new products and achieve greater client satisfaction and increase his profits.

Cesar's goals are to expand his business and buy a vehicle so that he can more easily develop his business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, sweets etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be humble.

She operates a farm where she grows tomatoes and other vegetables to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy seeds and manure. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Luis Cerbol

texts.es:
Luis tiene 50 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la comprar de panela es un producto a base de cañar de azucar, ademas tiene cerdos y ganado vacuno el dinero necesita para la compra de mas cerdos y alimento como balanceado de engordo y crianza para cerdos.

ademas cultiva pasto para ahorrar en la alimentacion del ganado, vende la leche y tambien hace quesos es un muy buen negocios, los vende en la feria de los domingos en guaranda, el sueño de luis es tener dinero para amplicar el negocio ya que le gusta mucho el trabajo, en los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar musica con la esposa.
texts.en:
Luis is 50 years old, is married and has three children. He buys raw cane sugar and also has pigs and cattle. He needs money to buy more pigs and balanced feed for growth and breeding.

He also cultivates land to save on feeding livestock, sells milk and also makes cheese, it is a very good business. He sells them at a Sunday fair in Guaranda. His dream is to have money to expand his business because he really likes his work. In his free time he enjoys listening to music with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and balanced feed for growth and breeding.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cooking fat, rice, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a remote area and her primary customers are locals.

Sophie will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, soap and other items

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marta, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, son padres de tres hijos que están estudiando.

Marta, es dueña de una tienda desde hace ocho años, ella empezó vendiendo refrescos, charamuscas y choco bananos, luego sus amigos y vecinos le animaron a que comprará productos básicos como maíz, frijol, maicillo, arroz y todos los productos de la canasta básica para vender, pero aparte de eso también elabora tortillas de maíz para vender.

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 quintales de maíz, 2 arrobas de arroz, 2 cajas de aceite, 3 cajas de jabón, dos bolsas de suavizante y para reparar los estantes de la tienda.

Los sueños de Marta son, tener un local más grande solo para la tienda, porque el espacio de su casa es muy reduciendo; pero también sueña con darle el estudio a sus hijos, hasta que obtengan un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Marta, 27, studied until fourth grade. She is married, her partner works in agriculture and they are parents to three children who are studying.

Marta has owned a store for eight years. She began selling soft drinks, popsicles and chocolate covered bananas, then her friends and neighbors encouraged her to buy basic items such as maize, beans, sorghum, rice and others to sell, but apart from that, she also makes tortillas to sell.

Marta, needs the loan to buy two sacks of corn, 2 pounds of rice, 2 boxes of oil, 3 boxes of soap, two bags of softener and to repair shop shelves.

Marta's dreams are to have a bigger shop, because the space in your home is very small; but also dreams of her children being able to study to obtain a college degree.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn, 2 pounds of rice, 2 boxes of oil, 3 boxes of soap, two bags of softener and to repair shop shelves.

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna is a 44-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children in a very small village of Parengerpar at Falakata, Alipurduar district. She is a responsible homemaker who looks after her family with great care. Pampa is the second daughter of Jharna. She is 21 years old and pursuing her Bachelor's degree in Arts from Falakata College. She is now in her second year.

Jharna’s husband is involved in a meat business. He is trying very hard to meet their expenses and their daily needs. As the prices of daily goods are increasing day by day, it becomes crucial for Jharna to cover the education costs of her daughter. But she doesn’t want to compromise Pampa’s education for a better future because her other children had to leave their studies midway due to the family’s financial issues. Thus Jharna is seeking economic help from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

Jharna will use the loan amount for purchasing Pampa’s books and other study materials, paying her exam fees, college fees and enrolling her in good private tutoring classes. This help is raising a hope in Pampa to become a nurse in future.

Jharna and Pampa (as in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear the education costs of a Bachelor's degree for her daughter.

loans.name: Fatmawati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of Ruma's agents, Fatmawati. Fatmawati lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Fatmawati owns and manages a stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She wanted to join Ruma because as a woman, she wants to help her husband improve their life and to learn about how to manage another business opportunity, as well as contribute more to her community.

As the business grows, Fatmawati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Fatmawati improve her business and accordingly, help her community who need access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Fatmawati is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as snacks, soups, grains, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
maria es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, gallinas, y cuyes, el dinero lo solica para la compra de chanchos que eso le resulta mas dificil comprar ademas de dedica al cultivo de guineo y necesita para infertir en ferlitizandes para cuidar el cultivo.

el sueño de maria es tener casa propia ya que aun no lo tiene, en los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a fighter and a hardworking woman who breeds pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She is asking for money to purchase pigs as she finds it harder to buy them. She also cultivates bananas and needs to invest in fertilizers to care for the crop.

Maria dreams of owning her own home since she does not have one. She likes to spend her free time with family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells firewood. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood.

loans.name: Yadelcy Del Carmen

texts.es: Yadelcy de 48 años es una comerciante que encontró la manera de ofrecer bienestar a su familia por medio de las ventas por catálogos especializados en cosméticas y cuidado de la piel, ella fue aconsejada por una amiga que realiza la misma actividad y le habló de los beneficios que adquiriría.  Hoy en día cuenta con cinco años de experiencia ofreciendo a sus clientes cremas corporales, cosméticos, splash, colonias, productos capilares y demás artículos de la oferta de la campaña, ella diariamente promueve ventas y sus clientes están ubicados en diferentes zonas de la ciudad.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en un surtido nuevo de mercancías; splash, cremas, cosméticos, colonias y demás productos que mantendrá en un stock con el que responderá a solicitudes de sus clientes y sobre todo por la temporada que se a vecina de amor y amistad en donde prevalecen detalles entre los amigos y los enamorados.  Su meta a futuro es remodelar su vivienda y continuar fidelizando a su clientela con buenos precios y buena atención.
texts.en:
Yadelcy is a 48-year-old businesswoman who found a way to bring well-being to her family by making sales through catalogues that specialise in cosmetics and skincare. She was advised by a friend who does the same job and told her about the benefits that it would bring her.

Currently she has five years of experience selling body creams, cosmetics, body spray, perfumes, hair products and other products that are on offer to her customers. She makes daily sales and her customers are located in different areas of the town.

At the moment she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in a new range of merchandise; body sprays, creams, cosmetics, perfumes and other products. She will keep these products in stock so that she can respond to customer requests, above all during the season of being a neighbour of love and friendship in which details prevail between friends and lovers.

Her goal for the future is to remodel her home and continue building loyalty with her clientele through good prices and good service.

loans.use: to invest in a new range of products; body spray, creams, cosmetics, perfumes and more.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be industrious.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and onions. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PALOMITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de coca, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, venta de computadoras, venta de dulces. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía hace más de dos años, y con la ayuda de su aliga decidió emprender este negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y aceite por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aparecen nueve integrantes porque la señora que esta con gorra blanco y chamarra celeste es la hermana de doña Caren, que vino a acompañar a su hermana al desembolso.
texts.en:
The “LAS PALOMITAS” communal bank is starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office. It is made up of eight members lead by a board of directors with Julia as the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Amongst them are: food sales, selling coca leaves, selling clothing, transportation services, computer sales and the sales of sweets.

The loan they are getting will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs Julia being one. She indicated that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She has a business selling food. She learned the business from an aunt more than two years ago and with the help of her friend decided to undertake this business.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying rice, noodles and oil wholesale) that she will acquire from the vendors in the city of El Alto and later after preparing them will sell in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and oil wholesale.

loans.name: Daniel Joselito

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre muy responsable que vela por el bienestar de la famili el tiene 34 años es casado tiene 6 hijos, el se dedica a la carpinteria es un buen negocios pero adicional a esto desea tener dinero para la compra de pollos para criar en la casa y despues venderla ya que la esposa puede pelarlas y vender por libras y con eso se ganaria un poco mas de dinero.

El sueño de Daniel es ver gradudos del colegio a los hijos y en los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol con los hijos en la cachan de la plaza que es aun de tierra
texts.en: Daniel is a very responsible man who looks out for the wellbeing of his family. He is 34 years old and married with 6 children. He works as a carpenter, which is a good business. Aside from that, he wants to have money to buy chickens to breed at home, and later sell them because his wife can pluck them and sell by the pound. With that, he would earn a little bit more money. Daniel's dream is to see his children graduate from school. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with the kids on the field of the plaza that is still dirt.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Kossiabou

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Kossiabou est une femme mariée avec un enfant à charge vivant à Tokoin. Pour soutenir sa famille, Kossiabou est une tresseuse qui vend des mèches et tissages dans son salon de coiffure en s’approvisionnant sept fois par mois au marché. Kossiabou réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Kossiabou désire ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de mèches  et des boites de gels afin d’agrandir son stock puis gagner des bénéfices et aider sa famille à couvrir les besoins quotidiens et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Kossiabou, age 30, is a married mother to one dependent child, and she lives in Tokoin. To support her family, Kossiabou braids hair and sells extensions and weaves from her salon. She buys supplies seven times per month at the market. She runs a profitable business and is eager to meet the needs of her customers.

To that end, Kossiabou is seeking a loan to purchase dozens of hair extensions and boxes or hair gel to bolster her stock and make more profits. She wants to help her family with their day-to-day needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen hair extensions and 5 boxes of hair gel.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, tiene 46 años, un hijo que culmino este año su bachillerato. Toda una vida de esperanza puesta en este cambio fuerte en su vida, víctima del conflicto armado en su país Colombia. Hoy Ecuador le ha brindado refugio. Cuando  relata su historia, las lágrimas no pueden estar fuera de ella, sin embargo su coraje, su decisión de salir adelante,   demuestra en cada frase, en cada gesto. Ahora quiere que su hijo siga la universidad, y sabe que es la única manera de  salir adelante. Su emprendimiento es un salón de belleza, es estilista. Muy trabajadora, lo hace los 7 días de la semana, solo aspira vivir en paz, construir su vida en Ecuador, aportar a su desarrollo. El crédito le permitirá Comprar la secadora, mesón, espejos, lavadora de cabello, tijeras especiales, set de manicure, y también  mejorar la decoración, para que su negocio sea más atractivo para la clientela.
texts.en:
Isabel is 46 years old and has a child who finished middle school this year. An entire hopeful life put on this road made her strong in life, victim of the armed conflict in her country, Colombia. Today, Ecuador has given her refuge.

When she told us her story, the tears couldn't leave her; however, her courage, her decision to keep going, showed in every phrase, in every gesture. Now she wants her child to go to college and know that that is the only way to change one's life.

Her undertaking is a beauty salon. She is a stylist. Very hardworking, she often does seven days a week. She aspires to live in peace, making her life in our country, contributing to her development.

Her loan is to buy a hairdryer, worktable, mirrors, washing station, special scissors, manicure set, improved decor so that her business will be more attractive for the client.

loans.use: va a comprar secadora de cabello, mesón, espejos, lavadora de cabello, tijeras especiales, set de manicure, mejorar la decoración

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: Olga tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente con dos hijos educando. Ella es propietaria de un  vehículo de transportes  público junto con su esposo. Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar porque sus hijos eran pequeños.  El crédito lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su carro. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Olga es la que viste cafarena azulino.
texts.en:
Olga is 39 years old. She is common-law-married, with two children who are studying. She and her spouse own a public transport vehicle. Years ago, she devoted herself to her home, because her children were little.

She will invest the loan in the maintenance of her car. The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan granted. Olga is wearing the blue turtleneck sweater.

loans.use: EN EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU CARRO

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 33 years old, is married to Eunice and is blessed with two children, Shylinne and Joan, aged seven and two years old.

He has a retail business. He operates a shop in Belekenya town in Kapsabet. Jacob has applied for a loan of 90,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. This is his fifth loan. He has paid back the previous loans successfully. With this loan he plans to buy cooking fat, rice, salt, sugar, flour and maize thereby increasing his stock.

The anticipated profits from his business shall be used to repay the loan, pay school fees and buy food. His future plans are to own a supermarket and to open other outlets in town.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, rice, salt, sugar, flour and maize thereby increasing his stock.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en: Ia is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in Akhaltsikhe district. Nowadays, Ia is unemployed. Her husband works at local petrol station and gets a monthly salary. Ia wants to open a beauty salon and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2500 USD. With the received credit she will renovate a space and will open a beauty salon. Ia will work as a hair stylist in her newly opened salon. She will be able to generate income and will improve the living conditions for her 3 children. Ia is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem is 39 years old, married and has three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She belongs to a poor family, living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells used clothing. He has been running this business for many years.

Her husband's business is unable to generate sufficient income for his family, so it is necessary to grow the business to meet the family's needs. A lack of capital is the major problem for him. Therefore, Naem took out a loan for her husband’s business. With help of this loan, he will purchase more used clothes to sell.

Naeem thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her husband's business selling used clothing.

loans.name: Hayatan

texts.en:
Hayatan is a 26 year old, married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

She aspires to save money for providing a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 26 years old and married with three children. She has had a business selling second hand clothes for six years.

She will be using the loan to purchase stock and hopes this will help her to open a boutique. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock to help her open a boutique in the future.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

Salome hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 2 children. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of items for salon use for offering beauty services.

Susan's business goal is to have more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items for salon use for offering beauty services.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be focused and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married with eight children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, chips, egg, milk, coffee, etc.

Elena has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from furniture making.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
