loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, chips, egg, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell. She supplements her income by running other business ventures like buying and selling fish. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and will use the current one to further build her business. Rosalia dreams that one day she will be able to save money enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell.

loans.name: Olga Katerine

texts.es:
olga es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta trabajar por ella misma es soltera no tiene hijos ella trabaja en un emplesa privada adicionalmente trabaja en el campo se dedica a la siembra de maiz y a la ceranza y venta de cerdos.

El dinero lo solicita para la compra de cerdos y balanceados de engorde para tener mas animalitos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta descanzar y salir a abailar con los amigos de la comunidad en las fiestas.
texts.en:
Olga is an enterprising woman who likes to work for herself. She is single with no children. She works for a private company, and in addition she works in agriculture, growing corn and raising and selling pigs.

She is requesting the funds in order to buy pigs as well as feed to fatten them up, so she can have more animals.

In her free time, she likes to relax and go out to dance at celebrations with her friends in her community.

loans.use: to buy pigs as well as feed to fatten them up.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 36, is married and lives in Baybay, Leyte, in the Philippines. She is in the hog raising business, while her husband works in construction as a mason. They work together to earn a living. Analiza also sells coconut wine for extra income. She dreams of having a sustainable life and, in the future, of expanding her business.

Analiza is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She also says she will use the loan to buy stock for a sari-sari (variety store) as she is planning to start a sari-sari business. This would be a great help for her to increase the family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and stock for a sari-sari.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is a housewife who developed a pig business to support her family's needs. She has three children, two of them already married and the last one still in university. Ni Ketut must work hard to pay for her child's education. To gain more capital and knowledge of the pig business, Ni Ketut and some of her friends formed the Sari Pertami group and she was chosen as its leader. In the group's last loan, Ni Ketut managed her loan and the members began raising pigs and having more income. Their goal is to become successful pig breeders and this was proven by two of them, who earned a satisfactory profit and decided to continue their businesses with their own money.

To increase their businesses, the rest of the Sari Pertami group is asking for a new loan. This time, they will use the loan to purchase superior piglets, feed and vitamins and to renovate the pig pens. Ni Ketut bought a sow with her previous profit and will use her portion of the loan to purchase one more sow. She sells piglets in her village. She hopes her plans run smoothly and she can earn more income to support her child's education.

One member is not pictured in the photo because she had to attend a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase one more sow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals i.e, maize and beans. He has been involved in this business for four years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

His business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming fruit trees in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice and general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leah dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: A villager from a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Em is 51 years old and married.She has six children total, but only one of whom is still dependent on her. The primary source of her family’s income is from cassava planting. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 31 years, they can earn about 15USD per day and manage to save about 5USD each day after expenses. The main challenge for her family’s business is the loss of unhealthy cassava products.Em has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve the financial burden. She is applying for another loan to buy fertilizers for her cassava. She hopes to grow more healthy cassava so as to increase her family’s income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Greetings from Palestine. Mahmoud is a young man who has a barber shop which has been open for the past five years. He has good experience and he is well-known in his city, Rafah. Mahmud loves his job and always thinks of ways to improve it. Mahmoud took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and redecorate his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Mahmoud appears in the photo.Mahmoud thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new tools and redecorate his barber shop.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and the mother of two children. She describes herself as focused and operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for four years and works in a good area where most of her customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient funds. She will use this Kes 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell, and hopes that in the future she will enjoy greater success. This is her first loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a Kiva borrower. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, i.e, maize and beans. He has been involved in this business for two years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

His business goal is to have a big cereals store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will supply cereals to institutions. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Husen

texts.en: Husen is a 47-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day, regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. Because he is not able to save enough money, Husen took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Jose Irene

texts.es:
José, ha tenido un resultado positivo al invertir el crédito anterior en la crianza de cerdos, sus deudas han disminuido, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y su núcleo familiar se mantiene igual, todos se encuentran en óptimas condiciones de salud.
Se encuentra motivado por seguir progresando, por tal razón se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en papas, repollos, remolachas, guineos, papayas, pipianes, entre otros productos para vender por temporada y tener ingresos extra, espera seguir teniendo su negocio junto a la porqueriza.
texts.en:
José had good results from the previous loan's investment in raising pigs. His debt has decreased, his financial situation has improved, and his nuclear family is the same, with everyone in the best of health.

He's motivated to continue making progress, so he decided to request another loan to invest in potatoes, cabbage, beets, bananas, papaya, pipián squash, and other products to sell in season and earn extra income.

He hopes to keep his business along with his pigpen.

loans.use: to invest in potatoes, cabbage, beets, bananas, papayas, pipián squash, and other products to sell in season

loans.name: Lorena Nohemy

texts.es:
Lorena, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, tuvo que abandonar los estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos con los que contaba su familia, actualmente está casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como carpintero y agricultor, juntos tienen tres hijas de 10, 6 y 2 años de edad, son una familia muy unida. 

Lorena, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, pero también le ayuda a su esposo en la carpintería, ya que él le ha enseñado cierto tipo de trabajos que ella puede realizar sin hacer tanto esfuerzo y que no son muy peligrosos para ella.- En época de cultivar maíz y frijol ella le ayuda también a sembrar, limpiar y abonar, debido a que la mano de obra es bastante escasa en su comunidad, los horarios de trabajo de ellos son diversos, porque ella tiene que realizar todas las labores del hogar antes de trasladarse a los cultivos o a la carpintería.

Lorena, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono para aplicarlo a su cultivo de frijol, porque actualmente han sembrado 60 libras de frijol y 10 libras de maíz, con lo cual esperan tener una buena cosecha y darle el alimento necesario a su familia. 

Lorena, desea que sus hijas puedan tener todo el estudio que a ella le fue negado por la falta de recursos económicos, también desea junto a su esposo poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y construir dos cuartos más para sus hijas.
texts.en:
Lorena is 30 years old. She went to school up to the second grade. She had to leave school due to a lack of resources in her family. Now she is married and her husband works as a carpenter and a farmer. Together they have three children, aged 10, 6 and 2. They are a very close family.

Lorena has taken care of the home since she was a child, but she also helps her husband with the carpentry. He has taught her certain jobs that she can do without too much effort and that are not dangerous for her. When it is time to plant the corn and the beans, she also helps him to plant, clear and fertilize, due to the fact that labor is very scarce in her community. Her work schedules are diverse, because she has to do all of the housework before she goes to the crops or to the carpentry.

Lorena needs the loan to buy fertilizer to apply to the bean crop, because right now, they have planted 60 pounds of beans and 10 pounds of corn. They hope to have a good harvest and give their family the food they need.

Lorena wants her daughters to have all of the education that she was denied due to a lack of resources. She also wants to do some home improvements with her husband and build two more rooms for their daughters.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to apply to her bean crop.

loans.name: Darwin Isidro

texts.es:
Darwin, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, dejo de estudiar porque se casó, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, juntos tienen un hijo de 20 días de nacido.

Darwin, actualmente se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de pollos de engorde, a la agricultura se ha dedicado toda la vida y a la crianza de pollos desde hace un año, porque participo en un proyecto con una ONG y ellos le regalaron 150 pollos con los cuales inicio y con las ganancias que adquirió de la venta de ellos continuó con el proyecto, los trabajos los tiene en su casa y el horario del trabajo es bastante variable.

Darwin, tiene 200 pollos actualmente, de los cuales ya está obteniendo una buena producción, él necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado, maya para acorralarlos y comprar 100 pollos más para hacer crecer su negocio y no quedarse sin producción para la venta, porque ya tiene muchos clientes.

Darwin, en un futuro desea poder tener una granja más grande y poder llegar a tener hasta 800 pollos, para que su negocio sea más próspero y tenga las ganancias necesarias para poder darle a su hijo y a su esposa una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Darwin is 21 years old and studied up to first year of secondary education. He quit school as he got married. His wife does housework. Together they have a 20 day old baby.

Darwin presently works in agriculture and raising broiler chickens. He has worked in agriculture all his life and raising chickens for one year. He participated in a project with a NGO and they gave him 150 chickens to start with. And he continued the project with the profit that he got selling them. He does this work at his house and his hours vary a lot.

Darwin currently has 200 chickens and he is seeing good production. He needs the loan to buy concentrated feed, wire mesh to pen them and buy 100 more chickens to grow his business. He doesn't want to be without product to sell as he now has lots of customers.

Darwin, in the future, wants to have a larger farm and be able to have up to 800 chickens. Then his business would be more prosperous and provide the profit needed to give his wife and child a good quality of living.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, wire mesh to pen them and buy 100 more chickens to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 7 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa de su madre con su madre y su hermano, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The young woman, who has had her face pixelated for being 20 years old and living in a high-risk area, has made a living selling clothes for 7 years. Her business is located in the municipal market and she has many clients. With the sales she makes, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. The young woman lives in her mother's house with her mother and brother. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more clothes wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and be able to have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is a 30 year old who works hard to support her family. She is working in a hospital. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of her brother's education.
This loan of $1,000 will allow Fernanda to help her brother graduate from university. She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. Fernanda loves her brother very much. She hopes that in the future he will be able to work in the government, in agriculture, or in a business.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman, with 2 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for 6 years.

Her primary customers are locals, and her biggest business challenge is a lack of enough capital. She will use this loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy more clothes to increase stock for her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase stock for her business.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a married man, with 3 children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a retail business where he sells spare auto parts. He has been involved in this business for 15 years, and his primary customers are locals.

Morris describes his biggest business challenge as being a lack of sufficient capital. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more spare auto parts to increase his stock. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to stock up on spare auto parts for his store.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 45 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school, and she works in the food business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of root crops to sell for her business. She has been in business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, Melinda would like to build and expand her business to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of root crops to sell for her business

loans.name: Lucia Marlene

texts.es:
lucia es casada tiene dos hijos es una mujer que le guta trabajar en el campo, a demas le gusta mucho los animales, por tal razon se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ganado y cuyes el dinero lo solicita para la compra de animales como cerdos cuyes y pollos y para alimento como son balanceados de crianza y de engorde.

En los tiempos libres le gusta estar en familia conversar y reirse de las cosas gocosas que han vivido.
texts.en:
Lucia is married and has two children. She is a woman who likes to work in the countryside, and, in addition, she likes animals very much. For that reason, she dedicates her time to raising pigs, cattle, and guinea pigs.

Lucia is requesting a loan to purchase animals, especially pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens and, also, to buy feed for raising and fattening them.

In her spare time, Lucia likes to be with her family, conversing and laughing about the enjoyable things she has experienced in life.

loans.use: buy pigs, guinea pigs and chickens, and purchase the feed required to fatten them.

loans.name: Rebeca Marina

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está soltera, su familia se conforma por su mamá y sus 3 hermanas que están estudiando.

Rebeca, es la más sobresaliente de su familia, actualmente se dedica a dar clases a niños en un grupo comunal que le paga por prestar sus servicios, decidió dedicarse a esta labor por la vocación de servicio que la caracteriza, es por eso que pretende seguir trabajando para ayudar al desarrollo de su comunidad; para llegar al lugar de trabajo se tarda aproximadamente 15 minutos; pero además de dar clases, Rebeca junto a su familia se dedica a sembrar cultivos de maíz y frijol, para disponer de sus propios alimentos para su familia.

Rebeca, sabe que la escasez de agua cada vez es mayor y que los cultivos no pueden quedarse sin el vital liquido por mucho tiempo, pero ahora con la llegada de la temporada lluviosa, ella quiere aprovechar el recurso para sembrar sus cultivos anuales, pero no dispone del dinero suficiente para invertir en agricultura; es por eso que decidió solicitar un préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y fito-sanitarios para cultivar el suelo y obtener su propia alimentación.

Los sueños y aspiraciones que Rebeca tiene son, seguir estudiando en la universidad, para obtener un titulo que la certifique para trabajar plenamente con maestra graduada; además quiere que sus hermanas estudien y obtengan lo que se proponen.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 20, studied up to the third year of high school. She's single and her family is made up of her mother and her three sisters, who attend school.

Rebeca's the most distinguished one in her family. Currently she earns a living teaching children in a group, and she's paid for providing her services. She decided to devote herself to this job because she's known for her vocation to service. That's why she wants to keep working to help her community develop. It takes her about 15 minutes to get to work.

In addition to teaching classes, however, Rebeca grows corn and bean crops so she has her own food for her family. Rebeca knows the water shortage is getting worse all the time and the crops won't remain for long without that vital liquid. With the arrival of the rainy season, though, she wants to make the most of the resource to plant her annual crops, but she doesn't have enough money to invest in agriculture. This is why she decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to work the land and grow her own food.

Rebeca's dreams and aspirations are to keep studying in the university and get a degree that will certify her to work as a fully degreed teacher. She also wants her sisters to go to school and complete what they set out to do.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for preparing the land

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She has one child. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Santos Evelyn

texts.es:
Santos, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura; tiene dos hijos de 2 y 3 años de edad.

Santos, es ama de casa, toda su vida ese ha sido su oficio, pero los domingos hace enchiladas, pastelitos de carne, tostadas y empanadas de plátano para ir a vender a la cancha de fútbol, de esa manera aporta un poco de dinero para cubrir los gastos de su casa.

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sembrar como: semilla, abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y para cancelar la mano de obra que le ayudara a su esposo a sembrar.

El sueño de ella, es tener una tienda donde se tenga todo lo necesario y básico para el hogar.
texts.en:
Santos, 28 years old, studied up to the third year of college. She is currently married and her husband works in agriculture. She has two children who are two and three years old.

Santos is a housewife. This has been her place for her entire life, but on Sundays she makes enchiladas, meat pies, tostadas, and banana empanadas to sell at the soccer field. This is how she is able to earn some money in order to cover household expenses.

Santos needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seed, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay the laborers who helped her husband plant seeds.

Her dream is to have a store that has all the basic necessities for a home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Existe una comunidad veracruzana cuya principal actividad económica es la ganadería, allí no sólo se produce carne de primera calidad sino también leche y sus derivados. Para los habitantes es tan importante dicha actividad que cada año se realiza la “Feria ganadera” en donde se dan cita gente local y foránea para disfrutar de eventos y competiciones.
   El grupo Perseverancia es originario de la región antes mencionada y  los integrantes eligieron ese nombre pues quieren superarse pese a cualquier obstáculo. El grupo lo integra: Ma. De Lourdes quien vende postres; Gregoria y Rosa, abarrotes; Nayeli y Ricarda, comida; Marta, tortillas; Lucia, bisutería; Alejandro, zapatos; Melvi y Jessica, ropa; Sara, material para construcción y Margarita quien maneja una refaccionaria. 
   Doña Marta tiene veintidós años al frente de su negocio que consiste en elaborar y vender tortillas “a mano”, es decir, que la producción es totalmente manual y cocida sobre un comal. Su actividad ha rendido frutos ya que en la localidad hay pocas personas dedicadas a ella, sin mencionar que las tortillas de Marta tienen un sabor único que ninguna máquina puede igualar. Desde los ocho años de edad aprendió a elaborar las tortillas como es costumbre en la comunidad y nunca imaginó que esto le daría tantas satisfacciones en la actualidad. 
   Trabaja desde muy temprano, así tiene el producto listo para cuando los trabajadores pasan a su negocio por las tortillas que degustarán en el refrigerio de sus trabajos. Cabe mencionar que una vez cocinadas las tortillas, son envueltas en servilletas bordadas artesanalmente por Marta misma. Algunos de los objetivos alcanzados has sido adquirir un local fijo, solventar la educación de sus hijos, comprar un refrigerador y un molino nuevos además de invertir en costuras para sus bordados que también pone a la venta.
   En esta ocasión comprara maíz y un par de piedras para el molino continuando, ya que su producción es de 30 a 40 kilos de masa utilizada al día. Los clientes sienten mucha confianza en acudir a su negocio pues, además de la calidad, la atención de Marta es excepcional. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el local de Doña Marta quien sostiene una tortilla en la mano.
texts.en:
REVISED

In Veracruz, there is a small community whose main economic activity is cattle raising. Top-quality beef as well as milk and dairy products are produced in this area. Such economic activity is so important to the inhabitants that every year they celebrate the "Feria Ganadera" (Livestock Fair), where locals and foreigners get together to enjoy the events and take part in the competitions. 

The Perseverancia Group is from the above mentioned region. Its members chose that name because it reflects their desire to get ahead in spite of the obstacles. The group's members and their occupations are the following: Ma. De Lourdes sells desserts; Gregoria and Rosa, groceries; Nayeli and Ricarda, food; Marta, tortillas; Lucia, costume jewellery; Alejandro, shoes; Melvi and Jessica, clothing; Sara, building materials; and Margarita runs an auto parts store.

Marta has been running her business for 22 years now. She sells handmade tortillas. This means that she makes her tortillas entirely by hand and cooks them on top of a "comal" (a metal hotplate for cooking tortillas).   

Her business has been successful because few people make and sell tortillas in her neighbourhood. In addition to this, Marta's tortillas have a unique flavour that no tortilla machine can match. She learned the trade when she was eight years old, as it is customary in the community, but she never imagined that this skill would bring her so many rewards today. 

She starts working very early in the morning to have her product ready for when the workers stop by her business to buy the tortillas that they will eat during their lunch break. 

It's worth noting that once the tortillas are cooked, they are wrapped in napkins that Marta has embroidered herself. 

Some of the goals that she has already achieved include acquiring a permanent stand, paying for her children's education, buying a new refrigerator and a new mill, and investing in sewing supplies for her embroideries, which she also sells.

This time she will buy corn and a couple of millstones to keep her mill going because she produces between 30 and 40 kilos of tortilla dough every day.  

Marta has earned her customers' trust because, in addition to the quality of her product, she provides them with an excellent customer service.

*The photograph was taken at Marta's tortilla stand. She is the one holding a tortilla in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase corn and millstones.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower, and she has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour and other items, and she has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient capital.

Esther will use this 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business, within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big shop. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Farida is in her mid 30s and is married. She has three children; two are in school while one is still too small. She has been running a genge business (grocery stall) for ten years now. She works from 6 am to 2 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Farida's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her genge. She dreams of expanding her business.

Farida will share this loan with the two other members in her loan group, Trust. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her genge (grocery stall).

loans.name: Gabriela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gabriela le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo ademas le gusta criar a los animales por lo que como ingresos para la casa se ha dedicado a la crianza de cerdos, gallinas, ganado vacuno ademas siembra pasto para alimento del ganado.

El dinero solicita para la compra de chanchos y alimento para todos los animalitos para engorde y crianza.

Las ventas las realiza en la feria de guaranda y san lorenzo, en los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Gabriela enjoys working in the field. She also likes raising animals so, in order to earn an income for her household, she dedicates herself to raising pigs, chickens, cattle, and plants grass to feed her livestock.

The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of pigs and animal feed to fatten them and breed them. She sells in the markets of Guaranda and San Lorenzo. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed to raise them

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, logro estudiar hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a las tareas agrícolas para producir sus propios alimentos, tienen 5 hijos, pero dos ya están acompañados, solo viven 3 en su casa y asisten a la escuela de su cantón.

Maximina, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero hace poco tiempo decidió colocar una venta de pupusas en su hogar y le está dando buenos resultados porque ya tiene muchos clientes por su amabilidad.- Pero a pesar de eso no descuida las actividades agrícolas y siempre le ayuda a su esposo a trabajae la tierra.

Maximina, solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y productos para proteger los cultivos de plagas y enfermedades y pagar mano de obra.- Con este préstamo se contribuirá al desarrollo de su familia.

Maximina, pretende establecer una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y para el negocio de pupusas quiere comprar otra plancha, porque la que tiene es pequeña y la demanda es alta.
texts.en:
Maximina, 43, is a tenacious and enterprising woman. She was able to attend school through the third grade. She is in a relationship, and her partner works in agriculture to raise their own food. They have five children, but two of them have partners, and only three live at home and go to the local school.

Maximina is a homemaker, but recently she decided to start selling pupusas in her home. She is getting good results, since she has many customers now due to her friendliness. Despite that, though, she does not neglect the agricultural work. She always helps her husband work the land.

Maximina is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and products to protect her crops from disease, and to pay for labor. This loan will contribute to her family's development.

Maximina plans to open a staple goods store, and she wants to buy another griddle for her pupusa business, because the one she has is small, and demand is high.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and products to protect her crops from disease, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José, de 45 años de edad, está acompañado, es padre de 4 hijos de 21, 18, 15 y 16 años de edad, de los cuales 3 estudian y solo el mayor trabaja junto a él y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, se dedica a trabajar de jornalero en una finca de café, siempre ha trabajado de jornalero porque su padre lo llevaba al campo y fue así como obtuvo experiencia, ahora ya tiene 15 años de trabajar en las fincas de café y es de este trabajo de donde puede obtener ingresos económicos para poder darle lo necesario a su familia, él trabaja ocho horas diarias, desde las siete de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, pero además de dedicarse a esta actividad también se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra granos básicos como maíz y frijol.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar 4 quintales de abono fertilizante y pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra donde sembrará, de esta manera pretende obtener buenas cosechas.

José, sueña con expandir más sus cultivos y poder ampliarla más su casa y además desea que sus hijos puedan estudiar para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Jose, 45, is a married father of four. His children are 21, 18, 15, and 16. Three of his children are in school, his oldest works with him, and his wife does domestic tasks. Jose earns his living as a laborer on a coffee farm. He has always worked as a laborer because his father took him to the fields and that's where he gained experience. He now has more than 15 years of experience working on coffee plantations. This work provides the income necessary for his family's necessities.

He works 8 hours daily from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon. He also engages in other activities. He also earns a living through agriculture, specifically planting basic staple crops like corn and beans. Jose needs a loan to buy four quintals of manure and pay laborers to help prepare his fields where he will plant. He seeks to obtain a good hearvest. Jose's dream is to increase his crop yield and expand his home. He wants his children to study so that they can learn to be good people in society.

loans.use: to purchase 4 quintals of manure and pay laborers to prepare his field for planting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Jenny Fernanda

texts.es:
jenny es soltera aun no tiene hijos vive feliz con su madre ella no tiene un trabajo estable por lo que que busca la forma de ayudar con los gastos en la casa, por lo que se ha dedicado a la crianza de chancos, pollos cuyes, y patos, el dinero lo socita para la compra de chanchos y para alimento para los animales como morocho, herba, balanceado.

En los tiempos libres se dedica a la salir con las amigas de la comunidad ademas le gusta bailar musica nacional se mueve muy bien.
texts.en:
Jenny is single and does not yet have children. She lives happily with her mother. She does not have a stable job. For this reason, she seeks a way to help with the household expenses, and so she has raised pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and ducks. The money that she is applying for is for the purchase of pigs and feed for the animals such as corn, grasses, and balanced feed.

In her free time, she likes to go out with friends from the community. In addition, she likes to dance to Ecuadorian music. She dances very well.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for the animals, such as corn, grasses, and balanced feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, necesita de un crédito para comprar una maquina coser nueva y también dará mantenimiento a tres que ya tiene, la finalidad es mejorar el equipo de trabajo en la sastrería para desarrollar sus actividades y satisfacer las peticiones de sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ha dado las oportunidades de continuar dando el servicio de sastre, sus ingresos han tenido una mejoría y los ha invertido en el pago de la deuda, ha hecho mejoras a su casa y puede dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Maria needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine and also to maintain the three machines that she already has, with the goal of improving the work equipment in her tailor shop in order to develop her business and satisfy the requests of her customers.

The previous loan gave her opportunities to continue giving tailoring services. Her income has made an improvement, and she has invested in paying off the debt. She has made improvements in her house and can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and also to maintain the three that she already has, with the goal of improving her work equipment in her tailor shop in order to develop her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a Kiva borrower. She has two children and describes herself to be ambitious. For the past ten years, Regina has operated a retail business selling vegetables. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. Regina describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

Regina will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is Regina's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 33 years old, is married and has four children. He has had a motorcycle business for six years. Joseph will be using the loan to  complete payment for another motorcycle and hopes this will help him educate his children. His hope and dream for the future is to open other businesses, among them farming.

loans.use: to  complete payment for another motorcycle to help him educate his children.

loans.name: Christian Daniel

texts.es:
Christian tiene 24 años de edad es soltero se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales de corral como pollosy necesita dinero para incremetar el negocio para comprar ganado vacuno y para vacunas ya que son animales de mucho cuidado. Las ventas las realiza en las ferias de guaranda, el sueño de el es tener mayores ingresos para poder viajar fuera del pais.

En los tiempos libre le gusta visitar a los animalitos para ver como estan.
texts.en:
Christian is 24 years old. He is single, and he sells and raises barnyard animals such as chickens. He needs money to expand his business by buying beef cattle and vaccines, since they are animals that require much care. He makes his sales at the fairs in Guaranda. His dream is to have better income in order to be able to travel outside the country.

In his free time, he likes to check on the little animals to see how they are doing.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle and vaccines

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent decided to open up his computer technology business after he graduated college in 2014. His business specializes in computer networks, wire installation, computer repair/ upgrade, and virus removal. Before opening up his business, Vincent worked closely with a friend that owns the same kind of business. One day he realized that there was a need for similar computer technology services on the other side of town.

Vincent is originally from Virginia. He lives at home with his girlfriend and her 13-year-old son. He currently has two employees and often subcontracts jobs to well-known colleagues when business is busy. Vincent’s greatest success has been his ability to solve a problem for every client that has stepped foot in his door. The largest difficulty he has faced are ones that come with owning a new business. There are times when clients do not step into his business or call for service two or three days at a time.

Vincent offers his services from both his storefront and through on-location assistance. He hopes to be able to financially sustain his family through his business and someday be able to employ more staff. He is currently seeking a loan to help make his storefront handicapped-accessible and purchase additional shelving for his office.

loans.use: to make his storefront handicapped-accessible and purchase additional shelving for his office.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Kiva borrower. He has three children and describes himself to be hardworking. For the past three years, John has operated a retail business selling vegetables. His primary customers are locals. John describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

John will use the KES 15,000 loan to pay school fees for his children. He hopes that, in the future, he will be financially stable. This is John's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Bellarosa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Bellarosa works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and a general store. Bellarosa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Bellarosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past thirty-six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and is 46 years old.

She has a shell craft business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shell coveer, and other supplies to use in her business.

Shirley has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shell cover and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Jefferson David

texts.es:
Jefferson tiene 18 años de edad es soltero vive con los padres, el ayuda con los gastos de la casa por lo que el se apuesto su propio negocios como son la crianza de pollos, chanchos, y ganado el dinero solicita para la comprar de pollos y ganado y para alimento para los animales como son balanceados y morocho.

El sueño es tener dinero para la comprar una casa para los padres ya que siempren han vivido pagando el arriendo. En los tiempos libres se dedica a hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Jefferson is 18 years old. he is single and lives with his parents. He helps with the household expenses by starting his own businesses raising chickens, pigs and cattle. The money he is asking for is to buy chickens and cattle for the animals, such as balanced feed and corn.

His dream is to have money to buy a house for his parents, since they have always rented. In his free time, he plays sports with his friends from the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cattle as well as feed for them, such as balanced feed and corn.

loans.name: Onua Do1 Group

texts.en:
The Onua Do1 group is made up of three members. They are from Teshie, Accra, which is part of the capital city of the country. The group members are characterized as hard working and responsible with the desire to improve themselves.

Sadly, they lack the financial resources to grow their businesses. Currently, they struggle to get their children ahead and offer them the opportunities that they didn't have. Their jobs include selling soft drinks, vegetables, charcoal, cassava dough, corn dough and gari (cassava flour) and working at a local food joint (banku (cooked corn and cassava paste), okro stew).

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the representative is Patience, and she works selling charcoal, gari (cassava flour), cassava dough and corn dough. She works approximately ten hours each day selling her products. She sells her products door to door to meet her customers. She has regular and occasional customers. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing more charcoal, gari (cassava flour), cassava dough and corn dough so that in the not-so-distant future she can get more income.

She is very grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to them allowing them to have dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, gari (cassava flour), cassava dough and corn dough so that in the not-so-distant future she can earn more income.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia started her business 18 months ago. The inspiration to start her business came from her participation as a member of her flying club. When she improved her loft so that her club could take better care of their pigeons, she realized that she could make her passion fruitful by capitalizing on her reputation and commitment to the flyer club community. After this realization, Claudia decided to become a distributor of pigeon seeds and cater to her flying community and many others throughout the east coast.


Claudia's business specializes in the distribution of pigeon seeds. She takes orders from clients and then orders from suppliers. The supplies include seeds, vitamins, olive oil, and any other item needed for the well-being of pigeons. She is currently seeking a loan to increase her inventory and to also purchase products necessary to take good care of her birds. Her vision for the the future is to become one of the top suppliers in the flyer club community in the east coast.

loans.use: to increase inventory and purchase products necessary to care for the flyer club's birds.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra started driving before age 21 and fell in love with the road. She had a great appreciation for the sense of freedom it gave her. She is a first generation Dominican American and she started her business with her 401 K money she had gathered from her previous job.

Alexandra owns a small trucking company that operates six tractor trailers with three employees. The largest difficulty she has had in running her business has been being a minority woman in an industry that is predominantly male. Her greatest success, however, has been being able to build a professional and good reputation for her company.

Alexandra is currently seeking a loan to buy truck parts that will ensure that her equipment stays up to date so that her company can remain competitive.

loans.use: to buy truck parts that will ensure that her equipment stays up to date so that her company can remain competitive.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, 29 years old, is married to Julius and blessed with two children, 13 and 10 years old. For the past three years, she has sold milk in Kapsabet, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Irine has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan. She intends to add more stock of milk to enable her to increase her income. Irine's dream is to have tenders in the nearby schools to stabilize her finances.

loans.use: to add more stock of milk to enable her to increase her income.

loans.name: Emilliana

texts.en:
Emilliana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emilliana is 55 years old.

Emilliana has a buy and sell plants business in the Philippines. Emilliana requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more plants, fertilizer, and other supplies needed in her business.

Emilliana has been in this business for 42 years. In the future, Emilliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more plants, fertilizer, and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Erra Grace

texts.en:
Erra Grace is 24 years old and married with two children. Erra Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Erra Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as personal care products, home care products, and other supplies.

Erra Grace has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Erra Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as personal care products, home care products, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maribel is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maribel has a shell craft business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy shells, covers, and other supplies to use in her business.

Maribel has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shells, covers, and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is a married mother of 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Malo has a computer shop business in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 loan PHP amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy a monitor and mouse, as well as other supplies needed for her business.

Malo has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Malo would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a monitor and mouse, as well as other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Narsana

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Narsana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Narsana is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, gasoline, rope, etc., for her fishing business.

Narsana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, gasoline, rope, etc.

loans.name: Wallis

texts.en:
When Wallis was a personal trainer she realized that stretching and teaching clients to stretch was the most important part of her work. As she continued to get several certifications in Active Isolated Stretch, she became more involved in the process of stretching her clients.Many of her clients shared with her that stretching was making a noticeable difference in their body and health. Such improvements motivated Wallis to develop Body Stretch Therapy in 2013.

Wallis' greatest success thus far has been the amazing testimonials she continues to receive from her clients. Some clients come to her because they are suffering from stiffness, tightness, and lack of movement. As a result of her work, they are able to move more fluidly and consequently are in better spirits.

Wallis is currently seeking a loan to hire an additional stretch therapist and invest in marketing. She would like to reach the public about the benefits of her work.

loans.use: to hire an additional stretch therapist and invest in marketing

loans.name: Del Valle Group

texts.es:
En una pequeña colonia  donde la sombra de los arboles es el cobijo de los pobladores durante el día y por las tardes un lugar agradable para disfrutar de juegos de mesa en familia es ahí donde se ha formado un grupo el cual lleva por nombre Del Valle  por ser este el nombre de la colonia, las integrantes del grupo son mujeres emprendedoras y han iniciado su propia actividad, ellas son:

Guadalupe,  Matilde - Pollo
Karina – Frutas Y Verduras 
Deysi – Pollo, Tamales Y Gelatinas 
Fabiana-Abarrotes
Jamileth – Zapatos 

Fabiana es una de las integrantes del grupo, está casada con don Martin, doña Fabi como todos le conocen  es madre de dos jóvenes el mayor de 20 años y el menor de 17, ella estudio hasta segundo año de primaria por lo que aprende día con día con sus hijos mientras ellos realizan sus tareas, hace 4 años inicio con su venta de dulces para ello colocaba una mesa fuera de su casa donde acomodaba los dulces, totis, chicharrones, salsa y con las ganancias obtenidas comenzó un ahorro para poder hacer realidad sus planes, al recibir  su primer préstamo otorgado por Visión F México logro hacerlo realidad e iniciar con su tienda de abarrotes invirtiendo en la compra de anaqueles , una báscula, arroz, azúcar, frijol, sopa, café, leche.

Poco a poco apoyada de las ganancias obtenidas y los préstamos que ha recibido ha logrado ampliar el surtido  ofreciendo huevos, frijol, azúcar, arroz, atún, sardina, mayonesa, media crema, leche, queso, jamón y salchicha.

Para doña Fabi los prestamos han cambiado su vida pues le han permitido obtener más ganancias, espera pronto poder construir un local pues la mercancía esta acomodada en la que antes era la sala de su casa, en esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, aceite, frijol, azúcar, papel higiénico y detergente  siendo los productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

“Estoy feliz por el éxito de mi tiendita, por el apoyo incondicional de mi familia, por la gran bendición que dios me ha dado, agradezco a quienes hacen posible nos sean otorgados los prestamos”

El grupo agradece a VFMéxico y KIVA por la cada oportunidad brindada en nuevos préstamos.

*Ellas son las integrantes del grupo, doña Fabi es quien viste blusa color roja con pantalón café.
texts.en:
In a small community where the shadow of the trees blankets the residents during the day and the afternoon is pleasant for enjoying board games with the family--that's where a group was formed with the name Del Valle, because that's the name of the community. The members of the group are enterprising women who have started their own businesses: Guadalupe and Matilde, chicken; Karina, fruits and vegetables; Deysi, chicken, tamales, and gelatin; Fabiana, groceries; and Jamileth, shoes.

Fabiana is a member of the group. She's married to Martín. Fabi, as she's known, is the mother of two young men; the older one is 20 years old and the youngest is 17. She went to school up to the second year of elementary school, so she learns every day with her children as they do their homework.

Four years ago she started selling candy, for which she set up a table outside her house to display the sweets, Totis-brand snacks, chicharrones, and salsa. With her earnings she started to save so she could carry out her plans. When she got her first loan from VisionFund Mexico, she managed to make her plans a reality. She started with her grocery store, investing in shelves, a scale, rice, sugar, beans, soup, coffee, and milk. Little by little, supported by her earnings and the loans she has received, she has managed to increase her stock. She sells eggs, beans, sugar, rice, tuna, sardines, mayonnaise, light cream, milk, cheese, ham, and sausage.

The loans have changed Fabi's life because they have allowed her to earn more income. She hopes that soon she can build a store, because her merchandise is set up in her house in what used to be the living room. This time she'll invest the loan in buying rice, oil, beans, sugar, toilet paper, and detergent--the products in greatest demand among her customers.

"I'm happy about the success of my little store, about my family's unconditional support, and about the blessing God has given me. I thank those who make it possible for us to be granted loans." The group is grateful to VF Mexico and Kiva for every opportunity offered by additional loans.

They are the group members. Fabi is wearing a red blouse with brown pants.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans, sugar, toilet paper, and detergent

loans.name: Chester

texts.en:
Chester has lived in the United States for 15 years. His business specializes in distribution of bodega goods and snacks and he has been an entrepreneur ever since his was a young kid. Since his arrival in the United States, Chester has worked hard to keep his entrepreneurial spirit and continues to make self-employment his main pursuit through his distribution services.

Chester has had great success in partnering with established wholesalers. He is proud to have been able to bring quality wholesale products to a growing number of retailers through a strategically elaborated distribution system. His most popular products are plantain chips of different flavors, cookies, natural juices, and bananas.

Chester is currently seeking a loan because he would like to expand his inventory so that he can meet demands in a timely manner. His vision for the future is to become the number one convenience store supplier in South Florida. He would like to expand his business and possibly target other markets and niches outside of his local boundaries.

loans.use: to expand inventory goods

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 19 años de edad es madre soltera su hijo tiene 4 años vive con los padres ella ha buscado con que mantener al niño ya que tiene que ayudar con los gastos de la casa.

Se dedica a la crianza y engorde de chanchos, gallinas y ganado en dinero lo solita para la compra de ganado y alimento como balanceado morocho tambien para vacunas, ya que necesita de mucho cuidado. En los tiempos libres ver la television y salir a caminar con el niño.
texts.en:
Jenny is 19 years old and is a single mother with a 4 year old son. She lives with her parents. She has looked for a way to support her son since she needs to help with the household expenses.

She makes a living rearing and fattening pigs, chickens, and cattle and is requesting the money to buy cattle, feed like balanced dense corn, and also for vaccines since it needs a lot of care.

In her free time she watches television and goes out for walks with her son.

loans.use: to buy cattle, feed like balanced dense corn, and also vaccines.

loans.name: Luz Herminia

texts.es:
Luz tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene uno hijo de 5 años vive con el esposo ella se dedica a la cxrianza de chanchos y ganado ademas vende productos de bella puerta a puerta, el dinero lo solicita para la comprar de chancos y alimento como balanceado.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en: Luz is 37 years old. She is married, has a 5 year old son and lives with her husband. She works raising pigs and cattle. Also, she sells beauty products door to door. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and balanced feed. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and balanced feed.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and is married with 4 children. With 3 of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, home care products, as well as other groceries.

Cheryl has been in this business for 10 years, and she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, home care products, as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 42 года, замужем, есть 3 дочери и сын. У Гулмиры средне-специальное образование. Она старается жить в согласии и дружбе со всеми. Гулмира уже 23 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры у нее есть 3 коровы, 20 овец, лошадь. На 6,0 Га земли она выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 молодых бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своей деятельности.
texts.en: Gulmira is 42 years old, married, and she has three daughters and one son.  She has a specialized secondary education.  She tries to live in harmony and friendship with everyone around her.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for 23 years already.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows, 20 sheep and one horse.  She also grows alfalfa on six hectares of land.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy four bull-calves for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy four bull-calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es:
Lidia, de 53 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y trabajan para sostener sus gastos personales.

Lidia, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, todo lo que sabe es gracias a su madre, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño, el cual con los granos que cosecha vende gran parte de ellos y los ingresos económicos le son de gran ayuda para poder obtener lo necesario.

Lidia, utilizará el préstamo para comprar 3 quintales de abono fertilizante, insecticidas y pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra, de esta forma con las cosechas que obtenga podrá vender y poder tener ingresos económicos para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.

Lidia, sueña con poder tener un negocio de productos de la canasta básica en  su casa, para así tener una fuente de ingresos económicos y poder tener lo necesario, además desea poder remodelar su casa junto a  su esposo.
texts.en:
Lidia is 53 years old. She didn't have the chance to go to school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has four children who are already grown and who work to pay for their personal expenses.

Lidia takes care of her home. Everything she knows is thanks to her mother. Her husband is a small farmer. He sells a big part of the grains he harvests and the income is a big help to be able to get what they need.

Lidia will use the loan to buy 3 quintals of fertilizer and insecticide, as well as to pay for labor to prepare the soil. This way, with the harvests can be sold and bring in income to have a better quality of life with her family.

Lidia dreams of being able to have a business selling staple products from her home so that she can have a source of income and be able to have what she needs. She also wants to remodel her home with her husband.

loans.use: to buy 3 quintals of fertilizer and insecticide, as well as to pay for labor to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Timothy's Group

texts.en: Timothy is a 36-year-old hardworking father of one child. He is the youngest child of a very poor family. He works as a palm oil mill manual worker during the peak season and then reinvests all of his proceeds in palm kernel processing. With his effort, he was able to help his parents send one of his siblings to secondary school. His sibling graduated last year and is now getting ready for his university degree. A portion of this loan will help Timothy purchase more palm kernel this season and make more income to support his immediate family. He will do all he can to educate his children since he did not have these opportunities. Timothy thanks all Kiva lenders that support this loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernels.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd, and she applied for a loan of UGX3,500,000/=. She is a married woman with children.

She is a business woman who owns a retail shop. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX3,500,000/= to boost her retail trade. She will buy daily household items, such as rice, corn flour, sugar, salt, and toiletries among other items to sell to her customers. This will boost her sales and profits. She is faced with the challenges of competition and lacking enough capital to purchase enough stock to satisfy her clients. This will soon be overcome, because she is getting a financial boost.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her as she is now able to fund her business.

Pictured is Sarah and a UGAFODE credit staff member.

loans.use: to boost her business.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victora is 36 years old and a mother of two kids. She lives with her husband and children. She has been into this trade for over eight years. She purchases finished palm kernel products from rural farmers and resells them back in the urban market. As a member of the Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society, she receives products from other rural members on credit and pays them back when she finishes marketing. Sometimes this is not possible considering that many millers are very poor and want to have their money immediately to enable them to attend to their family's needs.

Victoria hereby requests this loan to enable her to pay for her purchased products and also to finance transportation to the market. With this loan, Victoria’s life will change for the better as she will be relieved from financial constraints. She will also use her expected income this year to support her husband in caring for the family. Victoria and her group members thank all Kiva members for supporting this loan.

loans.use: to purchase processed palm oil products.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en: Mrs. Nyamjav, 57 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making Mongolian traditional dresses for local people since 2005. Her husband transports heavy machinery using his truck. Using her previous loan, she has purchased an automobile which was used to deliver goods. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is used for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is a hard-working woman from the community of Bien Unido in the province of Bohol, Philippines. By raising ten children, who are now adults, she learned to earn a living by engaging in a Sari-sari store business and a buy and sell dried fish business. These have been her businesses for 36 years. Ma. Nenita is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy stocks for her store, such as soy sauce, milo sachets, coffee, toothpaste, sugar, cooking oil, canned foods, noodles and more dried fish to sell.

Ma. Nenita is looking for a better future for her business, and she hopes that one day it will even give her a higher return on her investment. With the income from the business, she can save for old age and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, milo sachets, coffee, toothpaste, sugar, cooking oil, canned foods, noodles and more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy works hard to support her family. Judy is married and has a business buying and selling squid in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more squid to sell.

Judy has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more squid to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecilia is 60 years old.

Cecilia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Cecilia has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Merlisa

texts.en:
Merlisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlisa is 30 years old and one of her children is in school.

Merlisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies to use in her business.

Merlisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merlisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Julio Sabino

texts.es:
Julio, vive con su familia, es casado, también comparte el techo con sus nietos, todos son dependientes de los ingresos que él genera, se dedica a fabricar teja para venderla, tiene gran experiencia en realizar esta actividad que le enseño su padre.
Requiere de un crédito para dar cobertura a las demandas de sus clientes, comprara zacate para quemar las tejas en menos tiempo, así aumentara la producción, espera que sus planes se concreten para tener a su alcance recursos económicos con los que cubrirá las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Julio anhela cancelar su deuda en el menor tiempo posible y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his family, is married, and also shares the roof with his grandchildren. All are dependent on the income that he earns. He makes a living manufacturing bricks to sell them. He has extensive experience in this activity that he learned from his father.

He requires this loan to meet the demands of his customers, to purchase materials to burn to make bricks in less time, in order to increase production. He wants to implement these plans to have financial resources at his disposal with which he can cover the basic needs of the family.

Julio wants to pay his debt as quickly as possible and succeed with his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to burn and make bricks in less time, in order to increase production.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 55 years old and has nine children. Cristita is married and has two children who are in school.

Cristita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 62 years old and married. Eleonor works very hard to provide for them.

Eleonor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Eleonor has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Eleonor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 59 years old and has six children. Esperanza is married and one of her children is in school.

Esperanza is in the agricultural business, farming rootcrops in the Philippines. Esperanza requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Esperanza has been in this business for two years, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Esperanza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan Brigido

texts.es:
Juan, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y es padre de dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, ambos están estudiando.

Juan, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra granos básicos con la ayuda de sus hijos en el tiempo libre los fines de semana y también se dedica a trabajar en la molienda cortando caña y elaborando dulce de atado y además trabaja en los cafetales en tiempo de cosecha.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas para fumigar sus cultivos y para pagar mozos que le ayuden a trabajar los cultivos y terminar más rápido.
 
El sueño de Juan es, que sus hijos se preparen academicamente y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 35 years old, was educated through the fourth grade. He is in a relationship and is the father of two children, ages 14 and 10. Both are in school.

Juan works in farming, specifically growing basic grains with the help of his children in their free time on the weekends. He also works in the mills cutting sugar cane and making "dulce de atado" [an unrefined cane sugar product]. He also works on the coffee plantations at harvest time.

Juan needs the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to fumigate his crops, and to pay the workers who help him to work more quickly in the fields.

Juan's dream is that his children be well educated and that they be professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to fumigate his crops, and to pay the workers that help him work the fields.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar, está soltera y tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos viven con ella y están estudiando y los otros dos ya se casaron.

Pascuala, hace tamales de gallina para salir a vender en el caserío donde vive, casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a este oficio, pero aparte de eso junto a su hija elabora tortillas de maíz para vender y generar ingresos extras.

Pascuala, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como: semilla, abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y pagar el arrendamiento del terreno.

El sueño de Pascuala, sueña con poder comprar un terreno para poder sembrar y evitarse el egreso por alquiler.
texts.en:
Pascuala, 55, studied up to the second grade. She has always made a living working around the house. She is single and has five children, three of whom live with her and are studying. The other two are already married.

Pascuala makes chicken tamales to go out and sell in her neighborhood. Almost her whole life, she has made a living in this way. But aside from this, together with her daughter she makes corn tortillas to sell and generate extra income.

Pascuala needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay the rent for the land.

Pascuala's dream is to be able to buy a plot of land to plant and to avoid having the outflow for the rent.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay the rent for the land.

loans.name: Supriatna

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Supriatna. Supriatna lives in North Bogor, which is located about a one-hour-and-thirty-minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Supriatna lives there and sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He is a young, single man who has a big spirit to become a successful entrepreneur. He has learned a lot about how to manage a business since he joined Ruma. He also feels that Ruma's Sales Executive is informative and kind.

As the business grows, Supriatna is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Supriatna improve his business and accordingly, his community, who need access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Supriatna is the one who is standing and holding Ruma's banner in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide his community with better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Liquisa. Most of her daily income is from selling fish because her husband is a fisherman. She is busy with her business every day of her life, and she must help her husband to sell fish, because she has to find the money to help her family. She started doing her business in 2006 with her own working capital of $80. Now she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy trawl, fish crates, and other materials, and to fix the boat. After her husband gets the fish, she will bring them to the market to sell.

loans.use: to buy trawl, fish crates, and other materials, and to fix the boat.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old. She lives in a very dangerous neighborhood. She works as an assistant at a law firm and when she has free time she drives a car that she uses as a taxi.

Maria needs a loan to pay for the repair of her car. Maria would like to finish her studies and to sell her car in the future, but right now she hopes you can help her. Maria is single and she doesn't have children but she supports her parents.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her car.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркуль успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании.  Она по-прежнему работает в школе и также занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, лошадь, 12 овец. Также на земельном участке, мерою 3,15 Га она выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры, эспарцет для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль Анаркуль составляет 13,800 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса за счет покупки породистых дойных коров.
texts.en: Anarkul successfully repaid her previous loan after using for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing.  She is still working in a school and is also involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She currently has six cows, one horse and 12 sheep on her farm.  On 3.15 hectares of land she also grows potatoes, cereals and sainfoin for resale and domestic use on the farm.  She makes a monthly income of 13,800 som (KGS).
