She has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy a few lambs and increase the size of her herd.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business through the purchase of purebred dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase a few lambs in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Roland Geiber

texts.en:
Colombia is a country of strong traditions, and has a lot of country people who work the land and raise animals. Unfortunately, the people who do this work face many problems like the high costs of the inputs, the weather or bad seasons. Roland is aware of these issues but always finds a way to come through. He is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Caparrapi.

He has three sons who are the reason for his hard work. He has a farm where he grows different kind of products and raises cattle. He wants to be more competitive in the market. So he’s asking for a loan to buy some steers to be raised so they can be sold in December. The loan will also help to repair the barnyard.

Roland has many dreams. The main one is to make his business successful so that one day his children can inherit it and keep it so they have something to provide for themselves. You can help Roland to accomplish this dream and all his goals with just a loan.

loans.use: buy some steers to be raised so they can be sold in December. The loan will also help to repair the barnyard.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos todos son mayor de edad.

Rosa, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, gracias a que su madre le enseño esta actividad, pero además de dedicarse a los oficios domésticos, también se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño, ella tenía que realizar estas actividad extras debido a es madre soltera y tenía que velar por el bienestar de sus hijos y tener lo necesario en su casa.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, 2 quintales de abono, insecticidas y pagar mano de obra para que le realice el trabajo y con las cosechas que obtenga podrá vender alguna parte y tener lo necesario para su familia.

Rosa, desea para un futuro poder sembrar más y de esa manera obtener más y mejores cosechas y tener más ingresos económicos, además desea poder reconstruir su casa, porque con el paso del tiempo se le ha ido deteriorando y desea poder reconstruirla más grande y segura.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is a single mother of five grown children.

Rosa is a homemaker, which she learned from her mother. Besides working in the home, she also is a small farmer. She had to do this extra work because she is a single mother, and she had to protect her children's wellbeing and meet all the household needs.

Rosa needs this loan to buy chemical fertilizers, 200 pounds of organic fertilizer, and insecticides, and to pay for labor. When the crops are harvested, she will be able to sell part and have what her family needs.

In the future, Rosa wants to be able to plant more so that she can get better, more plentiful harvests and more income. She also wants to be able to rebuild her house, because it has deteriorated over time, and she would like to be able to make it bigger and more secure.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers, 200 lbs of organic fertilizers, and insecticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Martha Ligia

texts.en:
There’s a store in the municipality of Los Palmitos that has become recognized by a lot of people in the town for the good service as well as how the people can interact there. That store belongs to Martha, a 34 year-old-mother of two who has been working for around 10 years in her store trying to make it successful and to provide for her family.

She works all week for around eight hours each day, because she loves her business and wants to keep improving it. She wants to increase her clients so her sales can also increase. She’s asking for a loan so she can improve her store by buying some inputs and making some structural renovations.

Martha has many dreams but right now she needs to repair her house because it has some damage. She wants to give her family a place where they can feel safe and comfortable. You can help Martha to achieve all her goals, something that a loan will make a lot easier.

loans.use: to improve her store by buying some inputs and making some structural renovations.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción, de 59 años de edad, es madre soltera, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar mucho, solo logro estudiar primer grado, lo suficiente como para aprender a leer y a escribir, es madre de 5 hijos, todos son adultos y algunos ya tienen sus propias familias, ella vive con una hija que ya está casada y con su ultimo hijo que está estudiando y es el único que depende económicamente de ella.

Concepción, trabaja como empleada doméstica en una casa, su jornada empieza a las 5:00 de la mañana para hacer algunas cosas en su casa y luego viajar en bus media hora para llegar a su lugar de trabajo y sale de trabajar a las 4:00 de la tarde, tiene 6 años de trabajar en el mismo lugar.- Aparte de dedicarse a esta actividad, también se dedica a la agricultura junto a su hijo menor, actualmente tienen cultivos de maíz y frijol, esa es otra actividad que le genera alimento para el resto del verano, más que todo en los cultivos de maíz es que recibe el apoyo de sus demás hijos cuando lo requiere.

El financiamiento del préstamo lo necesita para comprar 2 sacos de abono fertilizante para la preparación de la tierra y para pagar la mano de obra, con la ayuda del préstamo le permitirá cosechar los granos y tener alimento durante la temporada seca junto a su hijo.

Concepción, desea que su último hijo logre terminar sus estudios universitarios; también desea reparar su casa y remodelarla un poco.
texts.en:
Concepción is 59 years old and a single mother. She did not have the chance to study a lot and was only able to study in first grade enough to learn how to read and write. She has 5 children which are all adults and, some, have their own families. She lives with a daughter who is already married and with her youngest son, who is still studying and the only one who financially depends on her.

Concepción works as a maid in a house. She starts her days at 5:00 a.m. to be able to do her chores at home and then take a half hour bus ride to her workplace. She gets off work at 4:00 p.m. She has worked at the same place for the last 6 years. Besides having this job, she also works in agriculture with her youngest son. They currently have corn and beans crops. This is another business activity that generates food for the rest of the summer. Her other children help out if needed, mainly with the corn crops.

She needs the loan to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer to get the land ready for farming and to pay for workers to cultivate it. The loan will help her harvest the grain and have food for her and her son during the dry season.

Concepción wants her youngest son to be able to complete his college education. She also wants to repair and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer to get the land ready for farming and to pay for workers to cultivate it.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
The Universal Group is in the city of Teshie, Accra. They demonstrate unity and trust among themselves. They work separately on selling groceries, jewelry, enamel bowls, plastics items and canned food and feel okay with their respective jobs. They intend to improve their earnings and become increasingly more independent.

Eva is one of the members of this group. She has been sacrificing a lot and little by little, she has been making progress. She has already been selling smoked fish to her customers. She mentions that she started out with very little, but she has been making progress, and she is already fairly well known in her neighborhood. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy more fish and firewood to smoke the fish and sell to her customers.

She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow and improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish and firewood to smoke the fish and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.es: Doña Medarda, tiene 71 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside en un sector del Municipio del Progreso, Yoro junto a sus dos hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, frijoles, pan huevos, refrescos, condimentos, dulces, sal, cafe, churros, y otros abarrotes. Lleva quince años de dedicarse al negocio propio para obtener ingresos y darles manutención a sus hijos.  Antes se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería de ropa. Desde entonces solicita préstamos en la institución para invertir en el negocio. Actualmente está solicitando otro préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 lempiras para comprar producto nuevo como refrescos, arroz, frijoles, huevos, pan, harina, manteca etc. y surtir más su negocio y aumentar las ventas e ingresos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando con el negocio y hacer que se desarrolle más para seguir obteniendo ingresos.
texts.en:
Dona Medarda is 71 years old, a single mother and lives in an area of Progreso municipality, Yoro with her two children. She currently makes her living selling basic goods such as rice, beans, bread, eggs, soft drinks, condiments, candy, salt, coffee, churros and other groceries. She has earned her living and supported her family with her own business for the last fifteen years. Before that she made her living selling clothing.

Since then she has gotten loans from this institution to invest in her business. She is currently requesting a loan of 15,000 Lempira to buy items such as soft drinks, rice, beans, bread, flour, lard, etc. to stock her store and increase sales and earnings.

Her dream is to keep working at her business and expand it to keep earning money.

loans.use: to buy new items such as soft drinks, rice, beans, eggs, bread, flour, lard, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Eucharia's Group

texts.en:
Eucharia is 41 years old and a mother to five children. She is a widow and a teacher in the rural primary school. Annually, she engages in different businesses to meet her family's needs. In this part of the world, teachers, especially primary school teachers in rural areas, face salary delays for months. If one is not engaged in other life-sustaining activities, life becomes tougher.

Eucharia joined Nke-Anyi cooperative. In the past, she has enjoyed the palm oil storage loan product. A portion of this loan will enable her to purchase fresh palm fruits and process them for the market. She spends her weekends at the mill and also evenings after school hours. Her children are also supporting her with the work. Eucharia and her group members appreciate all the Kiva lenders that show interest in supporting their loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Truth 2 Group

texts.en:
Angela, 48, is married and has a 27-year-old child who goes to school. She is also a business woman and member of Truth 2 Group, which has three members, all women. She is pictured in the center of the group photo.

Angela sells maize. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her business is open six days a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. She established her business to help support her child in school. She pays the school fees, buys learning materials and food from the profits from her business.

Angela and her group members needs a loan of GHS 6,000, of which she is entitled to GHS 3,000. She will use her portion to buy more maize and sell to her customers.

She hopes this loan will help her generate more profits to support her family. In the future, she plans to save more money to provide a university education for her child. She believes that educating her child to the university level will improve the lives of her family. This is her third loan with Kiva and eleventh loan with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to buy more maize and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Felismina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day, because she lives near many people. With the loan, she will buy some additional supplies including rice, baby oils, biscuits, milk, candles, sardines, cigarettes, noodles, hand and body cream, eggs, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

Felismina has been involved in business activities since 2010 with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can help her husband be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy rice, baby oils, biscuits, milk, candles, sardines, cigarettes, noodles, hand and body cream, eggs, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 55 years old. He is an electrician. Cirilo is married and his wife is 53 years old, and she has a grocery store.

Cirilo wants to help his wife and that is why he is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for his wife's grocery store. Cirilo is still working at the city hall, so he can't help his wife with the grocery store but at least he will do his best to give her financial support.

The picture was taken when Cirilo was working for the city hall. On the street, the truck behind him is city hall property and Cirilo uses it to go to many places.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his wife's grocery store.

loans.name: El Mirador De Aguacatan Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Mirador Aguacatán” was formed by eight determined women who live near the town of Aguacatán in northern Guatemala. On average, the clients of Friendship Bridge earn less than $2 each day, have had approximately 3 years of formal education, cannot read or write and are likely not to speak Spanish, the official language of Guatemala. These 7 hard-working women are striving to change this. With their small loans, they have small businesses from restaurants and stores to weaving and embroidering of traditional textiles. Others are involved in animal husbandry. They request loans to grow, expand and create more income.

The ladies of the Trust Bank are single mothers, widows and wives who range in age from 22 to 76 years old. They understand that education is a vital key to a successful future and are pleased that their children are in school. The President of the group, 27-year-old Irma, was able to attend school only until the 5th grade. She has three children who are 3, 5, and 7 years of age. She has a convenience store and sells items that her customers need on a daily basis. Irma also weaves and embroiders traditional blouses called “huipiles” (pronounced “we-pee-les”) Irma is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and would like to buy salt, sugar, rice, beans, pasta and soap. In addition, she would like to purchase materials for her “huipiles”.

Besides transacting business on their loans, the ladies of “El Mirador Aguacatan” participate in educational training during their monthly meetings. Together with a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge, they learn about women’s health, family matters, health and hygiene as well as nutrition and the use of medicinal plants. They also learn about effective business practices. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

Thank you to Kiva investors for their kindness and generosity in funding loans for Irma and her friends in the Trust Bank. We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, rice, beans, pasta and soap for her convenience store

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” live in the northern city of Huehuetenango. There is a lot of industry here and coffee is the primary export. The ethnic composition of the population is one of the most diverse in Guatemala. with the “Mam” being predominant.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” or “Entrepreneurial Women” are a group of women who are involved in various businesses. Some have restaurants while others have shops or are involved in the purchase and sale of products like corn, food and used clothing. They range in age from 28-70, are married and have children.

Zuly, who is 35 years old, is a member of the Trust Bank. She is married, and the couple has two children who are in school. Her husband is a construction worker. Zuly constantly looks for ways to excel and so she is studying. She purchases and sells corn and is requesting a loan to buy more corn in bulk to increase her earnings.

The ladies in the Trust Bank meet monthly with a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. After transacting business on their loans, the women participate in educational training that enables them to acquire personal and business skills and knowledge. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it is most effective.

Thank you to each Kiva investor who is taking the time to read about Zuly and her friends in the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Trust Bank. Ultimately, “Microcredit Plus” benefits all the women in Friendship Bridge as well as an average of six others in the community including spouses, children, parents and employees! It is a real “win win” scenario!

loans.use: to buy more corn in bulk and resell it, so she can increase her earnings.

loans.name: Zilpa Aridahi

texts.es:
Zilpa, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde y aún no tiene ningún bebé.

Zilpa, dedico su vida después de salir de estudiar a los oficios del hogar, ahora junto a su esposo se dedica a la crianza de pollos y decidieron iniciar este tipo de negocio porque en la actualidad hay mucha demanda y sabiéndolo administrar se obtienen buenas ganancias, la granja la tiene situada en su casa desde hace 3 años.- 

Zilpa, necesita el préstamo para comprar 100 de pollos de engorde, 3 quintales de concentrado y 7 láminas para reparar el techo de una de las galeras.

El sueño de ella es ampliar más la granja y tener una cantidad considerable de pollos.
texts.en:
Zilpa is 32 years old. She completed high school. She is married and her husband raises broiler chickens. They do not have any children yet.

After school, Zilpa devoted herself to home-making. Now, along with her husband, she is raising chickens. They decided to go into this kind of business because there is currently
high demand for it, and knowing how to manage it, good income can be earned. The farm has been at their home for the last 3 years.

Zilpa needs the loan to buy 100 broiler chickens, 3 quintals of concentrated feed and 7 pieces of sheet metal to repair the roof on one of the hen houses.

Her dream is to expand the farm and have a large number of chickens.

loans.use: to buy 100 broiler chickens, 3 quintals of concentrated feed and 7 pieces of sheet metal to repair the roof of one of the hen houses.

loans.name: San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, está conformado por 1 varón y 2 mujeres luchadoras que se integraron hace aproximadamente 3 años, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios, de esa manera vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Anhelan mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

DACIA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario SAN JERONIMO; es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 3 hijos: El mayor de 9 años de edad estudia su cuarto grado de primaria y 2 menores de edad. Es estilista, tiene su pequeño salón de belleza en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Bilwi. El préstamo que está solicitando es para  comprar más tintes, tratamiento para el cabello, maquillaje, pintura de uñas,  para poder ofertar más productos.  Ella sueña con tener unas vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus productos y otras mercaderías para poder mejorar sus ingresos y así poder también contribuir en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This is a mixed solidarity group, composed of one man and two hard-working women who joined together approximately three years ago in order to manage their financing through loans with a solidarity guarantee so that they can buy merchandise for their little businesses and in this way sell more and improve their income. They want to improve their living conditions in order to cover the basic necessities, assure the education of their children, and improve their homes.

Dacia is the coordinator of the solidarity group San Jeronimo. She is a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has three children: the oldest, who is nine years old, is in the fourth grade of primary school, and the other two are younger. She is a hair stylist. She has her little beauty salon in one of the markets of the city of Bilwi. The loan that she is applying for is to purchase more dyes, hair treatments, make-up, and nail polish to be able to offer more products. She dreams of having some display cases where she can exhibit her products and other merchandise in order to improve her income and thus also be able to contribute to improving the quality of life of her children and offer them a better future.

loans.use: to buy more dyes, hair treatments, make-up, and nail polish in order to offer more products.

loans.name: Rosario Loma Alta Group

texts.en:
The small town of Loma Alta is near San Juan Sacatepéquez about an hour drive to the northwest of Guatemala City. “Rosario Loma Alta”, a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, is located here with its very hard-working members, who financially support their husbands and families in order to provide them with a better future.

One of the members who is working hard to overcome a difficult life, is Maria. She is 36 years old and has three children who she wants to provide with good opportunities for a brighter and successful future. Four times per week, Maria sells typical Guatemalan food, corn on the cob and chickens in her community. Her business provides a small income but she needs to have a loan to buy more ingredients, such as rice, corn kernels and beans, to make her food items. Maria says, “The food business provides me good weekly income! That is why I want to do everything to continue it.”

Providing their children with good opportunities for a successful future is very important to the women of Guatemala. Maria and her friends in “Rosario Loma Alta” are grateful to the Kiva investors for trusting them with loans and having confidence in their development as good business women. When women are able to empower themselves through education, they help their communities improve and raise children who are educated and healthy. Everyone has the opportunity to step into a brighter future and leave poverty behind! Thank you Kiva investors!!!

loans.use: to buy rice, corn kernels and beans, to make her food items

loans.name: Canaan De Tzujil Group

texts.en:
The large Guatemalan State of El Quiche in the northwestern part of the country has many rural towns where the local Maya language predominates. San Pedro Jocopilas is one of these small towns whose citizens are very friendly and hardworking. Eleven dedicated women came together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Canaan De Tzujil” in order to make their dreams for better lives come true.

The President of “Canaan De Tzujil” is Agustina who was elected because of her leadership abilities, as well as being able to accept responsibility for the group’s successful development. She has five children and is married to a farmer. In order to provide more income for the family, Agustina raises pigs and chickens. She is asking for a loan to buy more pigs and chickens for resale. Farming is a difficult occupation that has it ups and downs because weather and temperature play an important role. Maria emphasizes the importance of her income from her animal husbandry business in helping the family get ahead.

Friendship Bridge partners with Kiva investors to provide non-formal education and financial development so that the women of “Canaan De Tzujil” can grow their small businesses. Friendship Bridge provides the program of non-formal education and microcredit called “Microcredit Plus”.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and chickens for resale

loans.name: Karen Daniela

texts.en:
Karen's young age hasn’t stopped her from fighting for her dreams. She’s a strong and hardworking woman who only is 19 years old. She lives in the municipality of Victoria where she has an arepas production business (a tortilla made of corn, really popular in Colombia). This business not only helps her provide for her family but lets her dream of having her own restaurant.

She wants to increase her clients and be able to formalize her business so it can last in time. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy a little cart and buy inputs like cheese, chorizo, jam, and pineapple so she can make delicious arepas.

Karen dreams big and wants to accomplish big things with her business and in her life. She wants to buy a new house so her family can have a good quality of life. You can help Karen with all these dreams and goals so she can achieve them all; a loan will get her so much closer.

loans.use: to buy a little cart and buy inputs like cheese, chorizo, jam, and pineapple so she can make delicious arepas.

loans.name: Oscar Andres

texts.en:
Oscar is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Norcasia, a place where he has a food business since 2010. This business has allowed him to provide for his family and improve their quality of life. He inherited the business from his family. His mother, who is a great cook, taught him everything so he does things right.

The most important thing for this man is his family. That’s why he works hard to make his business successful and make it last in time so he can keep providing for his family. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy a new refrigerator which he needs, and to buy inputs like food and drinks.

Oscar has many dreams but the most important one is to fix his family’s damaged house. It is important to do this quickly so that they will be safe. You can help this good man to accomplish all of his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy a new refrigerator which he needs, and to buy inputs like food and drinks.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Visitacion Group

texts.en:
Santa Maria Visitación is a small rural town in the Western Highlands of Guatemala where seven dedicated small business women formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Santa Isabel Visitación”. The women need to have capital in order to expand their small businesses. One of the founding members is 31-year-old Evelyn who had the opportunity to graduate from high school and then go on to receive a diploma as a teacher, but because she was recently laid off and has not been able to obtain another teaching position, she has created a small business sewing and embroidering clothes. She wants the income from her business to provide an education for her three children.

Evelyn and the other members of “Santa Isabel Visitación” want to generate more capital for their small businesses and are asking Kiva investors to support their request. Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy a variety of fabrics and threads to use for sewing and embroidering her various textile projects. She has an increasing number of requests each month so she wants to enlarge her inventory to meet her customers’ demands.

On average, a Friendship Bridge client has had approximately 3 years of formal education. The ladies look forward to their monthly meetings when, after transacting business on their loans, they participate in educational training on practical subjects such as effective business management practices, empowerment and self-esteem as well as hygiene, health and nutrition. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and microcredit “Microcredit Plus”. The “Plus” is the educational component.

On behalf of the members of the group, Evelyn says, “Thank you for the loans provided to the members of “Santa Isabel Visitación” so that we can develop our small businesses. The income from our businesses helps to put food on the table, buy medicine for emergencies, and provide for our children’s education.”

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics and threads to use for sewing and embroidering her various textile projects.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny lives at Alcala with her family. She is 33 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse is a private employee. Jenny manages a store to gain income. She sells grocery items. She wants to gain more income from her store but has insufficient funds to buy more merchandise so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, soap and school supplies to sell. The  additional merchandise will help increase her sales capacity and profits as well. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, soap and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Christy is 40 years old and has six children who are in school.

Christy has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Christy requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

Christy has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Christy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 55 years old and has one child. Florencia is a married woman.

Florencia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florencia has been in this business for five years and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 47 years old and has five children. Leonila is a married woman.

Leonila is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonila has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Alma has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 45 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Bebilyn

texts.en:
Bebilyn is 43 years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell.

Bebilyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Bebilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn is 44 years old and has six children who are in school.

Analyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vinegar, oil, flour, etc.

Analyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vinegar, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 38 years old and has five children. Cheryl is married and has two children who are in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cheryl has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 31-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Brenda requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Brenda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for childbirth expenses.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emilie is 35 years old, widowed and has a child. She is managing a mini-grocery for income. She patiently sells grocery items to the people in her village. She is able to sustain her family's needs.

Emilie would like to obtain more profits in her store but has insufficient funds to buy more merchandise, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread and biscuits to sell. With these additional goods to sell, she hopes to gain good profits from the store and continue offering affordable products and services to all her customers. She will save additional revenue for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Violy

texts.en: Violy has been working abroad for 10 years. When she got home and had enough capital, she decided to put up a sari-sari store business. Now, Violy has been managing her retailing business for four years. To gain additional income, Violy is also engaged in buying bananas in different villages and importing them to a different place. Violy wants to earn a bigger income because she wanted to continue help her some relatives in taking their studies. Therefore, Violy is ask for a loan of P20,000 to buy groceries to sell. She will also use the loan to buy more bananas to sell. Violy realize that helping others is one of her success.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana, de 25 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos, una niña de 9 años que estudia tercer grado y vive con su abuela y un niño de 3 años el cual vive con ella y su esposo en casa.
 
Roxana, se dedica a atender una pequeña tienda que tiene desde hace unos años, en donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, porque cuando ella estaba pequeña su madre tenia una tienda y a ella le gustaba mucho atender los clientes.- Cuando se casó decidió colocar ese mismo tipo de negocio en casa y aprovecha a cuidar de su hijo, mientras su esposo trabaja como vigilante.

Roxana, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta básicas y granos básicos para surtir más su tienda y darle a sus clientes lo necesario.

El sueño de Roxana, es ampliar más su negocio y que le genere más ganancias, para poder darle a sus hijos el estudio hasta que sean profesionales y que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana is 25 and did not have the opportunity to study. She is married and is the mother of two children: a 9-year-old girl who studies in the third grade and lives with her grandmother and a 3-year-old boy who lives at home with her and her husband.

Roxana has earned a living for several years attending a small store where she sells basic necessities. She learned this business from her parents, because when she was small her mother had a store and she liked helping the clients a lot. When she married, she decided to organize the same type of business at home and make the most of watching her son while her husband works as a guard.

Roxana needs the loan to buy basic staple products and basic grains to stock up her store and give her clients what is necessary.

Roxana's dream is to expand her business more and generate more profits, to be able to give her children an education until they become professionals and so that they may have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staple products and basic grains to stock up her store and give her clients what is necessary.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy's goal in life is for all her children to finish their studies and become professionals someday. She wants her children to hold a degree so they have an edge in applying for a white collar job. Jovy is doing her best to manage her retailing business and wishes to grow it for their future.

Jovy is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy sugar, coffee, canned goods, and condiments to sell. Her loan will be a great help for her to grow the business and earn a greater income. Jovy will invest her earnings in the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, canned goods, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, a farmer for over 20 years, lives in Thmey village. Spending her daytime raising her only child, she wants to have a comfortable life. Currently, she is still farming while her only child has started working as a company employee and earning a fixed income for the family.

Sophal has difficulty using her battery for home energy. She needs to recharge the battery every week. Moreover, she needs to get up early to feed her chickens. Using her car battery is not convenient for an over-50-year-old lady like her. Seeing the difficulty of using her car battery, Sophal decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home energy system. She believes solar home energy can enhance her lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Thmey village, Kraing Leav Commune, Rolea Pe Ear D

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita lives in Liquisa and her business is a printing rental. She opened her rental in 2009 with her awn working capital. She lives near many people, so she had the idea to open a rental for everybody so when they want to print a document, it will not be far away. Every day she earns a good income because many people come to print a document at her rental and, therefore, she is very happy with her business.

Now she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger rental business in the future. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy printer paper, ink, ink color, glue, photo paper, insulation and other materials to use. She hopes that with this loan, her business will improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy printing paper, ink, ink color, glue, photo paper, insulation and other materials to use.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in Alcala with her family. She is 36 years old, married and had a child. She is a vendor selling meat, frozen food products and groceries in her village. She also manages a hog raising business. She wanted to improve her profits but had insufficient funds to buy additional goods to sell.

Jennifer is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread, soap and shampoo to sell. In the future, she hopes to keep maintaining good profits in her store and developing her hog raising business too. She will save additional revenue for family emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en: Thorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Thorn works as a farmer and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
The cost of living today is very expensive. It forces everyone to work hard to make ends meet. Kadek can not just rely on the income from her husband – she also has to work. Raising pigs is one solution.

During 6 months of raising pigs, Kadek had no difficulties or problems. She sold her piglets and she earns 400,000 IDR profit per month. Her profit is increasing since the previous period because the price for pork has also increased this month. Because she has had good results with her business, her husband has given his full support to her. Kadek's efforts have been able to fulfill her children's school needs.

Kadek and other members of the Melati Putih group have decided to take a new loan to continue their businesses. Their main goal is to have enough capital by saving and to eventually no longer need to borrow.

Kadek got a loan to buy superior feed and renovate the cages. Her husband helped her to raise the pigs. They feed and clean the cages every day. Being careful about the hygiene of their food and cages, Kadek hopes the pigs will be healthy and will thrive.

One member of the group decided to resign because she had to move to the city. She was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to buy superior feed and renovate her pig cages.

loans.name: Aem's Group

texts.en:
Aem’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Aem works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Bork's Group

texts.en:
Bork’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Bork makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and seller to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en: Sokheng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokheng makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 47 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

Emelia has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
Mariefe is 35 years old and has seven children. Mariefe is married and has five children who are in school.

Mariefe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mariefe requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mariefe has been in this business for 5 years and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mariefe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Florenda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is a 32-year-old woman with three children, all of whom are in school.

Renelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Renelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Renelyn has been in this business for two years and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Renelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jesielyn

texts.en:
Jesielyn is 53 years old, married, and has eight children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jesielyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jesielyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jesielyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Samnag's Group

texts.en: Samnag’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samnag makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Virgen Chanca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN CHANCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco
La socia Elsa tiene 37 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose al negocio de  panadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio de restaurante el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora  diferentes tipos de panes  entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen  por el préstamo y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank "Virgen Chanca". The bank is located in the district of Challabamba, which is part of the province of Paucartambo and department of Cusco.

The member, Elsa, is 37 years old. She has 5 children and is married. The member alternates her daily activities, working in the bakery business. The member has a good time with her restaurant business, which has gone well because of the effort that she puts into her business each day. The member makes different types of breads, among other things, for her customers that make requests. This way, the member keeps her family moving forward.

The member is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, and other things.

The members in general are grateful for the loan, and agree to comply with their loan payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other things.

loans.name: Juan Reynaldo

texts.es:
Juan, actualmente vive con su madre, es soltero y no tiene hijos, se dedica a comercializar granos básicos, (maíz y frijol), lo tiene desde hace 2 años, lo ha aprendido con ayuda de su padre, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, inicio con poco producto y ha ido aumentando la cantidad así como también el número de clientes.
Se decidió por trabajar con créditos para comprar maíz, frijol y tres silos para almacenar los granos, la finalidad de la inversión es atender las demandas de la temporada y tener más ganancias para el pago de la deuda.
Los sueños que él tiene son ampliar su negocio con nuevos productos y fundar otro puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Juan currently lives with his mother. He is single and does not have any children. He works selling basic grains (corn and beans), which he has been doing for 2 years. He learned this with the help of his father. He works from eight in the morning to five in the afternoon. He began with little product, and he has increased the quantity of his product, as well as the number of customers.

He decided to work with loans to buy corn, beans, and three silos to store the grains. The purpose of the investment is to meet seasonal demands, and have more income for the repayment of debt.

The dreams that he has are to grow his business with new products, and fund another location for his sales.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and three silos to store grains. The purpose of the investment is to be able to meet seasonal needs.

loans.name: Ascension

texts.es:
Ascensión, es una persona dedicada a sembrar maíz y frijol, trabaja de manera independiente con un horario de seis de la mañana dos de la tarde, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 30 años, vive con su esposa e hijos, la familia es dependiente de Ascensión y no cuentan con apoyo de sus parientes.
El crédito que ha solicitado lo invertirá específicamente en insumos agrícolas y en el pago del arrendamiento del terreno en que sembrará, le será de ayuda para cuidar mejor sus cultivos y tener una cosecha abundante, espera que sus ganancias incrementen.
Sus sueños son remodelar su vivienda y respaldar económicamente a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ascensión is a person who works growing corn and beans. He works independently with the schedule of six in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. This is an activity that he has been doing for more than 30 years. He lives with his wife and children. The family depends on Ascensión, and do not receive support from relatives.

The loan that he has requested will be invested specifically in agricultural supplies, and for rent payment for the land which he will plant on. This will allow him to better care for his crops and have an abundant harvest. He hopes that his earnings increase.

His dreams are to remodel his home and support his children financially, so they can study in a university.

loans.use: he will invest specifically in agricultural supplies, and for rent payment for land which he will plant on. This will allow him to better care for his crops.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias, de 43 años de edad, es padre de cuatro hijos, los cuales están estudiando, tres en la escuela de la comunidad y su hija mayor estudia en la universidad, está casado y junto a su esposa hacen un gran esfuerzo para seguir adelante y a poyar a sus hijos y ella vende pupusas en la comunidad.

Elias, trabaja en estructuras metálicas desde que tenía 19 años de edad, un amigo le enseño en donde el estuvo trabajando por mucho tiempo, ahora tiene su propio taller en donde hace puertas, balcones, portones, techos y otros.- Además trabaja en la agricultura, siembra maíz y de frijoles, actualmente tiene 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y cuatro tareas de frijoles en la comunidad..

Elias, necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su taller y también necesita para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz.- Así logrará buenas cosechas que le permitan asegurar la alimentación para su familia.

Elias, sueña con hacer su casa de adobe, porque en la que actualmente vive es de bahareque y el sueña con darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.-
texts.en:
Elias, 43 years old, is a father of four children. All of his children are in school: three are in the community school, and his eldest daughter is in college. Elias is married, and along with his wife he makes a strong effort to move forward and help their children. His wife sells pupusas (Salvadoran snacks) in the community.

Elias has been working with metal structures since he was 19 years old. A friend taught him where he had been working for a long time. Now, he has his own workshop where he makes doors, balconies, gates, roofs and other things. In addition, he works in agriculture. He plants corn and beans. Currently, he has 3,500 square meters of corn and four plots of land with beans in his community.

Elias needs the loan to purchase tools for his workshop, and he also needs the loan to buy fertilizers for his corn crops. That way, he will achieve good harvests that allow him to assure that his family is fed.

Elias dreams to make his house with adobe, because the one that he currently lives in is made of straw and mud. He dreams to provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for his workshop, and he also needs the loan to buy fertilizers for corn crops.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem  is 40 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 4 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 35000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Gülşen

texts.en:
Gülşen is divorced and living with her son. Half of her days she works at a hospital and the rest of the days she makes Turkish ravioli (mantı) at home, sells them and makes money. She has used a loan for two times before.

With the help of her first loan she bought bulk mantı ingredients and sold her mantı. With the help of the second loan she bought bulk of flour, oil, butter and meat. She is planning to make and sell more mantı and wants to expand her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Gülşen hanım eşinden ayrı bir oğlu ile beraber yaşıyor. Gününün yarısını hastane çalışarak geçiriyor. Günün diğer kalan yarısı ile evde mantı yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. İki kez mikro kredi kullandı, ilk kredi ile mantı malzemelerini toptan aldı üretti ve sattı. İkinci mikro kredi ile de mantı malzemelerini (un, yağ, et) toptan alarak üreterek satmayı ve işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make mantı (Turkish ravioli)

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en: Azucena is a woman in her late 30s. She has been married to her loving husband for 20 years. She hasn't been able to have kids, but she hasn't lost hope. His husband provides as much as possible for the household expenses and she contributes by running a small convenience store that she owns. That store is her biggest accomplishment because she started from nothing; she made it grow and attracted clients. Now her store has big soda refrigerators and showcases for milk derivates. Her store is growing fast, and she has been struggling to meet the client demand so she is asking for a 5,000 MXN loan to buy more products like meat, ham, cheese, sodas, candies and groceries. She dreams that someday she may buy a van for the store logistics. Kubo knows she is going to succeed because of her determination and will to grow.

loans.use: to expand her stock

loans.name: Mwanzia

texts.en:
Mwanzia is a married man with 1 child. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman, with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. Her business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, clothes.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila, is 46 years old, a married woman, who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it and then is selling it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. Her son also assists her in doing this business.

For the improvement of her business, Shakila has requested a loan of 50000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 35 years old and a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.en:
Jose is a 20-year-old lad. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been working for seven years. At first, he worked at his parents' food business as a cooker or as a waiter. He started to save money and four years later, he started his own fruit stand, in which he has been working for the last three years. He has been improving the business with the collaboration of Kiva and Kubo, and now he is asking for a 10,000 MXN to restock his fruits and groceries. He is also looking to help his parents' business with short term investment.

This is his third loan with Kiva and Kubo; he paid for the two previous loans on time, and claims that those loans made his dream of econimic independence possible.

loans.use: to stock his fruit-selling business with seasonal produce

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en: Sern’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Sern works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a construction worker, seller and tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une veuve femme  avec deux enfants à charge habitant à Tokoin. Agée de 60 ans, Afi est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route et à domicile. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des balles de draps et de rideaux  en vue de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation et supporté les charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Afi is sixty years old, a widow and has two children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells second-hand linen items. She buys her stock once a month from the market and sells it at the roadside and from her home.

Afi has requested this loan to increase her stock levels and maximise her profits. She will buy bundles of sheets and curtains to meet the demands of her customers. Her earnings will support her children in their education and pay for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 bundles of sheets and 2 bundles of curtains.

loans.name: Essénam

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Essenam est une femme célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Pour exercer ses activités, Essenam vit à Tokoin et vend des casseroles, soutiens et des objets en plastiques en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Essenam s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des douzaines de casseroles, de soutiens et des caleçons, Essenam demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver un gain nécessaire pour aider son enfant à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Essenam is twenty-seven years old, single and mother to one child. She lives and works in Tokoin where she sells pans, underwear and plastic items. She makes her sales on foot in the local neighbourhoods. Four times a month she buys new supplies from the market.

Essenam is requesting this loan to buy dozens of casserole pots, bras and underpants. Her resulting profits will help improve the living conditions of her child and provide a good education.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen casserole pots, 10 dozen pairs of underpants and 9 dozen bras.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Ablavi est une veuve femme âgée de 78 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de huit enfants, Ablavi est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires et des céréales qu’elle revend à domicile dans sa boutique. Ablavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de farines de manioc, des bols de sucre et des bols d’arachides.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ablavi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ablavi is seventy-eight years old, widowed and mother to eight children. She lives in Tokoin and sells food products and cereals from the shop in her home. She buys new supplies twice a month from the market.

Ablavi is requesting this loan to buy sacks of cassava flour, bowls of sugar and bowls of peanuts. Her earnings will help her improve the look of her shop, offer a higher standard of living to her family and educate the children.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of cassava flour, 3 bowls of sugar and 4 bowls of peanuts.

loans.name: Afi Marie-Claire

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Afi est une marchande des céréales qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et des bols du haricot. Afi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en:
Afi is forty-two years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells cereals. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and sells them from the front of her house.

Afi is requesting this loan to buy sacks of maize and bowls of beans. Her resulting earnings will provide for the needs of her family and better cover the schooling costs of her children in this coming academic year.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize and 30 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Mitaaba Group

texts.fr:
Abibou, est une femme âgée de 40 ans, mariée mère d'1 enfant scolarisé.

Elle exerce son activité depuis 18 ans dans la restauration. 

Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamisme, son courage, sa bonne relation envers ses clients, elle tient son restaurant propre, son fort c'est la diversifications de ses repas. 

Elle veut le prêt pour acheter les gros plats thermostats pour conserver ses repas toujours chauds. à 800 000 frs. 

L'utilité du prêt de s'acquérir des thermostats pour garder toujours son repas chauds jusqu'à un certain temps. 

Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 4 fois et à rembourser à ACFIME aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Abibou is forty years old, married and mother to one school child. She has been working in the restaurant business for eighteen years. Her success is due to her dynamism, her courage, her excellent customer relations, the cleanliness of her restaurant and the wide variety of food which she offers.

Abibou is requesting this loan to buy thermostatically controlled heating plates to keep her food hot. These will cost 800,000 francs CFA. Abibou has already had four loans from the field partner, ACFIME, and they have always been repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy thermostatically controlled heating plates to keep her restaurant food hot.
